We’re looking for a dedicated and compassionate Behavior Interventionist (BI)/Behavioral Technician (BT) to join our clinical team. Behavioral Technicians (BT) are responsible for assisting Clinical Managers (BCBA) with treatment plans designed specifically toward strengthening or reducing clients behaviors that may be impairing their daily life activities.

A Behavioral Technicians responsibilities include helping clients who struggle with a variety of behavioral and learning challenges. Under the direction of the Clinical Manager (BCBA) and Program Supervisor (PS) the ideal candidate will help children and preteens with autism and other developmental disabilities increase positive behaviors and decrease behaviors that affect learning or that are a risk to safety. We are looking for someone who can help our clients engage in appropriate communication and play, while increasing individualized skills and reducing problem behavior.

Responsibilities

Provide 1:1 direct service with children and preteens in the home

· Follow individualized client programs

Collect and record data on client’s behavior each session

· Communicate effectively with Clinical Manager and Program Supervisor

Provide crisis intervention as needed
Provide a safe and supportive environment for clients and their family
Commit to a regular schedule

· Maintain client confidentiality

WHAT WE OFFER

Guaranteed 20 hours if available Mon-Fri between hours 3pm and 7pm.
Guaranteed 15 hours if available between 3pm and 7pm 4 days a week.
BCBA Supervision
Supportive team-based work environment
Tuition reimbursement
Mileage reimbursement between clients
Professional Development
Free Mental Health Counseling sessions for you and your family

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Education, Experience & Training Equivalent to:

High School diploma or equivalent required
Relevant experience preferred (Paraprofessional, Caregiver, Babysitter, Daycare Worker, Case Manager)
RBT Certification preferred
Ability to utilize an iPhone, iPad, and laptop

CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT

Ability to obtain and maintain criminal record clearance through the Department of Justice. The People & Performance department must analyze DOJ/FBI live scan reports in accordance with applicable federal, State, and local laws as well as fitness for position.
Must have valid California Driver's License and maintain a clean driving record.
Must pass health screenings, obtain vaccinations, and clear TB testing based on company policies.
Ability to obtain and maintain CPR certificate.
Ability to obtain and maintain clearance through the Office of Inspector General.
Ability to obtain RBT Certification within 90 days of hire and maintain active certification status.
Ability to obtain and maintain a National Provider Identifier (NPI).
Covid-19 vaccination and subsequent boosters required.

As Northern California’s premier home and community-based services organization, we’re committed to making care delivery easier for those with autism, other developmental disabilities, and their families. The Special Education Teacher leads the classroom team in educating all students on California Core Content Standards, NCSC Core Content Connectors, leads the development and implementation of student Individual Education Plans and supports students in learning functional, developmentally appropriate life skills. The Teacher also acts as the student’s case manager to coordinate all related service providers, parents/guardians, school district personnel and other providers in providing exemplary special education services.

Provide high-quality education to special education students, using the least restrictive supports necessary for the student to make meaningful progress.
Serve as the Special Education Teacher on the Individual Education Plan (IEP) team for all assigned students and implement and oversee all aspects of the student’s adopted IEP.
Lead a team of paraprofessionals in all aspects of individual student plans, TCS programming, professional development, and campus activities.
Be active in maintaining the efficacy and integrity of the organization within its goals/philosophy and strive to maintain the philosophy and mission of the program to the highest capacity.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

Plan, implement, and manage high quality, standards-based education for students.
Develop and provide an exemplary special education program to assigned students.
Teach students the necessary skills that will provide a solid foundation for an active, positive, healthy and independent adulthood.
Ensure data is consistently taken on IEP goals and target behaviors. Data should be reviewed and analyzed regularly, making any necessary changes to the educational program in collaboration with and support of the student’s educational team.
Maintain active and regular communication between student's home and school using school systems in place such as Google groups, email and Google voice.

Assess, write and implement Individual Education Plans (IEP) and triennial assessments.

Write, develop, edit and implement IEPs, complete and edit Progress Reports, develop and/or complete assessments and other documents as assigned within the time frames as assigned.
Coordinate with the Principal, Program Specialist, and Related Service providers to ensure all parts to IEP documents are complete, aligned, and included.
Follow IEP recommendations, Behavior Intervention Plans (BIP), sensory integration plans, communication plans, and other individual student plans consistently and with fidelity and oversee and direct Teaching Assistants to do the same.
Ensure files, documents and paperwork are updated as needed, are confidential, and comply with all regulations as set forth by the CDE.

Support the social-emotional development, health and well being of students at all times.

Utilize developmentally based, research-supported techniques and therapies such as The Developmental, Individual Difference, Relationship-based (DIR®/Floortime™) Model and Naturalistic Developmental Behavioral Interventions (NDBI).
Support students using least restrictive prompts and scaffolds so as to maximize independent skill development.
Continually work to build a positive relationship and rapport with each assigned student by engaging in child led activities with the student, pairing with student preferred activities and items, and striving to establish a developmentally appropriate relationship where meaningful back and forth social interaction may occur.
Utilize restrictive practices such as restraint, seclusion, escape extinction, and planned punishment only as a last resort or as part of an IEP team approved, data driven, and supervised intervention.

Manage and supervise a team of Teaching Assistants (TA).

Lead Teaching Assistants in a collaborative, respectful manner that supports the learning and professional growth of each staff member.
In collaboration with the Principal, manage TA attendance through the online timesheet platform.
Provide constructive and honest feedback and written evaluations. Encourage feedback and ideas from all staff.
Assign tasks to classroom staff and organize classroom responsibilities in a proactive, respectful, and supportive manner.
Create daily staff/student schedules and ensure that all supervisees take appropriate breaks and lunches on time.
Ensure that Teaching Assistants receive and complete all required training/onboarding and professional development. Lead retraining as needed.

Participate on a multi-disciplinary team.

Actively participate in school-level planning, meetings/committees and other school system groups.
Work with administration, related service providers and classroom staff to facilitate a school program that allows students to meet IEP goals, developmental milestones, and personal fulfillment.
On a multi-disciplinary team, represent expertise in academics, functional academics, life skills, vocational skills, teaching strategy and pedagogy.
Communicate effectively and respectfully with parents, care providers, students, other staff members, administrative staff, the Board of Directors, district officials, and community members.
When needed, present problems, issues or concerns to the Principal, Executive Director or colleagues in a respectful, proactive, and solutions-focused manner.
Receive feedback and concerns in an equally respectful, proactive, and solutions-focused manner.

Act as a leader on campus and support the overall mission and philosophy of TCS.

Be active in maintaining the efficacy and integrity of the organization within the goals/philosophy of the organization; strive to maintain the philosophy, and mission of the program to the highest capacity.
Serve as a classroom leader and senior staff member in a collaborative team environment, lead classroom meetings, parent conferences, IEP meetings, and when appropriate, professional development sessions.

Manage all aspects of a classroom program including: budget, material and curriculum management, shared use of vehicles, and shared use of therapy spaces.

Manage an annual classroom budget and comply with all budget reporting requirements.
Maintain a clean, organized, safe and effective classroom and school environment; regularly collaborating with other staff members to create and maintain this.
Manage time and resources effectively and appropriately.

Cooperate with and follow all TCS and CDE policies and procedures.

Maintain the confidentiality of all students and families at all times.
Work with the Principal, Executive Director and Related Services to ensure the school program/classroom is adhering to all laws, regulations, and standards set forth by the California Department of Education.

Qualifications: License/Credential/Certification

Moderate/Severe Education Specialtist
Extensive Needs Education Specialist
Mild/Mod Education Specialist with Autism Authorization
Intern Credential (must be currently enrolled in a program with a Master Teacher)
Substitute Credential (can be placed for up to 60 days)
Cleared credential preferred

Education

Bachelor’s degree or higher in education, psychology or related field.

Experience

1 year experience as a lead teacher/educator in a classroom setting.
3 years experience working with those on the autism spectrum and/or working with students who are moderate to severely affected by a developmental disability in a professional setting.
1 year experience collaborating with other professionals on a student’s IEP team.
1 year experience completing and presenting lesson plans, formal and informal assessments, progress reports, and IEPs for students with special needs.

Skills and Competencies: Knowledge

Extensive understanding of typical and atypical development of children, a variety of behavioral strategies/theories, how to work with those with severe sensory and communicative challenges, and the unique and individual learning styles of those with developmental disabilities.
Be familiar with augmentative and alternative communication systems and working with students with limited vocal speech.
Be familiar working with students who have significant sensory processing/integration challenges.

Skills and Abilities

Proficient in Google Suite. Working knowledge of Word, Excel and PowerPoint.
People management skills, including managing employees and teams’ performance and providing feedback, delegation, and direction.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Flexibility and creativity to adapt and/or modify activities/curriculum to engage and teach each individual despite challenges.
Be open to learning about and implementing new approaches used with children who have special needs through training, coaching sessions and conferences; be able to transfer new learning into practice.
Experienced in collecting quantitative and qualitative data, describing progress in measurable terms, have the ability to review and analyze data, and make program adjustments based on available data.
Have strong problem-solving skills with a solutions-focused approach to any issues as they arise with students, staff, parents, community members, etc.
Have good judgment, tact, and ability to maintain the highest level of professionalism as a leader, a model to other staff members, and a representative of the organization.
Have exemplary organizational skills, efficiency, and initiative in completing tasks within the timeframe as assigned while maintaining a high quality of work.
Ability to exercise leadership and collaborative skills effectively by taking ownership of responsibilities, maintaining positive rapport with others, guiding or learning from others.

Additional

Maintain calm and professional demeanor when dealing with difficult or emotional situations.
Be self-reflective and objective for the ultimate benefit of the students and school program, give and take feedback in a positive and supportive way.
Must consistently demonstrate the ability to be a self-initiator, creative and flexible to meet the needs of the organization and the individual learning styles of the children.

Physical Requirements

If applicable, working and playing with students at The Creekside School requires a considerable amount of strength and physical movement.Employees must be able to perform the following physical movement functions as needed:

Regularly

SITTING - Resting position in which the body weight is supported primarily by the buttocks in contact with the ground or a horizontal object such as a chair seat.
EXERT- up to 20 lbs. of force to move objects, equipment, and to work/play with students.
MOTOR SKILLS - Picking, pinching, or otherwise working primarily with fingers as in handling, typing, or writing.

Frequently

STANDING - Remaining upright on the feet, particularly for sustained periods of time.
WALKING/RUNNING - Moving about on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for long distances for community outings or moving from one classroom/office to another. Running is required for potential emergency situations.
REACHING - extending hand(s) and arm(s) in any direction.
EXERT - up to 40 lbs. of force to move objects, equipment, and to work/play with students.
HANDLING - Seizing, holding, grasping, turning, or otherwise working with hand or hands.

Occasionally

LIFTING - Up to 25 pounds. Raising objects from a lower to a higher position or moving objects horizontally from position to-position.
EXERT - up to 80 lbs. of force to move objects, equipment, and to work/play with students.
CLIMBING - Ascending or descending stairs, ramps, or hills using feet and legs
BALANCING - Maintaining body equilibrium to prevent falling
STOOPING - Bending body downward and forward.
KNEELING - Bending legs at knees to come to rest on knee(s).
CROUCHING - Bending body downward and forward by bending legs and spine.
CRAWLING - Moving about on hands and knees or hands and feet.
PUSHING - Using upper extremities to press against something with steady force in order to thrust forward, downward or outward.
PULLING - Using upper extremities to exert force in order to draw, drag, haul or tug objects in a sustained motion.

Important: A Creekside School student may exhibit behaviors such as aggression (e.g. biting, kicking, hitting), property destruction, self-injurious behavior, screaming, etc.Due to the potential safety risk for staff and students associated with working with those who may engage in behaviors of concern, all staff are required to be certified by Safety-Care by QBS to handle potentially dangerous situations and work to prevent crisis situations and/or hazards associated with those who engage in behaviors that pose a safety risk. Staff will not be allowed to perform any type of physical management unless they have received the initial Safety-Care training/certification through The Creekside School.

In the event that a student requires physical management because he/she poses a serious, imminent safety risk to him/herself and/or others, Safety-Care will be used as a last resort. This involves the use of safe, non-harmful control and restraint positions to safely control an individual until he/she can regain control of his/her behavior.

Terms of Employment

Employment at The Creekside School is based on mutual consent, and both the employee and The Creekside School have the right to terminate employment “at-will”, with or without cause or advance notice.

Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

ABOUT LA CHEIM

For nearly 50 years, La Cheim has built a robust continuum of care to help kids and adults that no one else could reach. We provide educational and mental health services throughout Alameda and Contra Costa County at our nonpublic schools, community mental health center, therapeutic behavioral services program, and residential treatment center.

Our uniqueness lies in the caliber and compassion of our team; teachers, Teacher Assistant (TA) School Counselors art therapists, counselors, psychiatrists, psychologists, RNs, Licensed Clinical Social Workers (LCSW), Marriage and Family Therapists (MFT). They are the ones who create life-changing experiences with the people they serve.

Team members experience La Cheim as being a member of a warm, family community. We enjoy rich benefits, valuable training and wellness opportunities, close support, and room to grow.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Special Education Teacher is responsible for providing multi-grade, differentiated instruction and academic interventions in response to identified areas of student strength, program parameters, and stated Individualized Education Program (IEP) goals. The teacher works with and guides the team to provide a clear consistent integrated academic/therapeutic environment for the classroom, ensuring that academic, social, and emotional needs of each student are met within the guidelines of the program, Ed Law, and the IEP.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Establish and support a safe, inclusive, therapeutic learning environment.
Present engaging, relevant, academic curriculum, using differentiation, and data driven planning.
Collaborate effectively as a member of a multi-disciplinary team to implement academic, behavioral, and therapeutic services for students in special education. The teacher will be supervising and working closely with the Teacher Assistant (TA) School Counselors regularly.
Implement and integrate La Cheim’s positive behavior intervention program across the milieu.
Interact and intervene guided by the principles of Trauma Informed Care across the milieu (training provided)
Perform all duties related to the development of an IEP: completing assessments, drafting goals, creating progress reports.
Lead/participate in school district IEP meetings.
Intervene using students' behavioral program as needed.
Assist with educational component of NPS Site Certification, yearly as required.
Respond to student crisis, including using verbal or physical intervention with students as necessary to ensure safety.
Complete all documentation with attention to detail, purpose, accuracy, and timelines.
Engage families/guardians/caregivers/student treatment teamin the educational process, providing frequent opportunities to discuss student growth and needs.
Guide and coordinate support staff duties.
Will supervise up to 4 Teacher Assistant (TA) School Counselors.
Will write daily notes in the appropriate billing and electronic health records.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Facilitate and/or participate in required meetings (classroom, site-wide and supervision)
Participate in professional learning communities and professional development as directed.
Complete all mandatory training(s), including through Relias, and ProAct.
Always maintain a high standard of professional behavior.
Take initiative to respond to program and student needs.
Other duties may be required as La Cheim continues its development. Employees are expected to be flexible and responsive to changes in the scope of duties.
Engage and participate in weekly staff meetings with multi-disciplinary team.
Available to talk to families/guardians/caregivers/student treatment team about students’ progress in class.
Generate and make available the School Accountability Report Card.
Fulfill duties of Test coordinator
Oversee completion of report cards, credit counts, and transcripts
Oversee quarterly updates of IEP goals and reporting as required.

QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Understand the process of Master Contracts and ISAs with districts and SELPAS.
Must hold a valid California Special Education Mild to Moderate Disabilities Credential
Intern Credential in Special Education program can be substituted for Special Education Credential
Experience in Special Education preferred.
Must possess a Valid California Driver’s License, and obtain TB, DOJ and FBI clearance.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The following is the extent of the specific activity required for this position:

Stairs – climbing stairs up to 50-100 – up to 2-4 hours, not continuously.
Sitting – up to 2 hours, not continuously; standing – up to 4 hours, not continuously
Walking – up to 2 hours, not continuously; bending over – up to 1 hour, not continuously.
Crawling – up to 0 hours; climbing – up to 0 hours, reaching overhead – up to a few minutes.
Crouching – up to ½ hour, not continuously; kneeling – up to a few minutes
Balancing – up to 0 hours; pushing or pulling – up to a few minutes.
Lifting or carrying – 25 pounds or less; repetitive use of feet – up to 0 hours
Repetitive use of hands – up to 0 hours
Grasping – with one or both, simple and firm, for up to 1 hour, not continuously
Fine dexterity - either hand up to 1 hour, not continuously Auditory and visual acuity – 8 hours within normal limits and maybe with glasses, contact lenses or hearing aids.
Driving cars and vans; Exposure to uneven concrete and blacktop
Exposure to normal dust, heat, and noise
Exposure to emotionally disturbed students who may be physically and verbally violent and require safe physical management.
Frequent exposure to office equipment.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

La Cheim School, Inc. is committed to diversity in its programming and in creating a staff reflective of the populations of the San Francisco Bay Area, and will not discriminate against applicants, employees, or unpaid veterans. We encourage and actively recruit applicants representing diversity of race, color, age, sex, race, religion, national origin, sex/gender expression and physical ability.

Interface Engineering is proud to announce our Collaboration from Home policy for this hybrid, work from home opportunity! Please follow the link to find out more: Interface Collaboration From Home

Interface Engineering recognizes the importance for employees to have a clear understanding of how to grow and promote within our organization. We provide a unique program with a roadmap and clear path for growth for our employees to understand how to advance and promote at Interface. Please follow the link to learn more: Pathway to Leadership

COME WORK WITH US!

Interface Engineering Inc., an internationally recognized leader in high performance design, is seeking to add a Senior ICT Designer to our Bay Area, CA team. Our team members have the freedom to define their own career path and evolve their role to play to their strengths. You will have the opportunity to quickly tackle new challenges and responsibilities, make an impact, and grow your role organically. Interface encourages everyone to come with questions and bring new ideas and solutions - we foster a culture of learning and growing. Our uniquely designed “Path to Leadership” offers clear cut means to advancement, measured in specific metrics and attributes - but our employees are supported in making their career path their own. We are successful collectively when our team members are empowered individually.

As a progressive multi-disciplined consultancy firm, we focus on innovative engineering solutions for high-performance projects. Our work demonstrates how creative collaboration produces outstanding results for our clients and communities.

This is a hybrid position. The incumbent Senior ICT Designer will usually work from home 3-4 days per week work in our office, or at a client site, 1-2 days per week.

Our Culture:
At Interface, we have the company culture and work environment that you have been seeking! You’ll find a workplace with a culture of fun, and superior work/life balance benefits, expansive personal development opportunities, cutting edge technology, and great relationships. You’ll work alongside MEP industry leaders who will help you develop your own thriving career path. Our work takes us around the globe and on a steady growth curve. Our success and innovation are powered by people like you!

Our Core Values:
Our core values capture the essence of who we are. We live and breathe them, and they inform everything we do. We are:

Conscientious.
Empowered.
Respectful.
Resilient.
Transformative.

What You Will be Doing:
As a Senior ICT Designer, you will assume a leadership role in various projects within our discipline. Your responsibilities will encompass a range of tasks, including but not limited to coordinating, specifying, drafting, and designing the following ICT systems:

Structured Cabling Systems (SCS)
Electronic Security Systems (ESS)
Audio Visual Systems (AVS)
Cellular Distributed Antenna Systems (DAS)
Emergency Responder Communication Enhancement Systems (ERCES)
Intercom and Two-Way Communication systems
Master Clocks (wired and wireless)
Nurse Call Systems
Paging Systems
Wi-Fi Systems

In this role, you will be instrumental in driving the success of these projects and ensuring the seamless integration of these systems.

Qualifications for Application:
We are seeking a highly qualified Senior ICT Designer with a minimum of 5 years of experience. The ideal candidate will be a proactive problem-solver and collaborative team player, possessing a strong background in the design of Information and Communications Technology (ICT) Systems. Key areas of expertise should include, but are not limited to:

AA/AS Degree or higher in a related field (or equivalent experience)
Telecommunications pathways and spaces
Layouts for Telecommunications Rooms
Cabling for both Inside and Outside plant
Assessment and design of Audiovisual systems, including controls and signal flow diagrams
Evaluation and design of Physical Security systems, encompassing both existing and new installations
Proficiency in various design phases (SD, DD, CD, CA, Closeout)

The successful candidate will demonstrate a proven history of delivering high-quality ICT designs and solutions.

Candidate Should be Experienced In:

We are seeking a candidate with a robust skill set and extensive experience in the following areas:

Proficiency in Revit and AutoCAD drafting
Expertise in responding to RFIs (Request for Information)
Ability to update drawings in alignment with architectural directives
Skill in editing Division 27 & 28 specifications to align with project design requirements
Experience in reviewing client-provided programming for integration into design
Proficient in conducting interviews with owner/client department personnel to outline design requirements
Capability to document meeting agendas and minutes
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proficiency in performing site visits for as-built condition documentation, due diligence reports, and site observation reports across various project phases
Demonstrated professional time management, including the ability to manage multiple ICT projects concurrently and meet deadlines and milestones with minimal oversight
Strong people skills, encompassing critical thinking, problem-solving, and thorough analysis
Actively involved in mentoring team members
Effective coordination with other disciplines, including Architectural, Civil, MEP, and Structural
Willingness and ability to travel occasionally for assigned projects

Candidate Should have a Working Knowledge of:

AVIXA/InfoComm Audio Visual Standards
ASIS International Electronic Security Systems Standards
BICSI TDMM
BICSI OSPDRM
TIA Standards
UL Standards
NEC Codes applicable to both, ICT systems and Life Safety

To Be Most Competitive for This Role, Preferred Qualifications Include:

RCDD, OSP, DCDC, and RTPM certifications
CTS-D and CTS-I certifications
PSP certification
Autodesk CAD Certification
Autodesk Revit Certification
Proficiency in Ekahau
Expertise in AutoCAD and Revit
Familiarity with Bluebeam
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite
Knowledge of Microsoft Teams and other electronic collaboration platforms
Experience with Newforma
Familiarity with SharePoint

Interface Benefits and Perks:

Highly competitive total compensation packages. The posted annual salary range for this position is $95,000 to $125,000.
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance. Interface pays 100% of employee only premium or 80% of the premium for employee and dependents.
Paid Time Off (PTO) – immediate accrual starts on your first day of work.
Paid Holidays – Nine (9) paid holidays per year.
More Time Off – All business days from Christmas to New Year’s Day.
401k Retirement Plan – With profit share matching based on compensation.
Life Insurance – Paid for up to two times (2x) your annual pay, up to $300k. You may purchase additional personal and family life insurance.
Long-term Disability Insurance – Interface pays 100% of the premium, beginning after six (6) months of employment.

…. And more!

Social Equity:
We are committed to social equity within our walls and out in our communities. We strive to be a diverse, inclusive, and responsible firm. It is our policy provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status or any other applicable federal or state-protected classification.

Further, we support local business and seek out small and minority owned firms to mentor and partner with on our projects. Staff are free to design programs to get us out to clean up beaches, serve meals at shelters, or teach school-aged kids about engineering – using paid volunteer time.

If you are seeking a challenging and rewarding role with an organization that provides a culture of safety, trust, commitment, and respect; look no further and apply now to become a member of the Interface Engineering team!

Job Title: Dean of Instruction

Location: Aurum Preparatory Academy, Oakland, CA.

Position Type: Full-Time On-Site

Reports To: Executive Director

About Aurum Preparatory Academy:

Aurum Preparatory Academy, located in Oakland, CA, is a dynamic and innovative charter school dedicated to providing a transformative educational experience. Committed to nurturing academic excellence, character development, and community engagement among a diverse student body, Aurum Prep offers an inclusive and supportive learning environment.

Position Overview:

Aurum Preparatory Academy is seeking a visionary Dean of Instruction to shape the school's academic program, ensure top-notch instruction, and foster a positive, inclusive learning atmosphere. The Dean of Instruction will serve as the educational leader for both staff and students, collaborating closely with the Executive Director. Responsibilities include overseeing instructional program development, staff leadership, and ensuring a high-quality educational environment meeting the diverse needs of all students. Additionally, the Dean of Instruction will provide leadership in coaching and managing the school’s teaching faculty.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Student Assessment and Monitoring:

Emphasizes student academic achievement as the primary outcome of schooling.
Systematically assesses and monitors student progress using objective and verifiable information.
Identifies and responds to at-risk students; makes referrals to appropriate community agencies.
Assists in training and supporting teachers and leaders in using student information and assessment systems.

Staff Instructional Leadership and Support:

Assists in staff classroom observations and instructional coaching, demonstrating proficiency in the process.
Contributes to recruiting, screening, hiring, training, and evaluating school personnel.
Helps maintain positive staff morale and provides orientation for newly assigned staff members.
Conducts data analysis alongside Site Director, preparing and delivering professional development related to data analysis and assessments.
Collects and analyzes survey data on the effectiveness of professional development sessions.

Assessment Coordination:

Coordinates statewide and school-wide assessments (e.g., MAP, SBAC, Benchmark Assessments).
Analyzes students’ work with teachers, brainstorming next steps for adjusting instruction.
Supports staff in using various programs such as online software and curriculum resources.

Professional Development:

Stays informed about changes in the profession through professional meetings, reading journals, and discussing mutual interests with colleagues.
Assumes responsibility for own professional growth, perceiving self as a change agent for self and organizational renewal.
Provides leadership in the development and innovation of educational programs, meeting diverse student needs.
Helps teachers set objectives for themselves and students, facilitating the sharing of successful practices.

Parent and Community Engagement:

Fosters positive relationships with parents and community members, promoting a collaborative educational environment.
Organizes and attends events engaging parents in their child's education.

Student Recruitment and Community Engagement:

Develops and executes student recruitment strategies to ensure a diverse and vibrant student body.
Engages with prospective families, providing information about the school's educational programs and benefits.
Fosters positive relationships with parents and community members, promoting a collaborative educational environment.
Organizes and attends events engaging parents in their child's education.
Attend marketing events (Saturday, Sunday, After School, etc.).

Administrative Duties:

Oversees scheduling, student assessments, and other administrative tasks related to instructional activities.
Collaborates with school leadership on strategic planning and vision development.

Qualifications:

Job Description

Construction Project Engineer

Ausonio Incorporated- Castroville, CA

Summary:

Ausonio is seeking a Construction Project Engineer to join our growing team covering multiple clients and projects throughout the greater Monterey area.

· The focus of this position is working with and through others, building and maintaining relationships, and working closely and accurately within established guidelines.

· There is a need for the ability to read plans and specifications, as well as strong analytical, communication, organization, and administrative skills.

· There will be many different people to meet and work with. The person in this position must be friendly and genuinely interested in the business, agenda, and needs of others, including the company, its management, the team, and the company's customers.

· Requires focus on the relationships with your coworkers, correct handling of project details, and a faster-than-average workflow.

· Detail work is a major focus of the job, and those details need to be handled quickly, correctly, and efficiently. This portion of the work will often focus on relationships with others; accuracy is necessary to maintain and grow relationships.

· As time is usually a factor, the work must be done on time, as well as correctly. In general, this is a position where guidelines, structure, and established policies must be followed closely, while communicating and cooperating effectively.

PRIMARY DUTIES:

· Assist Project Management: Assist in document control and processing to prepare preliminary lists of subcontractors and price quotations (Bids or RFCO’s), locate or research archived job information and/or plans, and transcribe meeting notes, punch lists, RFIs, etc.

· Competitively bid project pursuits: Meet with potential clients to understand long-range needs and upcoming opportunities. Review new postings and work with leadership team on go/no-go evaluation. Attend job walks, prepare takeoffs and self-perform pricing. Solicit, obtain, and review bids from trade partners. Assemble overall estimate and bid for leadership review. Submit bids in accordance with requirements.

· Project management: Cooperate with field and office teams to deliver the project on time and budget and ensure quality and safety goals are achieved.

o Assist in development of prequalification documentation

o Assist in promoting and enforcing Ausonio’s safety program

o Document project meetings with subcontractors and owners

o Ensure timely issuance and execution of subcontracts

o Oversee project closeout procedures

o Coordinate with and act in the interests of clients to resolve issues and ensure successful closeout and transition of project to end users.

· Contract administration: Understand all contract documents and oversee change management, closeout, and reporting.

· Client relations: Represent Ausonio in a professional manner as the liaison between the office and field, subcontractors, owners, architects, and engineers. Maintain ongoing positive relationship to achieve high client satisfaction and increase potential for additional business. Assist with business development and marketing initiatives as requested.

· Teamwork: support and receive support from other team members to resolve issues and maximize team success.

JOB CHARACTERISTICS

Successfully balancing varied activities across multiple, simultaneous projects in a fast-paced environment.
Customer-first attitude. Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to a range of different audiences. Dedication to building long-term business relationships.

· Expertise and skill in maintaining established standards of quality and accuracy. Utilizing established standards and procedures and developing innovative improvements.

· Initiative, determination and a self-disciplined approach to achieving results.

· Team environment: lead by example, using first-hand knowledge of area of expertise and input from team members to build consensus. Strong, friendly follow-up necessary on tasks delegated to ensure proper results.

· The work requires specialized technical problem solving and ingenuity while working within approved organizational systems and technology, and the demonstration of company values and culture.

Preferred Qualifications

· Bachelor’s degree in Construction Management, Engineering, Architecture, or equivalent training/experience in related fields

· Entry level commercial construction experience

· Demonstrated ability to set and achieve skill development goals and exceed client expectations

· Knowledge of modern construction management tools and software, including Procore, Sage, Bluebeam, and Microsoft Project

· Prior experience with budgets, purchasing, and accounting.

Do you love working with children and their families?
Is having a collaborative multi-disciplinary team important to you?

If so, we want to talk to you!

As a Pediatric Physical Therapist Assistant, you’ll work with children to improve their gait, mobility, strength, balance, and coordination.

Your responsibilities will include treatment, assisting in assessments and collaborating on customized physical therapy plans for your patients. Our clinic style is fully collaborative, meaning our therapists from all specialties work together to find the best approach for each child’s needs.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Degree in physical therapy
Valid California Physical Therapist license
At least 1 years’ experience providing pediatric physical therapy
Able to work collaboratively with a team of like-minded professionals
Love working with children
Preferred: current member of the American Physical Therapy Association (APTA)

JOB TYPE

Full-time, part-time

Monday – Friday 8:00 am – 7:00 pm

Optional: Saturday 8:00 am – 5:00 pm

BENEFITS OFFERED TO OUR STAFF

Generous PTO
Monthly bonuses
Flexible scheduling
401(k) matching
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance
Quarterly dinners / Happy Hour
Coffee and snacks in breakroom

ABOUT OUR CLINIC

Joy & Laughter Developmental Therapy was founded in 2012 to empower therapists, parents, and children to work together to reach the highest outcomes. We saw firsthand how other pediatric therapy clinics were run: with a lack of communication between staff and limited options for parents. We decided that we could do it better, and we have! Not only do we encourage parents to be intimately involved with their child’s therapy, but we also foster a collaborative environment for our team to truly make a difference. When our amazing team works together, we help children blossom!

WHAT WE BELIEVE IN

Collaboration – When we work together and brainstorm the best approach to a child’s therapy, we can provide exceptional service for the children in our care.
Communication – We are successful because our administrative staff, therapists, volunteers, and team leaders understand that communication is key to effective therapy and a good company culture.

About Effective School Solutions: Effective School Solutions (ESS) is one of the country’s leading providers in school-based mental health services for K-12 students. Serving over 2,000 students across nine states in the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, and the West Coast regions, our company was founded based on the concept of offering the types of higher acuity clinical care that students would normally receive in a private practice or private school setting within the public-school building. In response to the strong uptick in mental health challenges for young people over the past decade, the company has expanded its services to offer a wider range of programming options, as well as professional development and consultative solutions for districts.

About the role: Effective School Solutions is currently seeking an ASW, AMFT, APCC, LMFT, LCSW, or LPCC for our ASD Program in Mountain View.The selected candidate must possess a specialty in working with elementary and middle school students on the Autism Spectrum and will be responsible for providing clinical services to a small group of selected students who exhibit significant behavioral, developmental, and emotional concerns related to their Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Selected candidates will work with a highly seasoned and professional management team who provide the best possible clinical services. This position will include extensive training to ensure that the chosen individual will have a strong knowledge of the organization's protocols and model of services.

Clinical Responsibilities:

Delivers clinical interventions consistent with needs of the student and family, in a safe and ethical manner that promote and sustain academic and mental health stability.
Demonstrates competency in: Group Therapy, Individual Counseling, and Family Counseling.
Provides family programming with monthly evening Parent Support groups, as needed.
Understands continuum of mental health services, referring students and family to an appropriate level of care in coordination with their supervisor (such as: substance abuse services and/or IOP/PHP/In-Patient)
Provides consultation and facilitates referrals to appropriate levels of care and specialized services based on the student's needs.
Optimizes the collaboration and coordination of the interdisciplinary team to enhance the environment of student care.
Demonstrates a commitment to developing strong working relationships with school administration, district leadership, teachers, and paraprofessionals.

Administrative Responsibilities:

Submits Clinical Documentation in a timely manner, aligned with the electronic medical record.
Participates in all team meetings including but not limited to: Administrative School Meetings, ESS Town Hall meetings, ESS Supervision Meetings and Treatment Team meetings.
Maintains current professional license and adheres to ethical standards in accordance with governing board.
Consistently attends work on scheduled day and time, in professional attire and with a professional demeanor.
Participates in learning opportunities provided by ESS, such as Supervision Groups, and treatment planning, that will advance knowledge of clinical interventions and skills throughout the school year.

Qualifications and Skills

Must have 2+ years of experience treating children and/or adolescents with significant behavioral and emotional challenges.
2+ years treating individuals on the Autism Spectrum preferred.
Must have a minimum active associate number ASW, APCC or AMFT.
A clinical license in LCSW, LPCC, or LMFT.
Effective problem solving and communication skills.
Experience working with students and families, plus community health and social service agencies.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office and comfortable using a computer.
Must be able to complete thorough clinical documentation.

Why join Effective School Solutions?

ESS is focused on addressing one of the biggest challenges our country is facing - - the mental health of our youth.
ESS is a dynamic organization with a strong record of accomplishment of innovation and growth.
ESS provides staff with excellent career growth opportunities.
ESS provides extensive time off tied to the school calendar, with limited summer hours. ESS prioritizes and gives value to a clinician’s work-life balance.
ESS offers staff competitive compensation and benefits offerings.
ESS values clinician voice and perspective and has multiple methods to give feedback and input on company decisions.

ESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Fay is increasing access to affordable medical nutrition therapy. Over 150 million Americans need the help of a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist, but many of them can't find one that accepts insurance. As a result, most people end up paying out of their own pocket or do not seek help at all. Fay is empowering dietitians to accept insurance and connecting RD's with patients who are eager to get the care they need.

We've are supported by the best names in health and medicine: Harvard University, Blue Cross Blue Shield, United Healthcare, and Cigna. If you are a Registered Dietitian that already has a private practice or is looking to make extra income in addition to your current job, then we can help you with the following:

New client referrals: grow your clientele and book of business by getting connected with patients from our referral partnerships
Get in-network with insurance: we credential you with major insurance plans and we do it for free
Billing & admin: we know billing to insurance is a pain, so we do it for you and guarantee you get paid
Technology: we can provide HIPAA compliant technology so you can meet your clients in a virtual environment and stay in compliance with insurance companies
Patient education materials: feel free to use our library of handouts or bring your own
Flexibility: you can see as little as one client through Fay. We have no minimums or required number of visits per month.

All you need to provide is:

Proof you are a Registered Dietitian, certified by the Commission on Dietetic Registration
Professional Liability insurance (we can help you obtain this if you do not have it)

We're working with many different types of dietitians at different stages in their career. We're happy to help you grow your existing private practice or help you make additional income outside of your current job. Please feel welcome to apply no matter where you are on your journey. We are excited to meet you and empower you!

Sandis is about reliability, experience, and expertise. For over 55 years, we have been committed to innovation, excellence, leadership, and environmental stewardship. Our job and passion are to provide the foundation for the future to be built upon, always improving the communities where we live, work, and play. We service private and public clients in the high-tech, research and redevelopment, laboratory, corporate, commercial, residential, healthcare, academic, hospitality, civic, justice, and public works sectors. We are a team of experts who care about the people we work with and for.

Sandis is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

General Responsibilities:
Perform inspection on large, complex and diverse projects requiring expertise and knowledge in multiple areas of construction inspection and oversee the work of other testing and inspection personnel.

Communicates information to Project Manager and other personnel as directed by the Project Manager.

Coordinate pre-dispatch activities with Project, Department, and/or Office Managers.

Lead, provide direction and may coordinate activities of lower level inspectors.

Follow safety rules and practices and other safety requirements for all projects. Performs pre-task planning prior to executing work. Report any safety issues or concerns to management.
Be responsible for maintaining quality standards on all projects.

Requirements:

High school diploma or equivalent.

Valid driver’s license with acceptable violation history.

As a Pediatric Occupational Therapist, you’ll work with children to improve their fine and gross motor skills, emotional regulation, sensory processing, and independence.

Your responsibilities will include giving treatments, assessments and creating customized occupational therapy plans for your patients. Our clinic style is fully collaborative, meaning our therapists from all specialties work together to find the best approach for each child’s needs.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Master’s degree in occupational therapy
Valid California Occupational Therapist license
At least 3 years’ experience administering pediatric occupational therapy preferred
Able to work collaboratively with a team of like-minded professionals
Love working with children
Preferred: current member of the American Occupational Therapy Association (AOTA) or the Occupational Therapy Association of California (OTAC)

JOB TYPE

Full-time, part-time

Monday – Friday 8:00 am – 7:00 pm

Saturday 8:00 am – 5:00 pm

SALARY

$80,000 – $120,000 per year

BENEFITS OFFERED TO OUR STAFF

Generous PTO
Monthly bonuses
Flexible scheduling
401(k) matching
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance
Quarterly dinners / Happy Hour
Coffee and snacks in breakroom

ABOUT OUR CLINIC

Joy & Laughter Developmental Therapy was founded in 2012 to empower therapists, parents, and children to work together to reach the highest outcomes. We saw firsthand how other pediatric therapy clinics were run: with a lack of communication between staff and limited options for parents. We decided that we could do it better, and we have! Not only do we encourage parents to be intimately involved with their child’s therapy, but we also foster a collaborative environment for our team to truly make a difference. When our amazing team works together, we help children blossom!

WHAT WE BELIEVE IN

Collaboration – When we work together and brainstorm the best approach to a child’s therapy, we can provide exceptional service for the children in our care.
Communication – We are successful because our administrative staff, therapists, volunteers, and team leaders understand that communication is key to effective therapy and a good company culture.
Compassion – Our close-knit team is full of dedicated professionals who truly want to help children and their families achieve their developmental goals.

CONTACT US

San Geronimo Childcare Center, tucked in the rolling hills of West Marin, has been a hidden gem for 60 years. We are a small, friendly, play-based preschool, educating and nurturing children 18 months to 6 years. A Louis Torelli-designed facility, the school comprises both indoor and outdoor learning spaces, and boasts a dedicated staff of experienced teachers.

We are seeking a warm, experienced, personable director to help guide the school through the rapid changes in the world of early childhood education. Highly valued attributes include strong leadership, the ability to communicate clearly and openly with all members of the school community, and financial acumen.

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum: 12 ECE units-Core, 3 Admin ECE units, 4 year’s experience in the classroom. Maximum: BA or MA Degree, 24 ECE units, 8 ECE Admin units, 5 years’ experience in the classroom and 3 years’ experience in Administration, Program Director Permit.

· All applicable certifications, including CPR, 1st Aid, negative TB test, Fingerprinting and Child Abuse Index Check, and up-to-date vaccination records. Physically able to lift to 40 pounds.

RESPONSIBILITIES

· Administration. Keep the school in conformation with all health, safety, and licensing regulations. Keep all school records, attend and present enrollment and other informational reports to the board. Possess up-to-date technology skills for newsletters, billing, spreadsheets, website maintenance, and social media presence.

· Fiscal. Prepare the annual budget and monthly financial statements. Ensure accurate and timely billing and paycheck procedures.

· Staff. Hire, evaluate, and support teachers: provide consistent and open communication, and show follow-through on concerns and issues. Schedule staff meetings, periodic in-service training, and model respectful and sensitive personal interactions. Substitute in the classroom if necessary.

· Enrollment. Be proactive in efforts to keep the school fully enrolled, through advertising and public relations efforts. Meet with parents, providing tours and information. Implement plans to increase diversity among the school’s families.

· Parents. Maintain open, effective, timely and positive communications in all interactions, keeping the school community informed of policies and procedures. Support the teachers in conducting annual parent/teacher conferences, and work with parents concerning any special needs.

· Health and Safety. Arrange for custodial care and maintenance, indoors and out. Maintain a health and safety program and keep up-to-date health history records for children and staff.

· Children’s Program. Provide leadership to teachers in developing, delivering, and evaluating a high-quality, age-appropriate curriculum that reflects best practices in early childhood education. Establish and model child guidance procedures that encourage child self-regulation and social-emotional health.

· Community Relations. Provide a welcoming and professional presence for visitors and the community, demonstrating support for early childhood education and family life. Develop and maintain a collaborative relationship with the local school district, and other local child-centered organizations.

JOB DETAILS

This is a full-time, exempt position, Monday-Friday, with occasional Saturday events. Salary is $65,000-$70,000, commensurate with experience and education. Benefits include 401K with employer match, vision and dental insurance, $200/month pre-tax phone allowance, paid vacation and holidays, and generous paid time off during school breaks.

If early childhood education is your passion, and you want to work in a warm, intimate, low-key environment, please apply. We look forward to finding the perfect match for our school.

About Hogan Land Services:

Hogan Land Services is a full-service Engineering, Surveying, and Planning company serving all of California. We started with a strong desire to bring together the various disciplines required to "Get the Permit" from Local Agencies. We specialize in Civil & Structural Engineering, Septic, Surveying, Building Design, Planning, and Permit Assistance, all with the common purpose of assisting our clients achieve their development goals. As a member of the Hogan Land Services family, you would be a part of a very special team that strives to serve our clients with the utmost professionalism, providing prompt and cost-effective solutions to our client's development goals.

Hogan Land Services proudly serves California from 3 locations: Santa Rosa, Santa Cruz, and Livermore. We are a well-established Professional Engineering & Land Surveying firm, and we are seeking a Licensed Professional Civil Engineer.

We offer a competitive benefits package including health benefits, retirement plan, paid holidays, and alternative work schedules.

As a Licensed Professional Civil Engineer, you will provide general direction to your team while performing complex drafting assignments that require the application of Engineering design, drafting techniques, and computer-aided design (CAD) software. Create detailed drawings for engineering projects, layouts, sketches, maps, and graphic representations of engineering designs as the Licensed Professional. Work with your team to complete complex and detailed hydrology calculations based on the completed grading & drainage design plans as the Licensed Professional, as well as address plan check comments from the reviewing agency, plan revisions requested by the client and/or the contractor and responding to project related inquiries and receiving phone calls to discuss the design.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Perform Engineering and design services as the Licensed Professional and provide guidance to team members
Demonstrate knowledge and ability to prepare Civil packages including grading & drainage designs of driveways, building pads, and erosion & sediment control plans
Perform complex Hydrology calculations and Hydraulic evaluation of proposed drainage features for permit submission
Use AutoCAD Civil 3D to prepare Civil Design Drawings
Discuss potential new projects with prospective clients and author professional service agreements for Civil Engineering Related services
Coordinate with other members of the project design team including colleagues, Clients, Architects, Project Team Contractors, Owners, and Designers to coordinate civil design
Perform on-site evaluations, construction observation and inspections, and project site reviews related to Civil Engineering projects
Receive and address client, consultant and contractor calls
Communicating with Architects, Engineers, Contractors, and other parties involved in the design process
Site visits both prior to and after the grading design is completed to observe existing field conditions and to confirm general conformance with the approved plans to provide a Final Letter.

Required Skills and Abilities:

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, etc.), Outlook, and use of Engineering software (Auto Cad, Civil 3d, Blue Beam, etc.)
Application of Engineering principles including critical thinking, analysis, and innovative techniques

A Mental Health Clinic for Today’s Families

Leiya is an innovative approach to pediatric mental health care that creates one place where families can go when children are struggling. By streamlining access to care, integrating a multidisciplinary approach, training unlicensed providers, emphasizing early detection and preventative care, and providing transparency in cost, we are committed to transforming pediatric mental health care. Our vision is to modernize the care-model and provide the highest quality, community-based, mental health treatments to children and families.

Job Title: Educational Therapist

Employment Status: Full- Time/Salary Exempt

Compensation Range: $115,000-$135,000

Job Overview: The Educational Therapist at Leiya participates in multidisciplinary collaborative assessment, treatment, and intervention for students up to the age of 18 and their families.

Responsibilities and Duties:

● Collaborates with treating primary care providers, psychiatric and allied health professional team members to plan and direct each individual patient treatment program.

● Creates and implements treatment plans that include interventions to meet the educational and learning needs of the patient/family.

● Participates in staff conferences to select, plan, and evaluate treatment programs.
● Consults with medical, nursing, and psychiatric staff regarding diagnosis, strengths, and deficits as determined by psychological and neuropsychological assessment and evaluation.

● Instructs and counsels patients and their families regarding compliance with prescribed therapy regimens within the scope of the educational therapy practice.

● Collaborates with school staff, IEP meetings, and other members of the patient’s academic team to advocate for patients educational growth.

● Prepares intake summaries, treatment plans, and case summaries; maintains ongoing confidential records.

● Charts patients’ treatment and progress in accordance with state, federal, and facility regulations and guidelines and in keeping with accepted community standards.

● Utilizes resources of public and private agencies and community organizations to meet the needs of patients.

● Performs other related duties as assigned by the Leadership Team.

Qualifications and Requirements:

● MA in educational therapy or higher.
● Board Certified Educational Therapist.
● Certification or competence in a variety of programs and methodologies including:

Orton-Gillingham, SMARTS-EF, Social Thinking, Handwriting without tears, Wilson
Reading Systems and others.

● Able to work collaboratively with multiple health professionals in a busy and complex environment using tact, diplomacy, and discipline.

● Strong charting/documentation skills.
● Ability to effectively communicate with people at all levels and from various backgrounds.
● Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand the primary language(s) used in the workplace.
● Bilingual skills are a plus.
● Good judgment with the ability to make timely and sound decisions.
● Strong organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
● Ability to manage priorities and work flow.
● Versatility, flexibility, and a willingness to work within constantly changing priorities with enthusiasm.

Work Environment:

● This position requires an approximate breakdown of hours per week:

23 Clinical Hours
10 Administrative Hours (can be done remotely)
7 Professional development hours (can be hybrid)

● Dedicated hours for team cross - collaboration
● Weekly professional development hours are set aside for CEUs, mentorships, in-house interest groups, and multidisciplinary collaboration.
● Continually required to sit, be on the phone, and use a computer
● This job operates in an open office environment with some level of noise

Benefits:

Competitive benefit package, including:
● Health Benefit Contribution
● Paid Time Off + Company Paid Holidays
● Additional time off for bereavement, jury duty, parental leave & volunteer time
● Wellness program, educational assistance, childcare reimbursement
● Continuing education hours

We are currently seeking a qualified therapist to join our growing team with the expectation that you would provide in person and/or online therapy. This position is part time , but in may move towards full time as caseload increases.

Job Description

The clinical therapist will provide individual, family, child/adolescent, and/or couples therapy to clients of Relucent Psychology Group. Treatment specialties preferred include working with individuals with diverse backgrounds, trauma, experience in working with LGBTQ+ populations, couples counseling, ability to work with high functioning individuals, and anxiety and depression management with individual adults.

Minimum Qualification Requirements:

Master’s Degree or Doctoral Degree in counseling or clinical psychology. PhD’s, PsyD’s, LMFT’s, LPCC’s, LCSW’s are welcome to apply.

Passionate about the field of psychotherapy and helping others.

Trauma-informed, psychodynamic, EMDR, CBT, PCIT, Gottman and/or EFT-trained/certified a strong plus.
Compassionate, personable, hard-working, team-oriented, and reliable.

8. Attend mandatory staff meetings and training as directed by Relucent Psychology Group.

9. Be respectful of and cooperative and collaborative with co-workers.

About the role: Effective School Solutions is currently seeking a School-Based Therapist to join our team. We are looking for experienced, mission-aligned clinicians to provide clinical services to a small group of selected students with significant behavioral and emotional needs to specific districts as needed. Selected candidates will work with a highly seasoned and professional management team who provide the best possible clinical services. This position will include extensive training to ensure that the chosen individual will have a strong knowledge of the organization's protocols and model of services.
In this position, the clinician will have a school identified as their home school in a District near their home, but the Clinician will travel as needed to surrounding districts in the posting area and surrounding district locations.
Clinical Responsibilities:

Delivers clinical interventions consistent with needs of the student and family, in a safe and ethical manner that promote and sustain academic and mental health stability.
Demonstrates competency in: Group Therapy, Individual Counseling, and Family Counseling.
Provides family programming with monthly evening Parent Support groups, as needed.
Understands continuum of mental health services, referring students and family to an appropriate level of care in coordination with their supervisor (such as: substance abuse services and/or IOP/PHP/In-Patient)
Optimizes the collaboration and coordination of the interdisciplinary team to enhance the environment of student care.
Demonstrates a commitment to developing strong working relationships with school administration, district leadership, teachers, and paraprofessionals.

Administrative Responsibilities:

Submits Clinical Documentation in a timely manner, aligned with the electronic medical record.
Participates in all team meetings including but not limited to: Administrative School Meetings, ESS Town Hall meetings, ESS Supervision Meetings and Treatment Team meetings.
Maintains current professional license and adheres to ethical standards in accordance with governing board.
Consistently attends work on scheduled day and time, in professional attire and with a professional demeanor.
Participates in learning opportunities provided by ESS, such as Supervision Groups, and treatment planning, that will advance knowledge of clinical interventions and skills throughout the school year.

Qualifications and Skills

Must be willing to travel between numerous districts in their assigned area.
Must have 2+ years of experience treating children and/or adolescents with significant behavioral and emotional challenges.
Must have a minimum active associate number (ASW, AMFT, APCC).
A clinical license in LCSW, LMFT, LPCC or related licensure in the state in which this position is being offered is preferred.
Effective problem solving and communication skills.
Experience working with students and families, plus community health and social service agencies.
Must be proficient in Microsoft Office and comfortable using a computer.
Must be able to complete thorough clinical documentation.

Why join Effective School Solutions?

ESS is focused on addressing one of the biggest challenges our country is facing - - the mental health of our youth.
ESS is a dynamic organization with a strong record of accomplishment of innovation and growth.
ESS provides staff with excellent career growth opportunities.
ESS provides extensive time off tied to the school calendar, with limited summer hours. ESS prioritizes and gives value to a clinician's work-life balance.
ESS offers staff competitive compensation and benefits offerings.
ESS values clinician voice and perspective and has multiple methods to give feedback and input on company decisions.

ESS is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

Do you want a fun and playful team?
Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children?

As a Pediatric Speech-Language Pathologist, you’ll work with children to improve their receptive and expressive language skills, fluency, articulation, and ability to use augmentative and alternative communication (AAC) devices.

Your responsibilities will include giving assessments, creating customized speech-language therapy plans, and individual patient care. Our clinic style is fully collaborative, meaning our therapists from all specialties work together to find the best approach for each child’s needs.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Master’s degree in communication studies or speech therapy
Valid California Speech-Language Pathologist license
Valid Certificate of Clinical Competence (CCC) from the American Speech-Language-Hearing Association (ASHA)
At least 3 years’ experience administering speech-language therapy
Able to work collaboratively with a team of like-minded professionals
Love working with children
Preferred: current member of the American Speech & Hearing Association (ASHA) and/or California Speech & Hearing Association (CSHA)

JOB TYPE

Full-time, part-time

Monday – Friday 8:00 am – 7:00 pm

Saturday 8:00 am – 5:00 pm

SALARY

$80,000 – $120,000 per year

BENEFITS OFFERED TO OUR STAFF

Generous PTO
Monthly bonuses
Flexible scheduling
401(k) matching
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Life insurance
Quarterly dinners / Happy Hour
Coffee and snacks in breakroom

ABOUT OUR CLINIC

Joy & Laughter Developmental Therapy was founded in 2012 to empower therapists, parents, and children to work together to reach the highest outcomes. We saw firsthand how other pediatric therapy clinics were run: with a lack of communication between staff and limited options for parents. We decided that we could do it better, and we have! Not only do we encourage parents to be intimately involved with their child’s therapy, but we also foster a collaborative environment for our team to truly make a difference. When our amazing team works together, we help children blossom!

WHAT WE BELIEVE IN

Collaboration – When we work together and brainstorm the best approach to a child’s therapy, we can provide exceptional service for the children in our care.
Communication – We are successful because our administrative staff, therapists, volunteers, and team leaders understand that communication is key to effective therapy and a good company culture.
Compassion – Our close-knit team is full of dedicated professionals who truly want to help children and their families achieve their developmental goals.

CONTACT US

About us

Advanced Physical Therapy & Ergonomics, Inc. is a small business in Pleasanton, CA. We are professional, agile and innovative.

Modern office setting
Wellness programs

Companies Overview:

APTE (Advanced Physical Therapy & Ergonomics): Committed to providing the highest quality of physical therapy services, APTE is dedicated to ensuring every patient achieves optimal recovery and well-being.
B2H (Bridge 2 Health LLC): An extension of our commitment to health and wellness, B2H focuses on holistic approaches to personal health, offering services like personal training and massage therapy.

Company Mission: At both APTE and B2H, our mission is to abundantly create meaningful and impactful client/employee experiences. We're devoted to connecting with and safeguarding our community to the best of our ability. Every interaction is a pathway towards a healthier, more fulfilling life for our clients, and an opportunity to embody our core values.

Purpose: Our Physical Therapist Assistants are paramount to our team, supporting the efforts of our Physical Therapists at APTE and extending holistic wellness services at B2H. They play a pivotal role in our mission, assisting in guiding clients towards better health and well-being.

Intrapreneurial Spirit: At both APTE and B2H, we celebrate the spirit of intrapreneurship. Our Physical Therapist Assistants are encouraged to bring an entrepreneurial mindset within the organization, driving innovation in alignment with our mission. Creativity, a propensity for calculated risks, and the zeal for continuous growth are what fuel us.

Key Responsibilities:

Support Physical Therapists: Assist in the delivery and monitoring of prescribed therapeutic exercises and treatments.
Hands-on Techniques: Implement hands-on techniques and instrument-assisted tools as directed to enhance the therapeutic process.
Exercise Guidance: Direct clients through personalized exercises, ensuring adherence to prescribed techniques.
Modalities Application: Administer therapeutic modalities as instructed by the supervising Physical Therapist.
Wellness and Boundaries: Engage with clients at B2H for personal training or massage sessions, while articulating the boundaries between APTE's physical therapy services and B2H's wellness services.
Team Dynamics: Foster team unity and actively partake in team-building initiatives.
Client Education: Clarify the nuances between APTE's and B2H's offerings, helping clients understand each service's specific objectives and benefits.

Skills and Qualifications:

Associate degree or higher from an accredited Physical Therapist Assistant program.
Active license to practice as a Physical Therapist Assistant.
Certifications or expertise in Strength Training and/or Massage Therapy, especially beneficial for roles within B2H.
Aptitude for hands-on therapeutic techniques.
Robust interpersonal and team-building skills.
An intrapreneurial mindset, with a strong drive for innovation and progress.
Current CPR certification.

Bonus Opportunities: Employees dedicated to the company's growth and the achievement of our shared objectives will be recognized. Lucrative bonus opportunities await those who significantly contribute to helping the company reach its goals.

Become a part of our mission at APTE and B2H, championing both recovery and holistic wellness. Your skills, dedication, and intrapreneurial spirit will be instrumental as we endeavor to deliver unmatched care and services to our community.Physical Therapist Assistant

Duties:

- Assist the physical therapist in providing treatment to patients with various musculoskeletal conditions.
- Implement therapeutic exercises and activities under the guidance of the physical therapist.
- Monitor and document patient progress during therapy sessions.
- Educate patients on proper techniques for exercises and activities.
- Assist in the setup and maintenance of therapy equipment.
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to develop comprehensive treatment plans.
- Provide support and encouragement to patients throughout their therapy sessions.

Requirements:

- Associate's degree in Physical Therapy Assistant program.
- Valid state licensure or certification as a Physical Therapist Assistant.
- Strong knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and kinesiology.
- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
- Ability to work effectively as part of a healthcare team.
- Experience working in occupational health is preferred.

This is an exciting opportunity for a dedicated Physical Therapist Assistant to join our team. We offer competitive compensation and benefits packages, including medical insurance, retirement plans, and opportunities for professional development. Starfish Therapies is a company that strives to make a difference in the lives of the children and families we work with. We work as a team to reach this vision through our core values of: Passion for Kids, Lifelong Learning, Respect, Communication and Teamwork, and Dedication to Excellence. We create an environment that fosters career growth while maintaining individual and group accountability.

As an Occupational Therapist, you play an integral role in our mission of Making A Difference. In this position you are responsible for providing occupational therapy services to children in the school, clinic, and home settings, so travel is a requirement. Services are provided under the early intervention, education, and medical models providing therapists with the unique opportunity of being able to gain experience in and truly understand the differences and the interplay between these models of care.

Where we stand out as a company is our collaboration and our mentoring. We offer extensive mentoring to support you in your development as a therapist, all why enhancing the experience of the family. We work as a team and the kids and families we work with thrive as a result. We love having new graduates, therapists transitioning into pediatrics, and experienced therapists who love to collaborate!

Responsibilities of this position include but are not limited to:

Complete a comprehensive evaluation under all models of care
