POSITION DESCRIPTION: To provide direct patient care and support activities which build and maintain the outstanding outcomes of the therapy department.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Aids in the restoration and enhancement of independent function in those individuals whose living status has been compromised by illness and/or injury: evaluates and treats patients, communicates with families, physicians and other health team members, documents services in the medical record. Contributes to professional development of self and others. Enhances interdisciplinary team through professional skills and knowledge. Demonstrates safe working practices.

Provides patient treatments, which meet patient needs, and uses current treatment knowledge in accordance with facility clinical procedures. This includes but is not limited to:

Performing accurate, comprehensive patient evaluations.

Developing effective plan of treatment and obtaining appropriate approvals from referring physicians.

· Supervising Certified Occupational Therapy Assistants and/or Aides in direct patient care and patient related activities according to facility policy as well as State and Federal requirements.

Communicating with supervisor and other health team members regarding patient progress, problems, and plans.

Instructing patient’s families or nursing staff in specified follow through programs.

Interviewing patient and families regarding previous level of functioning and life style and current and future expectations.

Demonstrating knowledge of appropriate resources for problem-solving and clinical best practice.

Assessing, training, and issuing necessary ADL adaptive equipment and durable medical equipment for patients to facilitate independence in ADLs.

Writes accurate, complete, and clear documentation in accordance with regulatory, licensing, payor, and accrediting requirements. This includes but is not limited to:

Recording Resident Needs Reviews, evaluations, daily treatment notes, progress notes, and discharge summaries in accordance with facility procedures.

Recording treatment charges and insuring that documentation is consistent with billing data.

Writing specific, objective documentation, which is outcome oriented and details the patient’s needs, potential to benefit from treatment, and progress achieved to date. Includes specific, objective, measurable goals.

Managing Medicare Medical Review and Denials process in conjunction with Director of Rehabilitation, the facility, and therapy staff.

Acquiring and documenting consents/approvals for treatment when necessary.

Consistently demonstrates the facility’s interdisciplinary approach to patient care. This includes but is not limited to:

Integrating findings of other members of the interdisciplinary team in treatment assessment and recommendations.

Integrating input from patient and family in treatment assessment and recommendations.

Preparing for and providing meaningful contributions to the rehab team conferences, patient care conferences, utilization review meetings, family conferences, and caregiver training sessions.

Collaborating with and informing facility staff in areas of patient progress.

Educating members of the team in areas of expertise.

Working with facility to teach documentation practices, which assist the therapy team.

Communicating effectively with discharge planners.

Contributes to professional development of self and others. This includes but is not limited to:

Utilizing continuing education assistance to achieve targeted quality improvements.

Interacting with peer therapist at local acute hospitals and other environments, if appropriate.

Presenting at weekly rehab team conferences, facility in-services, and professional conferences.

Maintaining a current body of knowledge in areas of clinical expertise through seminars, professional journals, and peers.

Meeting continuing education requirements of regulatory agencies.

Aids in building and maintaining a positive facility culture as a professional member of the staff. This includes but is not limited to:

Consistently demonstrating positive core values in interactions with co-workers, patients and families, with all other persons involved with the patient’s care, and the general public.

Consistently demonstrating professional standards.

Contributing to a positive work team by sharing information, using problem-solving methods and accepting new ideas, constructive criticism, or advice from others.

Demonstrating superior customer service through courtesy, consistent follow-up and positive communication.

Demonstrates safe working practices. This includes but is not limited to:

Identifying and correcting safety hazards or notifying the facility or the Director of Rehabilitation so that safety hazards will be immediately remedied.

Maintaining work areas in safe and orderly fashion.

Maintaining equipment in safe working order by facilitation annual calibration.

Using proper body mechanics during treatments of patients and during support activities.

Using universal safety precautions.

Wearing appropriate protective equipment.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:

· Knowledge in Occupational Therapy evaluation and treatments.

· Ability to supervise and direct assistants and aides.

· Understanding of the principles of physical modalities employed in Occupational Therapy.

· Knowledge of use of prosthetic and orthotic devices ambulatory aides, assistive and resistive devices, and training.

· Knowledge of medical terminology.

· Ability to work with all types and levels of patients.

· Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Education:

Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Occupational Therapy from an accredited Occupational Therapy program.

Experience:

· Experience in geriatric rehabilitation preferred

· Experience in adult neurological, cardiac, and/or general rehabilitation is preferred.

Physical Requirements:

For Direct Patient Care:

Must be able to lift and transfer patients to and from all surfaces a minimum of 10 times per day.

Must be able to lift approximately 50-70 pounds a minimum of 10 times per day.

Must be proficient with the use of hands for repetitive grasping and find motor manipulation.

Must be able to perform CPR, if required.

Occupational Therapist will spend approximately 60-80% of time bending, stooping, kneeling, and reaching while working with occupational therapy patients.

Occupational Therapist will spend approximately 60-80% of time walking/standing.

For Support Activities:

Occupational Therapist may spend approximately 10-20% of time sitting at desk

or terminal entering data.

License/Certification/Registration:

Current Occupational Therapist State Licensure as required.

Current CPR certification

Clinical Manager for the RAMS CAAP Counseling & Pre-Vocational Services Program

The RAMS CAAP Counseling & Pre-Vocational Services (RAMS-CCS) provides culturally competent outpatient integrated behavioral health counseling and pre-vocational services to participants of the San Francisco Department of Human Services (DHS) County Adult Assistance Program (CAAP), serving adults without dependent children. This position is with the WorkForce Development program. RAMS-CCS is a collaborative effort with San Francisco Department of Human Services and San Francisco Department of Public Health (DPH) – Behavioral Health Services (BHS), Community Programs.

Essential Job Duties include, but are not limited to:

Provide clinical supervision, oversee and monitor quality of care provided by supervisees (e.g. service delivery, documentation, etc…), and liaise with other service providers and Human Services Agency (HSA)
Provide outreach, consultation services, and education/training on behavioral health services and issues to clients, families of consumers, community members, other professionals and program staff/interns, schools, and community organizations as deemed necessary
Participate in the clinical leadership team at RAMS CAAP Counseling Services with Program Director and other clinical supervisor(s), in assessing and planning for clinical services and administrative needs of the program
Provide culturally competent behavioral health services, including individual mid to short-term counseling/therapy and case management services, and as needed, conduct crisis intervention and collateral meetings, to remove behavioral barriers to work participation and employment
Conduct intakes and comprehensive initial risk assessments of clients, including a clinical analysis of the history and current status in relation to bio-psycho-social-cultural, risk factors, substance use/abuse/dependence, vocational experience, SSI assessments and eligibility, and other information.
Facilitate/conduct group counseling/therapy sessions utilizing various modalities; process-oriented, curriculum-based, and/or psycho-educational, with various topics such as symptom management, stress management, relationship management, wellness recovery, parenting skills, and skills building
Conduct functional assessments to determine if clients are able to perform work activities (brief screening to assess functioning for employability), and learning needs assessments to determine learning disabilities and tailor services to fit client needs as needed
Refer and transition clients to the appropriate services and departments, as needed, based on clients’ needs and conditions
Complete and maintain timely administrative and treatment records and documentation related to client care, in accordance to standards specified by RAMS policies, clinical standards, and oversight agencies (e.g. HSA)
Facilitate/Participate in case conferences, staff meetings, in-service trainings, and other staff development activities
Participate in and facilitate various educational and training workshops relating to behavioral health issues, technical support/training, and psycho-educational topics for clients, HSA program staff, other professionals, and/or the community-at-large, as deemed necessary
Collaborate in roundtable sessions as needed and closely coordinate and/or oversee coordination with treatment team members, HSA staff, and other care/community providers, as well as the client, in the planning of the individual’s treatment and care, goal development, vocational assessment and rehabilitation, case conferencing, participant progress, discharge planning, and other services as indicated
Develop and maintain clear, open, timely, cooperative, and diplomatic communications and working relations with all staff, consumers, and partner agencies
Perform other duties as assigned

Minimum Required Educational level and Experience:

At least Masters in Psychology/Counseling/Social Work, or PhD/PsyD in Psychology, REQUIRED
Must be licensed by Board (PhD/PsyD, LCSW, MFT, LPCC) and able to meet State/Board requirements to serve as a clinical supervisor
Demonstrated knowledge and at least 3 years work experience in providing outpatient behavioral health services to adults in the indigent and underserved populations, who have mental health and/or co-occurring conditions, and their families, in a community behavioral health setting, required
Demonstrated experience in supervising clinical staff/paraprofessionals, required. Experience providing clinical supervision in community mental health settings, highly preferred
Demonstrated experience in engaging target population, engaging participants in small and large group activities, and conducting psychoeducational workshops
Keen understanding and comprehension of the complex systems of the Human Services Agency and Community Behavioral Health, and ability to support supervisees in navigating the systems

Other Requirements:

Must be detail-oriented and organized, think analytically, value accuracy and organization
Knowledge of community resources/services (including public health, mental health, substance abuse, primary care, housing, vocational, etc…)
Familiarity with various treatment modalities, strategies, and approaches to recovery in working with dually diagnosed clients (i.e., mental health and substance abuse/dependence)
Combination of education and clinical experience related to substance abuse/dependence treatment issues and working knowledge of mental health and substance abuse counseling, assessment and crisis intervention skills
A commitment to engage in professional development through attending trainings, continuing education seminars, case conferences, and reading new material, etc…, as related to treatment and support services for those with co-occurring disorders/dual diagnosis
Strong commitment to the philosophy, goals, and mission of RAMS, including providing culturally competent behavioral health services in a community setting
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work effectively, function independently, and interact professionally with a diverse, multi-cultural, and interdisciplinary staff of all levels
Applicants with ability to provide bilingual and culturally competent services in Cantonese, Tagalog, Russian, Vietnamese, or Spanish, preferred, due to the populations served

GENERAL INFORMATION

Great company seeks candidates with experience in a manufacturing environment for position of QA-Safety-Purchasing Director. Flexibility, dependability, a can-do attitude, and ability to solve challenges are important attributes for this role.

Does that sound like you? If yes, then read on, and if you are interested, send us an email with your cover letter *and* resume, including your desired pay range.

Please make sure that your resume includes your contact phone number AND lists the *month and year* of your previous positions, not just the year.

Some of what we offer to you are a pleasant and friendly work environment, very good benefits, and competitive compensation.

Please note that a background check will be conducted.

We look forward to hearing from you!

JOB DESCRIPTION

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The Senior Sales Fulfillment Coordinator (SSFC) is responsible for assisting to manage the Ingredient sales orders for the company. Most of the orders are either email requests or online orders. This position will assist to grow our Ingredients customer base and will coordinate those efforts.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

- Assist to manage the overall Ingredient business of organic herbs and spices within the existing customer base, new prospects generated from sales activities including trade shows, e-mails, Marketing e-mails, phone calls, promotions, and face to face meetings.

- Assist to manage daily order needs, from email/phone interactions to identify needs, sending appropriate documentation, providing sample requests, and obtaining order.

- High level of interaction with other CS members, Warehouse Team, and Quality Assurance to provide information, and ultimately high quality items on a timely basis that meet/exceed customer specifications to meet their needs.

- High level of autonomy to make decisions in assisting to manage current accounts and in assisting to develop new accounts, product sales for each account, creating Contract programs when deemed appropriate. Program proposal is reviewed with the Sales Director and possibly with the COO.

- Sales analytics – Analyze sales data to forecast and identify the sales activities that generate quick sales and long term contract opportunities to ensure full sales funnel and consistent flow of revenue.

- Conduct monthly reviews of the account sales and progress with management by reviewing sales.

- Work with marketing/web-master to automate and optimize on-line Ingredient sales.

- On a weekly basis, work closely with the production team and purchasing to assist with the proper forecasting of the anticipated sales of spices and blends to prevent shorts or out of stocks and minimizing lost sales.

- Make independent decisions on how to interact with Purchasing Team effectively anticipating Sales needs to satisfy upcoming sales.

ESSENTIAL ABILITIES

- Excellent analytic, problem solving, organizational, negotiation, planning, and people skills.

- Ability to succeed in a multi-task, fast paced/dynamic environment.

- Ability to write IIPP, SOPs, manuals, and other applicable written materials independently, in proper written form, grammar, and spelling.

WORK EXPERIENCE AND JOB REQUIREMENTS

- 2 to 6 years of experience in Customer Service or CPG sales.

- Strong track record of success – consistently exceeding customer expectations.

- Strong computer skills including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word. Experience with ERP and CRM systems.

- Strong written and verbal communications skills.

- Understanding of AC Nielsen, SPINS, IRI, Household Panel, and SPECTRA preferred.

- Travel for Trade Shows (currently anticipated at 1 to 2 shows per year, but may be more depending on company needs; approximately 4 days at each show).

EDUCATION

- BA/BS in Business, Marketing or related field preferred.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS

- Must use safe lifting techniques

- While performing the duties of this position, the team member is regularly required to stand, walk, sit, use hands to finger handle or feel objects tools or controls, reach with hands and arms, balance, stoop, talk, hear.

- Wearing personal protective equipment when in the facility is expected, as applicable, and following the required safety procedures.

- Lift and move up to 35 lbs.

- Exposure to spices, dust; variable temperatures; there may be exposure to chemicals.

The above content is not an exhaustive listing of all functions that the employee may be required to perform.

JT: Assistant Head of School for Finance and Operations
JD:
Title: Assistant Head of School for Finance and Operations

Reports​ ​to​: Head of School

Status: Professional Full-Year Staff

Start Date: July 1, 2024

Marin Country Day School seeks a talented, experienced, and qualified individual with a demonstrated background of success in leadership and management in the areas of finance and operations.

About Marin Country Day School:

MCDS is an independent, K-8, co-educational day school enrolling approximately 600 students from across the Bay area, primarily from San Francisco and Marin.

Our mission at MCDS is to create an inclusive community of learning that inspires curiosity, empathy, and action.

We actively seek diversity in our administration, faculty, and student body. As a school, we affirm that human diversity includes but is not limited to age, family structure, gender, gender identity and expression, race, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, socioeconomic class, physical ability, and learning style. As our Statement of Community and Inclusion indicates, “Ours is a community that would be uncomfortable without diversity and, therefore, has been intentional about creating and nurturing a diverse group of adults and children who share the core values of respect, responsibility, and compassion.”

At MCDS, every employee is integral to creating a learning community. All seek to improve as practitioners, learners, and team members, and we support our outstanding faculty and professional staff through our strong professional development program.

Position Description:

The Assistant Head for Finance & Operations reports to the Head of School and serves as a critical member of the School’s leadership team. The Assistant Head supervises approximately 40 non-faculty employees, collaborates with the Head and Trustees to develop and monitor all aspects of a $31 million budget, participates actively in strategic planning, master planning and supervises all of the School’s finance, human resources, compliance, operational and auxiliary program functions; is essentially responsible for everything that is not academic, admissions, or development related.

Principle Responsibilities:

Collaborates with the Head and Board to plan, oversee and monitor and report all aspects of the school’s finances.
Supervises and monitors all non-academic managers and staff in such diverse areas as finance, facilities, transportation, maintenance, food service, custodial and safety and security on the school's 35-acre campus.
Collaborates with the Head and Board to develop short- and long-range budgets and models for pension, endowment, strategic planning and capital projects.
Develops and monitors internal policies, practices and systems to facilitate the efficient and safe operation of the school.
Supervises and monitors the personnel policies and governmental compliance requirements.
Serves as a key member of the administrative team and finance, investment, audit, buildings and grounds and ad hoc committees of the Board.
Collaborates with Head of School and Board of Trustees in refinement and implementation of 25-year Master Plan adopted in 2007, and five-year strategic plan launched in 2023.

Qualifications

Professional:

Strong knowledge, experience and an insightful understanding of finance and administration with a solid grasp of accounting. Experience as a CFO or financial leader of a complex organization.
Excellent communication (speaking, listening and writing), planning, monitoring and delegating skills. Significant experience as a supervisor; able to juggle multiple tasks and responsibilities simultaneously.
Experience and skill in problem solving and understanding financial and other risks and developing solutions for their management.
Experience with the development of accurate, timely and useful financial reports. Able to identify and employ appropriate technology across the responsibilities of the position. Understanding of the complexities of gift tracking and development office systems.
Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills, integrity, judgment and competence. Effective planning skills demonstrated ability to multitask and a collaborative, positive, team-oriented approach to work. Experience with boards of directors.
Reflects and models the school’s core values of inclusion, curiosity, and empathy, and is positive, discrete and team oriented.
Possesses significant experience as a leader, speaker, and decision maker.
Brings experience interacting with contractors, vendors, auditors, insurance risk consultants, technology consultants, etc.
Understands the sociology of a school and engenders trust and confidence across constituencies.
Experience with master planning, architects, faculty and staff, as well as Trustee committees, e.g., Audit, Buildings and Grounds, Finance, Investment.

Personal:

Ability to fit into the school’s culture, which emphasizes teamwork, creativity, passion, flexibility, achievement, and reflection.

Independent, creative thinker with high self-esteem and a sense of humor.
High level of energy and ability to carry on multiple tasks simultaneously.
High integrity, intelligence, and excellent judgment.
Strong interpersonal skills. Ability to generate credibility, trust and respect throughout the organization.

Education:

Bachelor’s degree required.

MBA and/or CPA certification preferred.

Perks of MCDS:

MCDS is set back in the beautiful hills of Marin County, with a gorgeous view of the San Francisco Bay. We are surrounded by all sorts of wildlife varying from swans on the grass field to frogs jumping from one succulent to another. Our staff enjoy year-round gardens that produce amazing vegetables. We are fortunate enough to enjoy these vegetables throughout the academic school year through the farm to table meals our Chefs and kitchen prepare daily for all students and staff.

The setting and meals are just a few of the amazing parts of Marin Country Day School. The inclusion, warmth and passion exuded from faculty, staff, families and the children are unique to Marin Country Day School and it makes this a very special place to work.

We offer a very generous benefit and paid time-off package and believe in a healthy work/life balance for all employees.

Salary range is $200k-$250k

Please submit cover letter and resume to employment@MCDS.org

Bay Area General Contractor expanding and growing! We are adding to our team and have an immediate opening for a Construction Project Manager/Estimator.

· Experience with Blueprint reading

· Proficient in Xactimate preferred

Responsibilities include the installation, maintenance and troubleshooting of the electrical & Automation equipment associated the crude oil pump stations storage facilities & measurement systems. Exemplary client service skills, with the ability to interact with various departments, all levels of firm executive personnel, vendors and contractors.
Excellent written, verbal and organizational skills.
Maintain and handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.
Promote effective work practices, work as a team member, and show respect for all firm personnel.
Proficiency in MS Office applications.
Reporting to the Patent Client Services Manager

Experience in a law firm setting is preferred

JT: Psychiatric Social Worker/Marriage & Family Therapist - Juvenile Hall Youth
JD:
Do you believe in second chances? Want to make a difference in the lives of the justice involved youth? San Mateo County’s Behavioral Health and Recovery Services Youth Services Center has a career opportunity for a Psychiatric Social Worker/Marriage and Family Therapist I/II.

What we offer:

A supportive team environment with collaborative partnerships with Probation Officers, Judges, and community-based agencies.
Very diverse, and rich experiences working with underserved, justice involved youth within the Juvenile Hall, Camp Kemp, and in the community.
Participation in health equity initiatives to address race disparities.
Licensed supervision.
Excellent training opportunities towards licensure, Tuition Reimbursement, Education Leave and a Wellness Program, among others.
Flexible schedules/hybrid telework.
Mileage reimbursement and County cars available.
Competitive salaries, comprehensive benefits, and pension plan for regular employees.
Currently we have one full-time vacancy (Bilingual Spanish Required),

Exciting news! Candidates have the opportunity to receive a sign-on bonus of up to $15,000.

First-time external new hires, or current staff promoted internally or from other County departments into a regular Psychiatric Social Worker or Marriage and Family Therapist position in Behavioral Health and Recovery Services (BHRS) may be eligible to receive a sign-on bonus of up to $15,000 (subject to discontinuation at any time). The sign-on bonus will be in 3 phases and will be prorated for part-time positions. Restrictions Apply. Please see link for details. https://jobs.smcgov.org/hiring-incentives/

The clinician will provide specialized mental health services to justice involved youth that are detained in the juvenile hall or out-of-custody and on probation. The target population are adolescents and young adults ages 11 – 25 years of age presenting with severe emotional and/or behavioral issues and with multiple risk factors, including substance abuse, trauma, out-of-home placement, psychiatric hospitalizations. Principal duties will include Court Ordered assessments, individual and family therapy, in addition to crisis intervention, case management, collaboration and coordination with Probation and Institution staff, and community-based agencies. The clinician will also participate in an On-Call rotation. The clinician will provide assessment and/or therapy within the Juvenile Hall, Camp Kemp, the Behavioral Health & Recovery Services office, other community locations and/or home settings.

Minimum qualifications include:

Licensure/Certification

Psychiatric Social Worker I: Registration with the Board of Behavioral Sciences as an Associate Clinical Social Worker. An individual hired in this classification must become licensed within three years from the date of employment as a Licensed Clinical Social Worker issued by the State of California.

Psychiatric Social Worker II: Current California license as a Licensed Clinical Social Worker.

Marriage & Family Therapist I: Registration with the Board of Behavioral Sciences as an Associate Marriage and Family Therapist. An individual hired in this classification must become licensed within three years from the date of employment as a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist in the State of California.

Marriage & Family Therapist II: Current California license as a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist.

Education and Experience:

Any combination of education and experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities is qualifying.

A typical way to qualify is a Master's degree in Social Work, Social Welfare or a closely related field.

SALARY

Psychiatric Social Worker / Marriage & Family Therapist I

About us

Rubik Environmental has an immediate opening for a Senior Geologist to manage environmental investigation and remediation projects. The position requires strong communication, writing, and financial management skills, extensive experience overseeing site investigations and remediation projects, conducting regulatory negotiations, managing developing budgets, and interfacing with clients. The ideal candidate will be a licensed California Professional Geologist or Professional Engineer and be willing to obtain a Qualified Industrial Stormwater Practitioner certification. The position requires a minimum of 5 years of project management experience.

Rubik is headquartered in Reno, Nevada, with staff located throughout the country. We work on a wide variety of national and international projects and pride ourselves on our high standards and meeting our client's needs to solve complex issues. We prioritize a healthy work/life balance and provide a stimulating and nurturing environment for our employees with great benefits and a high degree of flexibility.

This position requires a detail oriented and enthusiastic self-starter who communicates well. This is primarily an in-office position but requires occasional travel for site visits, regulatory meetings, and meetings with clients. Preference will be given to candidates based in California or that can fill this position in our Reno, NV office. Remote candidates will be considered if they meet the required qualifications.

The job responsibilities will include the following:

Managing remediation, site investigation and groundwater monitoring projects
Developing scopes of work and budgets
Managing budgets, lifecycle cost forecasting, and invoicing
Preparing technical reports including remedial and site investigation reports, work plans, feasibility studies, conceptual site models, and monitoring and sampling reports
Providing peer review of technical reports
Presenting technical and financial information to clients
Presenting technical information to agencies and participating in regulatory negotiations
Researching scientific literature, regulatory requirements, and guidance documents
Mentoring and managing junior staff geologists/engineers
Facilitating effective communication among team members and stakeholders

Minimum Qualifications

B.S. in Environmental Science, Engineering, Geology, or closely related field
5+ years of experience conducting and/or overseeing soil/groundwater investigations and remediation projects
5+ years of experience as a Project Manager
OSHA 40-hr HAZWOPER and refresher courses
Proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite and AutoCAD (optional)
Excellent oral and written communication skills

Note: This is a senior-level position requiring extensive experience in project management.

Summary: Manage the operation of the portfolio. Assists in the monitoring of company policies and procedures related to property management. Responsible for recruitment, training, development, and supervision of Community Managers and shares responsibility for maintaining the physical asset and performance of assigned properties. Assists the Vice President of Operations and other supervisors with special projects, administrative tasks, and other related work. Reasonable use of your vehicle is required from time to time.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Establishes and coordinates a communication system involving transaction and activities among Community Managers and Main Office.

2. Interviews, trains, supervises, develops, and terminates the employment of those supervised in accordance with company policies and directives; performs performance evaluations on supervised associates; assists Community Managers with site-level associates.

3. Monitors, assists, and makes recommendations to improve marketing activities; reviews occupancy status; recommends rent schedules.

4. Monitors and research sub-market trends of portfolio on a weekly basis and makes recommendations based on information.

5. Reviews/audits property administrative, accounting, and maintenance areas to ensure compliance with established policies and procedures. Resolves resident relation issues.

6. Inspects the properties to ensure the highest standards are maintained; evaluates maintenance, grounds, and housekeeping operations in areas of efficiency. Conducts periodic inspection of vacant apartments for make-ready condition.

7. Assists in or develops corrective programs for apartment communities.

8. Supervises and coordinates preparation of annual operating and capital budgets. Monitors and makes recommendations on budget performance and prepares budget reports as delegated by Vice President of Operations.

9. Reviews and approves expenditures within specified budgetary guidelines. Negotiates and/or evaluates contracts and makes recommendations.

10. Establishes/revises property management forms, and reports including updates, changes, and additions.

11. Prepares and conducts meetings; develops and implements property management training programs for all departments.

12. Performs other duties as assigned.

Supervisory Responsibilities:

Strong supervisory, personnel management and organizational skills. Ability to delegate and communicate property management methods. Carries out supervisory responsibilities in accordance with the organization's policies and applicable laws. Responsibilities include interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance; rewarding and disciplining employees; addressing complaints and resolving problems.

Qualification Requirements:

To perform this job successfully, an individual must he able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions-

Education and/or Experience:

Knowledge of apartment property management normally acquired by two years of college or five years of supervisory experience in property management including three years on-site property management experience.

Language Skills:

Ability to communicate well both verbally and in writing. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety roles, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

Mathematical Skills:

Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as occupancy, exposure, GPR, Loss to Lease, leasing ratios, percentages, etc. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra.

Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to instruct and/or carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form. Ability to deal with problems involving several concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk or hear.

The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may he made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to be in an office setting, the employee occasionally works near moving mechanical parts. The employee occasionally works in outside weather conditions and is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions, fumes or airborne particles, toxic or caustic chemicals, extreme cold, and vibration.

At times, employee may be scheduled to work at a property that does not have an employee restroom. Although the company actively tries to maintain a vacant apartment that is clean and stocked with toiletries, as times this is not possible. In this case, employees may use an off-site facility and may remain on the clock and request mileage reimbursement.

Company: International Building Investment Incorporated (IBI Inc.)
Location: Greater Bay Area, California
Job Type: Full-time

Are you a construction enthusiast with a knack for turning complex remodel and repair projects into reality? Do you possess a deep understanding of both interior and exterior construction work, visualizing solutions and estimating the details in your sleep? If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you!

About Us:

International Building Investment Incorporated (IBI Inc.) is a dynamic and fast-paced construction firm specializing in remodel and repair projects. We take pride in our ability to transform spaces, from aging balconies to outdated interiors, into something extraordinary. Our team thrives on challenges and thrives in a high-energy, organized chaos environment.

Position Overview:

We are seeking an experienced Estimator with a unique skill set – someone who can look at a project, dissect it in their mind, and create a detailed plan of action. Our ideal candidate is a construction professional with a wealth of knowledge in both interior and exterior work, particularly in the realm of remodel and repair.

Key Qualifications:

Construction Expertise: Profound knowledge of construction, including the ability to deconstruct and reconstruct various project types, from balconies to dry rot siding, stucco, trim, drywall, and interior remodels. We need someone who can visualize the entire process, down to the plumbing, electrical, and finishing touches.

Estimation Mastery: Strong estimating skills are crucial. You should be able to accurately calculate the required man-hours for a project and assess whether subcontractors are needed. This includes understanding fair pricing for subcontracted work.

Full-Service or Right-Hand Experience: A background in full-service contracting or supporting a full-service contractor is a significant advantage. Experience in production-focused construction, rather than custom homes or single-item contracting, is preferred.

Personal Attributes:

Adaptability: Thrives in a fast-paced, chaotic environment and enjoys juggling multiple estimate requests with ease. You should feel energized by the constant flow of projects and have excellent organizational and prioritization skills.

Charm and Honesty: Possesses excellent interpersonal skills, building positive relationships with colleagues, clients, and subcontractors. Honesty and sincerity are essential.

Humble and Hungry: Displays humility, embraces challenges, and is passionate about their career in construction.

People Smart: Understands and responds to others' needs and wants effectively, fostering strong working relationships.

What We Offer:

Competitive salary commensurate with experience.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.
A supportive and collaborative team environment.
Challenging and diverse projects that keep you engaged.
The chance to make a real impact on our company's success.
If you are ready to take your construction expertise to the next level and thrive in an environment where no two days are the same, we want to hear from you!

How to Apply:

To apply for this position, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you're the ideal candidate for this role. We look forward to reviewing your application and getting to know you better.

*We Are An Equal Opportunity Employer*

If you are looking to make a difference in this developing role, we would like to hear from you. Please apply today with the link below.

Job Summary:

The company is seeking a General Manager for the NorCal market. This position is located in the Bay area. The General Manager is responsible for the market’s P&L, overseeing and supporting the daily operations of the management within a specific region, ensuring execution of the regions budgets and forecasts while maintaining safety and construction services, including macro sites, small cells, site maintenance, decommissioning and other projects. The General Manager, as a key member of the company’s management, will build the NorCal market from it’s current revenue level to a significant operation over the next 2 years.

Responsibilities:

· Financial Planning:

o Meet the market Profit and Loss budget through effective workforce management, tactical implementation, Revenue generation, efficiency improvements and client satisfaction.

o Demonstrate compliance with approved regional budget and forecast.

o Preparation and maintenance of annual budgets and regular financial planning reports, including monthly profit and loss forecast with Division President.

· Region Operations:

o Ensures customer satisfaction, profitability, and the growth of client relationships.

o Supports managers in customer-facing strategic discussions.

o Ensures that work is of the highest quality and all operational performance metrics are met or exceeded.

o Supports and promotes organization’s Core Values of Invested effort, Safety, Quality performance, Integrity, Reliability and Ethical behavior. .

o Monitors and analyzes reports pertaining to scheduling, workload management, resource management and on site performance.

o Oversees and assist in coordination of work force, identifying market needs and opportunities for same day staff adjustments.

o Leads and manages employees ensuring ongoing communication, performance management, and development.

o Pursues and develops new business opportunities for the company in their division or region and participating in the estimating process.

o Coordinates with Senior Management within region on the evaluation of the cost-effectiveness of equipment potential upgrades and additions; plans and schedules installations to meet system deadlines.

o Complies with all specifications, industry standards, safety rules, regulations, and company policies and procedures.

· Leadership:

o Partner with the Division President to develop long-term strategy, implement efficiently and assess organizational performance against it

o Collaborates with regional management staff to execute short- to middle-term implementation plans and assess organizational performance against it.

o Manages direct reports to efficiently meet client quality and satisfaction targets, on time / on budget installation of each job and support of corporate initiatives.

o Mentor and develop direct reports and identified high potential employees, managing training, performance evaluation, problem resolution and the building of an effective team dynamic.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Clear, concise, and persuasive, communication, writing and presentation skills.
Strong orientation to deadline and detail.
Decisive, with the ability to exercise good judgement under pressure.
An individual who embraces taking a hands-on approach.
Confident, open, and willing to confront difficult issues, cope with conflict, and challenges others in order to create positive change.
Have a point of view, but flexible in considering other approaches.
Creative problem solver.

Construction Project Accountant

Job Location: Menlo Park, CA

BACKGROUND:

Menlo Equities is a private equity, fully integrated commercial real estate firm with a history of holdings and operations in major US innovation hub markets. These markets include Seattle, San
Francisco/Silicon Valley, Los Angeles/Orange County, San Diego, Phoenix, Denver, Austin, Dallas,
Atlanta, Raleigh‐Durham, Nashville, Northern VA (DC metro), Minneapolis, and Boston. Established in
1994, we currently manage and operate entities holding approximately $3.5 billion in commercial real estate. We focus on the office, data center, life sciences/lab, in‐fill logistics and specialized R&D asset classes. We are the landlord to many large corporations including Apple, Amazon Web Services (AWS),
Disney, Equinix, Target, Southern Company, San Diego Gas & Electric, LG, Wells Fargo, BAE systems and
Samsung just to name a few.

Our 25+ year successful track record is built upon three distinct investment strategies: (i) targeted value add (buy, reposition/lease up and exit), (ii) core plus (properties leased long‐term to high credit tenants characterized by a significant portion of the return derived from operating cash flow) and (iii) opportunistic, ground‐up development projects that include entitling a site, building construction and economic stabilization through proactive leasing. Properties are held in various partnership structures that include closed‐end funds, an open‐end perpetual fund, syndications, institutional separate accounts, and joint ventures.

Our mission is to be a trusted partner to our investors, tenants, creditors, employees, and communities while delivering top tier, risk‐adjusted returns, and outperforming industry benchmarks. Culturally, we value intellectual curiosity, rigorous analysis, creative problem‐solving, a collaborative spirit and a willingness to be accountable and to take initiative.

DESCRIPTION:

We are currently seeking a Construction Project Accountant to join our accounting team in Menlo Park.
The role will primarily be responsible for preparing financials statements and management information for current and prospective development projects. The role will be responsible for preparing financial statements, monitoring costs and budgets, and working with Development project managers to ensure that all aspects of reporting and project financial controls are met. The position will report to our Vice
President, Controller. This is a dynamic position offering career development as our portfolio continues to grow and our investment offerings evolve.

A successful candidate will be a team player that is comfortable working in a challenging, fast‐paced environment.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

All facets of accounting related to construction projects including:

1. Management of loan draw budgets and associated reporting which includes review of contractor pay applications, bank financing forms and lien waivers.2. Assistance in the preparation of loan draw requests.
3. Review contractor invoices for accuracy and completeness.
4. Research and resolve invoice and billing disputes with contractors.
5. Assigning invoices and accrued project expenses to specific WBS categories within the construction project accounting system.
6. Closing the books and completing month end accounting and reporting (including the preparation of financial statements) for all entities associated with an assigned development project.

Develop a strong comprehension of an assigned construction project business plan such that the accountant can coordinate and collaborate with team members providing relevant parties timely updates to project forecasts (including adjusted ETCs) thereby ensuring material variances to project and loan budgets are analyzed and appropriately reported.
Review and analyze all construction project forms, contracts and other documentation to ensure relevant terms are well understood resulting in accurate accounting and cost tracking.
Assist in preparing all required reports for internal and external partners.
Prepare journal entries, perform account reconciliation and analysis, and schedules for internal and external reporting.
Work with team members to ensure timely and accurate billing of reimbursable capital projects costs and/or the review and calculation of affiliated development fees.
Investigate any unbilled project costs.
Organize and maintain, in conjunction with the Development team, financial project files.
Ensure monthly books are reconciled and closed on an accurate and timely basis.
Prepare monthly bank account reconciliations.
Assist in interim, quarter, and year‐end audit or review process, including providing requisite

PBCs to Menlo’s external auditors and tax preparers.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist in the review of tax workpapers and K‐1s prior to issuance.
Assist in the preparation of internal and external financial reporting.
Close monthly GAAP and tax basis accounting for assigned commercial real estate and management/fund entities.
Provide support and assistance to the Treasury and Accounts Payable group(s) on an occasional basis.

REQUIRED EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, Finance, or other relevant business discipline

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:

2‐5 years of real estate or financial accounting experience or general ledger responsibilities for partnership entities in a private equity/investment firm is preferred.
Minimum of 2 years’ experience working as a project construction accountant demonstrating a familiarity with an established construction accounting system (e.g. Sage, Timberline, Yardi, etc.)
Excellent knowledge of construction cost accounting and related financial procedures
Strong analytical skills
Knowledge of US GAAP
Experience with Yardi Voyager enterprise accounting system preferred.
Strong MS computer skills (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) required.

2

Must be a detail‐oriented, self‐starter with good oral and written communication and strong time management skills.
Must be a team player willing to support and assist others when called upon.

All offers of employment are contingent upon satisfactory results of a comprehensive pre‐hire background check including criminal, education, and employment verification.

Salary Range: $85,000 to $110,000 annually depending on experience.

This position is also eligible for a semi‐annual bonus and other forms of incentive compensation based on the successful completion of defined performance objectives.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical and dental insurance, VSP, and a firm sponsored 401K plan with a safe harbor matching component.

This position is provided with clinical supervision with a board registered supervisor.

POSITION DESCRIPTION

The Program Director is the clinical and administrative team leader of the Dore Urgent Care Clinic, primary responsibility is to manage and directly supervise the work flow of the Clinic, a community based Mental health crisis intervention and assessment center. This includes ensuring that all services are consistent with the Progress Foundation philosophy of Social Rehabilitation. The Program Director oversees the day to day functions of the clinic and is responsible for ensuring that DUCC staff works as a connected and cohesive unit in order to effectively respond to the needs of a diverse client population in distress. This role requires a high energy cross functional project manager, team builder and staff leader with a strong clinical background and excellent communication, crisis management and investigative skills. DUCC is unique in the San Francisco Behavioral Health community. The client centered program continues to evolve in a positive way and strives to provide the community, particularly the economically disadvantaged and vulnerable residents of San Francisco, with crisis intervention that is effective, culturally competent, and compassionate.

The Program Director ensures that the regulatory components of the DUCC program are well integrated and operated in a manner that is consistent with prevailing standards of psychiatric and medical care, with applicable Federal, State, City and County laws and regulations, and with Progress Foundation policies and procedures.

In addition, the Program Director is responsible for assisting in personnel operations, supervision and coaching, developing and maintaining effective relationships with clients, support people, and with the community, and for the comfort, safety, non-institutional ambiance, and overall physical condition of the facility environment. The Program Director may also be required to participate in community trainings like the CBHS 5150 training.

The Program Director must work in conjunction with the leadership of the adjoining Crisis Residential Treatment Program, Dore House, as well as the other Acute Diversion Units and Residential Treatment programs. The DUCC provides clinical support and intervention and is consistently and efficiently linked with those programs in order to achieve continuity of care.

Minimum Qualifications

Valid and current California license as a Nurse Practitioner or Registered Nurse
Minimum 3 years experience in a crisis mental health setting
Minimum 3 years’ experience in clinic management, staff supervision, scheduling, and budgeting
Must have or develop knowledge of Social rehabilitation philosophy and mental health recovery models
Must be able to communicate effectively with medical and mental health staff, clients, family members and providers both orally and in writing.
Must be able to work effectively on computers and computer based information systems
Must comply with the Progress Foundation code of ethics.

Progress Foundation is an equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce. Bilingual/bicultural, people of color, women, individuals with personal experience as consumers of mental health services and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment-qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Employment is contingent upon meeting the above minimum qualifications and verification of previous employment and education.

The Company will consider qualified applicants including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local “Fair Chance” laws.

Job Description

Duties:

- Create and implement age-appropriate lesson plans and activities for children in the daycare center.
- Provide a safe and nurturing environment for children to learn and grow.
- Supervise and engage with children during playtime, mealtime, and naptime.
- Foster social, emotional, cognitive, and physical development through various educational activities.
- Collaborate with other teachers and staff members to ensure a cohesive and enriching learning experience for all children.
- Maintain open communication with parents regarding their child's progress and any concerns or updates.
- Follow all health and safety guidelines to ensure the well-being of the children.

Experience:

- Previous experience working with students or children in a daycare or educational setting.
- Knowledge of early intervention strategies and techniques.
- Familiarity with curriculum development and implementation.
- Strong understanding of math and literacy education for young children.
- Ability to educate and engage toddlers and preschool-aged children.
- Experience in providing quality care for children, including diaper changing, feeding, and naptime routines.

We are looking for a dedicated Daycare Teacher who is passionate about early childhood education. The ideal candidate will have experience working with young children in a daycare or educational setting. They should be knowledgeable in math and literacy education, as well as have experience with curriculum development. The Daycare Teacher will be responsible for creating engaging lesson plans, supervising children during playtime, mealtime, and naptime, and fostering their social, emotional, cognitive, and physical development. Strong communication skills are essential as the Daycare Teacher will need to collaborate with other teachers and communicate regularly with parents. The ability to provide quality care for toddlers and preschool-aged children is also important. If you are enthusiastic about working with young children and helping them thrive in a nurturing environment, we encourage you to apply.

Qualifications:

Educational Requirements (must meet one of the following combinations):

1. 12 semester units (18 quarter units) of passing grades in ECE/Child Development (classes include, but not limited to child/human growth and development; child, family and community, program/curriculum), or a related field (e.g., recreation, education, or sociology) AND at least 6 months experience in a licensed child care center or comparable group child care program OR,

2. 6 semester units of passing grades in ECE/Child Development (classes include, but not limited to child/human growth and development; child, family and community, program/curriculum), or a related field (e.g., recreation, education, or sociology) AND currently enrolled in at least 2 units a semester until the educational requirement in subdivision (1) is satisfied AND at least 6 months experience in a licensed child care center or comparable group child care program

Other Requirements:

· Possess Preventative Health & Safety including Nutrition Certificate (within 30 days of employment)

· Pediatric & Adult First Aide and CPR

· Must be at least 21 years of age

· Completion of Child Abuse Prevention training, Medication Administration Online and CDSS Mandated Reporter Training Online (AB 1207) within 30 days of hire

· Completion of Licensing Operations & Record Keeping CCLD- online within 30 days of hire

· All personnel shall be in good health and shall be physically and mentally capable of performing assigned tasks. Verification through a health screening, including a documented negative test for TB (not more than one year old) as well as documentation of MMR (within 20 years) & TDAP (within 10 years) vaccinations

· Obtain a California clearance or a criminal record exemption as required by law (from DOJ/CACI and FBI) prior to working with children on site

· This position is a supervisory position and requires the ability to make sound and independent decisions that protect children, families, staff, the program and the organization

· Ability to communicate effectively and appropriately with all individuals at all levels

· Experience working in diverse communities and highly competent across cultures

· Ability to hold self and staff team to high expectations as well as skills in coaching and training staff

· Ability to understand and sign California State Licensing’s “Notification of Employee Rights” (LIC 9052)

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

· Understand the developmental needs and expectations of youth across the ages

· Ability to relate to youth and adults in a positive manner

· Understand and have a working knowledge of positive behavior guidance and discipline with youth

· Demonstrated knowledge and skill in different program areas such as sports, academic enrichment, camp activities, etc.

· Based on availability and programming needs, hours scheduled will be between 2 to 6 pm, Monday-Friday, with occasional weekends, for maximum hours of 26 to 30 hours per week

· Ability to have FUN while also being safe

Physical Aspects of the Job:

· Ability to communicate and work with different participating groups (age and skill levels) and provide necessary instruction to participants and staff

· Ability to observe participant behavior, assess its appropriateness, enforce appropriate safety regulations and emergency procedures, and apply appropriate behavior-management techniques

· Ability to observe staff behavior, assess its appropriateness, enforce appropriate safety regulations and emergency procedures, and apply appropriate management techniques

· Visual and auditory ability to identify and respond to environmental and other hazards related to the environment

· Physical ability to respond appropriately to situations requiring first aid. Must be able to assist participants in an emergency (fire, evacuation, illness, injury, etc.) and possess strength and endurance required to maintain constant supervision of participants

· Some physical requirements may include prolonged standing, some bending, stooping, walking long distances, and stretching; requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity to manipulate equipment and program activities; requires normal range of hearing and eyesight to record, prepare, and communicate appropriate participant activities/programs and the ability to lift up to 50 lbs; willing to work irregular hours with limited or simple equipment and facilities; and with daily exposure to the sun, heat, and outdoor events

Additional Information:

· This job description is not definite and it may be necessary to perform other duties as assigned when requested by your supervisor with reasonable expectations and within a reasonable amount of time

· All facility personnel shall be competent to provide the services necessary to meet the individual needs of children in care and shall at all times be employed in numbers sufficient to meet those needs

Triple Aught Design is an apparel and equipment manufacturer headquartered in San Francisco. On their toughest missions and in their everyday adventures, our highly-engaged and dedicated community depends on our gear to help them prevail. With the Pacific to our west and the Sierras to our east, we have spectacular landscapes to inspire our designs and rugged wilderness areas in which to test and use our products.

We are currently seeking an energetic, collaborative, agile, and detail-oriented Senior Technical Designer experienced in developing best-in-class technical apparel and equipment from concept through production.

Utilizing your advanced technical knowledge of fit, materials, patterns and construction, you will partner with others on our product team to build innovative product lines and grow market share and profitability. You will be responsible for ensuring products are commercialized accurately, adhering to TAD aesthetic, fit, quality and environmental standards resulting in on-time product development and production deliveries.

This is an exciting and impactful opportunity to help grow a vertically integrated manufacturing and retail startup.

Core Responsibilities

Manage the calendar and process including costing, quality evaluation, and approval requirements.
Identify construction technology that supports design vision and product requirements.
Produce accurate product specifications in PLM (including BOMs, patterns, markers, grading information, size charts, technical drawings, etc.) and ensure they are maintained and distributed.
Capture and detail product materials and construction information -- maintain BOM and PLM information to ensure efficient material purchasing and accurately produced finished product.
Manage the pattern creation process and ensure that TAD fit and quality standards are achieved in a timely manner.
Prepare accurate initial cost estimates for all prototypes and manage the costing process to ensure consistent, accurate cost sheets are received from all vendors and approvals are clearly communicated internally and externally.
Manage proto, sample, counter-sample, and production approvals to ensure TAD quality standards as well as on-time deliveries.
Lead efforts to resolve quality issues in a timely manner & work to ensure production orders leave the factory defect-free.
Work in collaboration with design and patternmaking to ensure products meet established fit and measurement standards.
Coordinate with Production, Finance, Marketing, and Design on sampling requirements.
Ensure all external product communication accurately reflects product model and specification.

Core Proficiencies

Extensive knowledge of apparel construction, material construction, and properties, pattern making, costing, bill of materials, embroidery and surface applications (e.g. screen printing, etc).
Extensive knowledge of technical fabric / trims, construction, and production requirements.
Significant experience with menswear and technical outdoor apparel
Ability to interpret design intent and offer alternative solutions.
Knowledge of garment fit and the ability to instruct a patternmaker on necessary changes to a pattern to influence the fit.
Excellent communication skills: written, verbal, presentation, and negotiation -- ability to write comprehensive product specs and produce extremely detailed technical drawings.
Demonstrated history of taking initiative and following through on areas of responsibility.
Extreme attention to detail.
Solid grasp of the design, development and merchandising process from concept through production.
Excellent skills in creating construction specifications in Illustrator
Experience with creating and modifying patterns and markers in Gerber Accumark.

Preferred Experience

5+ years experience in technical design -- proven problem-solving skills, interpreting design intent, and product innovation.
Strong hands-on sewing capabilities and knowledge.
Performance history with domestic and offshore vendors and manufacturers.
Bachelor's degree in Apparel Design preferred

Benefits

Triple Aught Design offers a comprehensive benefits package for all full-time employees working 30 hours/week or more. Benefits include Medical, Dental, Vision, PTO, and others.

Please apply by submitting your resume and cover letter in either PDF or plain-text format.

While we thank all applicants for their interest, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted.

POSITION SUMMARY

This position is responsible for ensuring safe, reliable and efficient electrical maintenance of production equipment to meet operating standards and manufacturing needs.

The position consists of electrical maintenance of plant equipment; high speed packaging equipment, sand conveyor systems, gas fired burners, transfer conveyors, pumps as well as mobile equipment. The plant has a variety of electrical equipment including, Allen Bradley PLC’s & VFD’s, Danfoss drives, Modicon PLC’s and Ethernet communications. Working as part of dynamic team, the position will be involved in all aspects for planned/unplanned electrical maintenance using Continuous Improvement tools and methods (TPM).

This is a represented position and reports to the Maintenance Supervisor.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES

Read and understand electrical prints and schematic drawings
Troubleshoot and repair all types of electrical controls, including 460 volt - three phase motors and equipment
Troubleshoot and repair Programmable Logic Controlled (PLC) equipment, including Allen Bradley and Modicon controllers
Troubleshoot and repair Variable Frequency Drive (VFD) motors and equipment
Perform electrical control design work and equipment control modifications
Perform electrical equipment installations according to National Electrical Code (NEC) including all feeder and branch circuits
Maintain a safe work environment and the safety management of assigned employees. Must recognize unsafe conditions and practices and make corrections to prevent injuries and property loss. Required to complete safety audits/inspections of the assigned work area; thorough investigations of incidents and accidents, job safety analysis and have periodic safety meetings
Support 5S and World Class Manufacturing initiatives
Work within the Safe Work Process and Permitting procedures in CertainTeed roofing Inc.
Other duties as assigned

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

Capable of troubleshooting, repairing and installing electrical controls and equipment, including PLC, VFD and PC communication systems
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing
Must understand and use preventive and predictive maintenance systems and World Class Manufacturing tools
Must have basic computer skills, including the ability to learn/use the corporate CMMS (SAP) software as well as be able send and retrieve email, access company web pages through the Internet and to use basic business software like MS Word and MS Excel
Self-motivated and willing to maintain and continue to develop his/her skills

The above declarations are not intended to be all-inclusive of this position’s duties, responsibilities and requirements to do this job. They are intended only to describe its general nature.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

High School Diploma or equivalent
Minimum of three (3) years of industrial electrical maintenance experience

PREFERRED OR DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS

Associate degree in Electrical Engineering or related one year industrial electrical trade school training
Electrician license
Ability to program PLC and SCADA equipment
Previous experience with maintenance of roofing production equipment

ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS
WORKING CONDITIONS

Work is performed in a manufacturing plant environment with limited HVAC, concrete floors, and exposure to industrial noise, dust, chemicals and temperature changes
Normal plant operation is 24 hours, 7 days a week and work hours may vary depending on business needs.
May require long hours, and weekend and holiday work
May require travel by air and rental cars
May also require shift work
Physical demands include, but not limited to: walking and climbing, entering confined spaces, and heights; able to lift 50 pounds; able to operate powered machinery and tools

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be capable of wearing personal protective equipment necessary to comply with government and company safety standards whenever engineered methods of reducing hazards or physical requirements cannot be reasonably accommodated.
Job includes tasks that require walking, bending, twisting, gripping, stair and ladder climbing, entering confined spaces, navigating rough terrain and occasional lifting of up to 50 lbs.
May require long periods of sitting, walking, standing, working on a computer or engaging in telephone conversation.

Company: ABA SHINE

Location: Contra Costa, CA (Hercules, Pinel, Richmond, Lafayette, Walnut Creek, Concord)

Job Type: Full-time maximum 8 cases & Part-time as per your availability.

Pay: Competitive salary

Benefits: 401(k) matching, Flexible schedule, Health insurance, Professional development assistance, Referral program, Relocation assistance

COVID-19 considerations: ABA SHINE follows a strict safety protocol during the pandemic which will be outlined in detail at the interview.

Application Question(s): Please explain why you are qualified to implement our unique 1-tier model

Job Description:

Are you a dedicated and experienced Board-Certified Behavior Analyst (BCBA) ready to shine in your career? Join the exceptional team at ABA SHINE, where we empower children with special needs to reach their full potential through high-quality Applied Behavior Analysis (ABA) therapy.

Who We Are:

ABA SHINE is a leading provider of ABA services, committed to making a positive impact in the lives of children with special needs and their families. Our mission is to enable parents of children aged 18 months to 99 years with autism by delivering evidence-based ABA therapy. Each of our ABA principles is aimed at fostering each client’s full potential. Our fundamental principles revolve around compassion, unwavering energy, responsibility, solution-oriented thinking, integrity, steadfastness, and a positive mindset. Our team of Board-Certified Behavior Analysts (BCBAs) is dedicated to delivering patient-centered ABA Therapy to children and adults affected by autism spectrum disorder (ASD). We extend a warm invitation to BCBAs in search of mentorship and professional growth opportunities to join us in our mission to expand our reach and serve and transform the lives of our clients and their families

The Role:

As a BCBA at ABA SHINE, you will be at the forefront of providing direct ABA services for clients in various settings, including homes, schools, day programs, and communities. You will work closely with children with special needs, applying your expertise in ABA principles to enhance their development, communication, independence, and social skills. Your role includes creating personalized treatment plans, conducting assessments, and collaborating with families to achieve meaningful progress.

What We Offer:

At ABA SHINE, we believe in investing in our team members. We offer:

A competitive salary with opportunities for advancement.
Regular pay raises to reward your dedication.
A sign-on bonus as a warm welcome to our team.
Direct and indirect client time paid at the same hourly rate.
Access to in-house CEUs to support your professional growth.
A speaker series featuring renowned experts offering free workshops.
Autonomy in your role, with access to 1:1 coaching for guidance.
A strong support network of experienced BCBAs for collaborative brainstorming.
Comprehensive health insurance for peace of mind.
Hand-picked clients tailored to your expertise and preferences.
Options for group health insurance or health reimbursement arrangements.
Yearly bonuses as a token of our appreciation.
Company-provided electronics for enhanced efficiency.
Pay raise opportunities every quarter to reward your dedication.
Monthly team gatherings, from survival classes to beach cleanups.
An annual weekend retreat for employees, plus ones, and even pets!
A positive and supportive work environment where:
90% of our employees agree that ABA SHINE is a top-tier ABA agency.
90% appreciate the balance between work and life.
Over 60% plan to make ABA SHINE their professional home indefinitely.

Position Summary:

Implement direct ABA treatment sessions in the home.
Set and achieve performance goals with the client and client guardian(s).
Train guardians and family members to utilize ABA treatment techniques.
Attend seminars, meetings, and conferences to maintain certification.
Write ongoing treatment reports.
Conduct semi-annual/annual assessments.
Develop behavior intervention plans.
Attend weekly team building calls.

Capabilities / Key Competencies:

Must be a problem solver, dependable, organized, and detail-oriented.
Ability to utilize online data management software.
Strong verbal communication (oral and written).
Ability to work in the home, school, and community settings.
Maintain confidential client files following HIPAA guidelines.
Must use BST to teach ABA skills to parents and caregivers.
Valid Driver's License.
Auto Insurance.
Current TB shots / Vaccines (required for school settings).

Qualifications:

To excel at ABA SHINE, you should possess:

A BCBA credential in good standing.
At least 6 years of experience in the field of ABA.
Expertise in Verbal Behavior, NET, early intervention (ages 20 months - 4 years), assessments (VB-MAPP, Vineland, and FBA), and parent training.
Strong interpersonal skills and a passion for making a difference.
Availability between 8:00 a.m. and 6:00 p.m. Monday to Friday, with hours ranging from a minimum of 25-40 hours per week. BCBAs have full control over their schedules, with a minimum of 25 hours required for full-time position.

The role is paid hourly with a minimum of 25 hours (total of direct and indirect hours) expected per week. The pay range is as follows:

Beginning at $50 per hour with the potential for pay increases every 4 months, and continuing quarterly bonuses.
25 hours per week @$100,000 per year
35 hours per week @ $115,000 per year.

Join Our Team:

If you are a committed BCBA seeking a rewarding opportunity to shine in your career, we invite you to apply and become part of the ABA SHINE family.

We are seeking a Patent Client Services Administrator who will be responsible for managing portfolios for the firm’s patent group clients. The Patent Client Services Administrator will ensure quality service and will maintain a harmonious working relationship with lawyers, management, supervisors, co-workers, and clients by ensuring effective and efficient workflows and working ahead of all deadlines. This position can be based in any of our U.S. office locations.

Job Description:

Accurately record billable and nonbillable time; submits Intapp timely; meets applicable billable, and non billable hours requirements.
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of patent rules and regulations.
Utilize and follow all Fenwick IP specific workflow processes and procedures to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of work.
Draft, prepare and proofread written correspondence involving emails, memoranda and/or other documentation to internal personnel, clients and/or assignees.
Assist with the drafting and e-filing of various legal documents in the U.S. Patent & Trademark Office (PTO) related to patent prosecution of applications including, but not limited to, office action amendments and responses, requests for continued examination, continuation and divisional applications, information disclosure statements, supplemental application data sheets, sequence listings, extensions of time, terminal disclaimers, various petitions, notices of appeal, appeal briefs, corrected drawings, assignment recordations, post-grant proceedings and other documents as required.
Format utility/provisional specifications for filing in the PTO and have the ability to develop and maintain structural and formatting requirements as outlined in the MPEP.

Comprehensive knowledge of U.S. Patents.
Must have experience in preparing complex IDSs and stay abreast of all related rules and processes including citing references correctly.
Must have strong knowledge of IP docketing systems.
Multitask in a highly demanding, deadline-driven environment.
Possess a high level of attention to detail.
Take initiative and work both independently and in a team environment.
Ability to proofread typed material for grammatical, typographical and spelling errors.
Ability to type standard correspondence, memoranda and similar material in draft or final form from written material or dictation.
Exemplary client service skills, with the ability to interact with various departments, all levels of firm executive personnel, vendors and contractors.
Excellent written, verbal and organizational skills.
Maintain and handle confidential and sensitive information with discretion.
Promote effective work practices, work as a team member, and show respect for all firm personnel.
Proficiency in MS Office applications.
Reporting to the Patent Client Services Manager, the ideal candidate will have a minimum of four (4) years of relevant patent prosecution and/or U.S. docketing work experience. Experience in a law firm setting is preferred
