JD:
California Young World, Inc. is seeking a qualified professional to join our organization. The Health and Nutrition Coordinator is an exempt FULL-TIME position. The successful candidate will demonstrate expertise in Health and Nutrition, including a Bachelor's Degree (in Health, Nutrition, Special Education or Child Development) and five years experience in the Education, or Social Service area. Primary duties include; Staff Training, Compliance of State Mandates, Support for Teachers and Parents with Early Intervention Strategies and the Operation of our Funded CA Food Program. CYW hopes to attract a diverse, bilingual individual who reflects the children and families served. If you are interested in this opportunity, please provide your resume to Delfina Lopez, HR Generalist at Delfina@californiayoungworld.org or apply indeed. Salary commensurate with Education and Experience.

Summary: The Health and Nutrition Coordinator will support the Program Director with all Health related matters. This position also supports the Executive Director with the California Adult and Child Food Program (CACFP). Maintaining compliance with State, Federal and local mandates, regulations, and Health and Safety education supports for our employee’s, parents and children. Coordination of health screenings, organization of health files, and supporting the Center Operating staff with health and nutrition related activities, training and curriculum to enhance the program at California Young World.

Primary Functions: MONTHLY

· Submit the Food Program Claim to Child Nutrition (CNIPS), and submit a copy to the Accounting Dept.

· Work in collaboration with the Enrollment Coordinator (EC) to anticipate Data being requested from CYW, and state agencies, and provide necessary information for compliance. Provide support to the EC for tracking data of Alumni and current families (ethnicity, parent profiles etc.)

ANNUALLY

· Complete the Agency Annual CNIPS Application by August 31st each year to ensure certification of the CACFP Sponsor Status of CYW.

· Conduct the Annual USDA Certification of all families in the CA Food Program every October 1-31.

· Act as Liaison with CACFP DSS staff. Prepare and facilitate the annual self-review and State Administrative Review every three years

· Conduct visits to the three centers to conduct Compliance Monitoring Inspections and complete the CACFP Report 3 X per year/per site.

· Coordinate the annual Health Screenings with Healthier Kids Foundation for children 0-5 enrolled at CYW. (Dental, Vision, Auditory and Mental Health).

· Identify data and work with stakeholders (HKF, ASQ, LG, DRDP) to provide information about the status of follow up health needs for children requiring a glasses, dental work, hearing and auditory treatment, and mental health services.

· Attend the Annual CACFP National Conference – to stay informed of the latest mandates and health and safety requirements.

· Review current policies (and revise when necessary) the protocols for Daily Health Inspections, Medication Administration, the Exclusion Policy, and children who have medically involved disabilities (Asthma Albuterol Treatments, Colostomy bags, Epi Pen labels, etc.)

· Complete the “Mandatory CACFP Training” as the Food Program representative for CYW.

ONGOING

· Collaborate with the PD to attend all IEP meetings, or Student Study Team as requested by the Sunnyvale School District, the child’s teacher, or parents.

· Provide or coordinate training to staff on health and nutrition topics throughout the year. (CPR, dental awareness, nutrition program mandates).

· Work with HR Generalist for any Impact Suites intervention services for employee’s and their family. (Employee Assistance Provider EAP).

· Endeavor to design a Work-Place Wellness Program at CYW for employees. This may include; Meditation, Self-care strategies, Walking/exercise, Visualization, fitness classes.

· Provide coaching and support to staff who have severe challenges with children’s behaviors. Especially with children with special needs. Refer to FIRST 5 as needed for a deeper assessment. (Kids Connection – Medical Eligible & Personal Insurance for non-Medical).

· Provide oversight of the Summer Lunch Program for School Age children (New 6/24) who have no access to healthy meals when school is out for the summer. (and school breaks)

· Inspect health files of staff and children to insure compliance with mandates (TB test, physical, etc.)

Other duties as assigned:

· Active participant on the CYW Leadership Team.

· Liaison with F5, Healthier Kids Foundation, USDA and CNIPS/CACFP, and the Inclusion Collaborative.

· Onboarding new employee’s in regards to Health and Nutrition related policies and procedures.

Must be organized, creative, independent, self-motivated, enthusiastic, dependable, detail oriented, flexible in scheduling and prioritization, and driven by excellence.
Must demonstrate excellent communication skills to present facts and recommendations effectively in verbal and written form, including business correspondence.
Strong interpersonal skills to establish and maintain effective business relationships with clients, venders and employees.

JT: Licensed Marriage & Family Therapist/Associate Marriage Family & Therapist
JD:
Are you looking for a change? National Psychiatric Care and Rehabilitation Services are hiring for a clinician LMFT/AMFT.

NPCRS San Jose is a Crisis Residential Treatment (CRT) Program that supports adults recovering from a behavioral health crisis. Unlike programs that are held in a psychiatric unit or hospital-like facility, National San Jose provides a safe, home-like environment that supports individuals in their recovery. During their voluntary stay, individuals participate in a highly structured program and work with a team of specialists who help them resolve the behavioral or emotional issues associated with their crisis and provide the tools necessary to help them work through future challenges and re-integrate back into the community.

Job Summary

Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, LMFT, provides direct behavioral health services to patients admitted to National Psychiatric Care and Rehabilitation services and is responsible for treating, counseling and educating clients based upon their individualized emotional and psychological needs.

General Responsibilities

· Under the direction of the program director, Lead Therapist and/or a qualified licensed practitioner, the therapist will evaluate potential clients to assess whether they will fit program criteria for admission. Provides therapy for facility residents and their families.

· Works in conjunction with other staff to meet individual and family needs.

· Secures and documents informed consent from all participants.

· Develops and documents goals for each resident and documents all progress made toward the completion of goals.

· Document information concerning family therapy sessions, phone calls, e-mail, voicemail, etc. as appropriate, explaining all contact as necessary.

· Complete a case closure summary when services are terminated, including information on documented hours of service, identified problems, resident progress, and recommendations regarding further treatment.

· Makes community referrals as appropriate, and works with other staff to facilitate any necessary follow-up regarding resident needs.

· Identifies and responds to changes in policies, regulations, and procedures which can impact the patient.

· Assesses diagnoses and treats adult mental health patients by incorporating individual, couple, family and group therapy skills.

· Participates in case staffing and staff meetings as requested.

· Participates in staff training as requested.

· Participates in regularly scheduled performance evaluations.

· Understands and applies all National Psychiatric Care and Rehabilitation Services Policies and Procedures.

· Performs other duties as assigned.

Job Qualifications

· Licenses and Certifications: Valid California Marriage and Family Therapist License or Intern Registration

· Minimum Education: Master’s Degree in Social Work, Psychology, Human Services, Sociology or Behavioral Science.

· Minimum Experience: One (1) year experience working in a mental health setting or social service agency providing services to mentally ill consumers.

· Meets all health and background investigation regulations required by California Title 22.

We are looking for an Associate Veterinarian to fill a position at our two Veterinarian practice in Vallejo, CA. Graduates encouraged to apply! We would love to mentor a veterinarian.

JD:
We are a four-doctor practice, with three offices in Silicon Valley. This practice increased gross production by 10x in 7 years, doubling every two years. Our goal is to hire and train four doctors over the next four years, leading to attractive partnership opportunities. This starts as a training position because it involves learning an entirely new system of diagnosis and treatment. What we have been able to do is identify a population of people whose intelligence has deteriorated due to underlying visual processing issues. We were able to restore their intelligence to the highest level that they ever measured.

Gains in IQ of one standard deviation (15 points) or more have been achieved with regularity over the past decade. With multiple programs of therapy, similar gains have been achieved with each successive program. The demand for our services has been incredible. We are only limited by the number of doctors that we can teach to produce similar results.

Parents do not bring the children to use because they want to build “super kids.” They come because these issues put their child at risk for depression, anxiety, suicidal ideation, or a host of other types of mental illness. It is rewarding at a level that you never thought was possible to achieve with optometric practice. We want doctors who can practice with LOVE and COMPASSION.

This is a training position that starts out at about 25 hours a week. Could quickly move to full-time if you can master what we have to teach. We are located in Silicon Valley, with offices in Campbell, Los Altos, and Saratoga. We would like to start 2 doctors in the next two weeks to help us prepare for the surge of new patients that are coming in.

In addition to your involvement in affordable housing transactions, you will also handle ad hoc corporate finance tasks to support the overall financial management of the company.

Affordable Housing Deal Structuring: Lead the financial analysis and structuring of affordable housing projects, including Low-Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) deals, tax-exempt bond financing, and other subsidy programs.

Job Description

Rich Products Corporation is seeking a full-time Environmental Health and Safety Specialist to join our team in Union City, CA. This position will be responsible for the oversight of all environmental health and safety programs and activities at a manufacturing facility located in Union City, CA. The Environmental Health and Safety Specialist will be responsible for developing, implementing, monitoring, and evaluating environmental health and safety programs and activities. The position will also provide support to the manufacturing plant’s environmental health and safety management system.

Qualifications

The ideal candidate will have a minimum of two-three years of experience in environmental health and safety, including compliance with OSHA, EPA, NIOSH, FDA, and other regulatory bodies. This position requires an individual to have the ability to read technical drawings, understand work instructions, interpret process instructions, develop work plans, analyze data, and make decisions based on scientific principles. The ideal candidate will also possess the ability to communicate effectively with others and work independently as well as the ability to multi-task. The candidate must also be able to work in a team environment while maintaining strong leadership skills. Bilingual in the Spanish language a plus.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Being the Subject Matter Expert on all associate Safety, Environmental and Regulatory matters, provides coaching and support to plant teams.
Development and implementation of site-specific policies and procedures within corporate guidelines for assigned locations.
Conducts Safety, Environmental and Regulatory audits of the facility in order to evaluate compliance, identify areas for improvement and communicates them directly to the department managers and the Plant Manager.
Responsible to ensure local plant activities are being conducted as defined under local Regulatory compliance and within Rich’s Enterprise Safety Foundations.
· Coordinates training and/or training materials to all plant associates (hourly, leaders, management) in all safety and regulatory programs, documents, and tracks training compliance.
· Leader of the Accident Investigation team, utilizing Root Cause Analysis (RCA) to include 6W2H & 5 Why’s or similar techniques to identify causes and corrective actions to prevent similar occurrences.
Establishes and directs the plant safety shift(s) committees and their activities.
· Main contact with RPC Corporate regarding the Workers Compensation program and back to work policies.
· Assists Plant Leadership in identifying and correcting unsafe behaviors and unsafe conditions to drive a Zero Injury state.
· Provide EH&S oversight on large plant projects, conducts Pre-Start Safety Reviews on all equipment installs and upgrades.
· Administration, documentation, and proper filing of OSHA’s Record keeping Standards 29CFR1904, Accident Reports, 300 Log & Form 301, as well as other Regulatory and Safety Compliance documentation.
· Plant contact for our medical clinic, nurse case managers and insurance carrier representative concerning medical restrictions.
· Assist plant leadership with the design, layout and implementation of access control, CCTV, security systems, security contracts and building safety measures while maintaining consistency and integration with corporate systems.
· Any other duties as assigned by Leadership.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:

Knowledge of: OSHA/EPA regulations (29 CFR, 1910 & 1926; 40 CFR) applicable to manufacturing.
Knowledge of Industrial Hygiene, Labor Relations, Loss Control, Basic Engineering Principles
Knowledge of State specific Workers’ Compensation Law/Regulations
Completion of OSHA 10 Hour General Industry Course, 30 Hour certification preferred.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to prioritize and deal with multiple and conflicting workload requirements.
Bilingual in the Spanish language
Education – BS degree preferred or at minimum AA/AS degree required with minimum 3-5 years manufacturing and industrial safety & regulatory work experience.

Benefits

Medical insurance (includes dental & vision)
Dental insurance
Paid time off (PTO)
Paid holidays (4 days): New Year’s Day, Memorial Day, Independence Day, Thanksgiving Day, and Christmas Day (5 days)
401k with company match
Supplemental insurance (insurance company offers)
Life insurance
Short-term & long-term disability insurance
Accident insurance
Accutire insurance
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Flexible spending account (FSA) with qualified medical provider

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Sit, stand, walk, climb ladders, function in both cold and hot environments.
10% Travel may be required.

Senior Accountant

Job Location: Menlo Park, CA

BACKGROUND:

Menlo Equities is a private equity, fully integrated commercial real estate firm with a history of holdings and operations in major US innovation hub markets. These markets include: Seattle, San
Francisco/Silicon Valley, Los Angeles/Orange County, San Diego, Phoenix, Denver, Austin, Dallas,
Atlanta, Raleigh-Durham, Nashville, Northern VA (DC metro), Minneapolis, and Boston. Established in
1994, we currently manage and operate entities holding approximately $3.5 billion in commercial real estate. We focus on the office, data center, life sciences/lab, in-fill logistics and specialized R&D asset classes. We are the landlord to many large corporations including: Apple, Amazon Web Services (AWS),
Disney, Equinix, Target, Southern Company, San Diego Gas & Electric, LG, Wells Fargo, BAE systems and
Samsung just to name a few.

Our 25+ year successful track record is built upon three distinct investment strategies: (i) targeted value add (buy, reposition/lease up and exit), (ii) core plus (properties leased long-term to high credit tenants characterized by a significant portion of the return derived from operating cash flow) and (iii) opportunistic, ground-up development projects that include entitling a site, building construction and economic stabilization through proactive leasing. Properties are held in various partnership structures that include closed-end funds, an open-end perpetual fund, syndications, institutional separate accounts, and joint ventures.

Our mission is to be a trusted partner to our investors, tenants, creditors, employees, and communities while delivering top tier, risk-adjusted returns, and outperforming industry benchmarks. Culturally, we value intellectual curiosity, rigorous analysis, creative problem-solving, a collaborative spirit and a willingness to be accountable and to take initiative.

DESCRIPTION:

We are currently seeking a Senior Accountant to join our accounting team in Menlo Park. The role will primarily be responsible for closing property, fund or management entity books. The position will report to our Vice President, Controller and will receive guidance and instruction from our Assistant Controller.
This is a dynamic position offering career development as our portfolio continues to grow and our investment offerings evolve.

A successful candidate will be a team player that is comfortable working in a challenging, fast-paced environment.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Close monthly GAAP and tax basis accounting for assigned commercial real estate and management/fund entities
Ensure monthly books are reconciled and closed on an accurate and timely basis
Ensure monthly operating activity is in line with budget, investigate and understand significant variances
Work with Controller and/or Assistant Controller to prepare annual financial statements which will be audited by Menlo’s external auditors
Prepare monthly bank account reconciliations
Assist in the interim, quarters and year-end audit or review process, which will include providing requisite PBCs to Menlo’s external auditors
Maintain and ensure internal controls are operating effectively
Calculates and records appropriate depreciation and amortization of fixed assets, tenant improvements, and leasing commissions

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:

Assist in the review of tax workpapers and K-1s prior to issuance.
Assist in the quarterly distribution process.
Assist the Controller or Assistant Controller in the preparation of internal and external financial reporting.
Provide support and assistance to the Treasury and Accounts Payable group(s) on an occasional basis.

REQUIRED EDUCATION:

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or other relevant business discipline

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS:

2-5 years of real estate or financial accounting experience or general ledger responsibilities for partnership entities in a private equity/investment firm is preferred
Knowledge of US GAAP
Experience with Yardi Voyager enterprise accounting system preferred
Strong MS computer skills (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) required
Must be a detail-oriented, self-starter with good oral and written communication and strong time management skills
Must be a team player willing to support and assist others when called upon

All offers of employment are contingent upon satisfactory results of a comprehensive pre-hire background check including criminal, education, and employment verification.

Salary Range: $95,000 to $125,000 annually depending on experience.

This position is also eligible for a semi-annual bonus and other forms of incentive compensation based on the successful completion of defined performance objectives.

We offer a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical and dental insurance, VSP, and a firm sponsored 401K plan with a safe harbor matching component.

JT: Annual Giving and Donor Events Manager
JD:
The Girls’ Middle School

Imagine a school where each day is alive with learning and the spirit of adventure. Since its founding in 1998, The Girls’ Middle School (GMS) has been committed to progressive education and innovative programming, meeting the needs of a wide range of middle school students who make up our vibrant, inclusive community. Our project-based curriculum encourages creative problem-solving, collaborative teamwork, and independent thought. GMS educates girls* during a pivotal time in their lives. Students develop self-knowledge, confidence, and leadership skills supported by a staff highly attuned to their changing emotional and social needs. GMS encourages girls to find their voices, take risks, and become self-reliant. Learn more about GMS: www.girlsms.org.

*At GMS, “girls” refers to cis girls, trans girls, non-binary youth, gender non-conforming youth, gender queer youth, and any girl-identified youth.

Mission

The Girls’ Middle School educates girls at a crucial time in life. We create an inclusive environment where academic growth is nourished. A GMS girl discovers her strengths and expresses her voice while respecting the contributions of others.

The Position

Reporting to the Director of Advancement, the Annual Giving and Donor Events Manager supports the Advancement department in meeting the financial and community engagement goals of the organization. Core job responsibilities include executing the strategy for annual donor activities and development of non-major donors, including managing the donor database and related records; working with fundraising and event volunteers to manage and execute all fundraising and donor cultivation events. The Annual Giving and Donor Events Manager will manage a portfolio of donors and prospects giving small to medium size annual gifts. In addition, the Annual Giving and Donor Events Manager will manage various aspects of our annual fundraising campaigns, the annual Bennett Scholars Event, and other donor cultivation events and activities.

Job Summary

GMS is seeking a passionate Advancement professional to work closely with the Director of Advancement in developing and implementing strategies to achieve multi-faceted goals. The Annual Giving and Donor Events Manager joins a strong collaborative team. This team member will manage The GMS Fund (annual giving), The Bennett Scholars Breakfast (our signature advancement event), as well as additional programs and events.

General Responsibilities

Partner with the Director of Advancement to execute the annual giving campaign, The GMS Fund.
Plan, organize, implement and attend donor events.
Manage the interdependencies of contributing teams to successfully implement GMS major giving campaigns.
Collaborate with the Director of Advancement and team to plan and successfully execute the Bennett Scholars Breakfast. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to, production of invitations and promotional materials, venue coordination, volunteer management, and run-of-show production.
Effectively manage numerous outside service providers such as photographers, graphic designers, AV providers, caterers, etc.
Write a wide range of fundraising communications such as appeal letters and annual fund brochures. Collaborate with GMS Communications Manager on impact reports, website content, constituent communications, etc.
Attend monthly Board of Trustees Advancement Committee meetings; responsible for taking and distributing meeting minutes.
Collaborate with the Advancement Associate on donor research to draft solicitation meeting briefing notes for the Director of Advancement, Head of School, and other solicitors.
Partner with internal stakeholders to proactively identify and resolve roadblocks.
As part of the GMS team, assist faculty and staff in providing Administration supervision duties for students when necessary.

Alum Affairs and Parent Coordination

Annual and long-term planning: Working with the Director of Advancement, develop a short and long term engagement program for GMS Alums and their families.
Alum Events: Calendar, plan, implement and attend alum events such as Class reunions, Almost Alums ceremonies, etc.
Outreach: Initiate, manage, and implement a robust outreach program that includes, but is not limited to, Alum communications, GMS Fund solicitations, Bennett Scholars Breakfast campaign, College Care Packages, the Gryphon Society, and 25th Anniversary engagement.

Skills and Abilities

Excellent verbal and written communication skills and experience conceptualizing, writing and coordinating campaign materials.
Ability to develop effective professional relationships with a diverse spectrum of donors, vendors, faculty, staff and volunteers.
Proficiency with G Suite, Word, Excel. Working knowledge of Constant Contact and Raiser’s Edge is a plus.
Understanding of the sound judgment required in relation to confidential projects, personnel, school, or student matters.
Embodies a cooperative team approach with colleagues and a willingness to take on responsibilities beyond those explicitly defined.
The ability to demonstrate grace under pressure and creatively problem-solve.
Enthusiasm for the values and mission of The Girls’ Middle School.
Professional development/fundraising/event experience; bachelor’s degree required
Proven managerial skills and the ability to develop and inspire staff and volunteers
Strong proofreading skills
Superb organization and administrative skills
Flexibility and high tolerance for change and ambiguity
Must be physically able to assist, when necessary, with event set-up and breakdown, including lifting up to 25 lbs.

This is a full-time position. Occasional weekends and evening work.

Education and/or Experience

Minimum 5 years of Development experience including demonstrated success in individual giving, corporate sponsorship, alumni giving, and special events fundraising and management(preferably at an independent school), and an undergraduate degree or similar training is required; a relevant advanced degree is a plus. Knowledge of fundraising principles and project management best practices is expected.

Equity, inclusion, and belonging are at the heart of our mission. The Girls’ Middle School was founded on the core belief that diverse and inclusive communities are strong communities. We are committed to creating a school culture that welcomes all aspects of each individual’s identity. We welcome applications from those with experience outside the educational field. We are actively seeking individuals who value equitable education and are committed to fostering an environment of belonging for our diverse student body.

The Girls’ Middle School is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer committed to a policy of equal treatment and opportunity in every aspect of its hiring and promotion process without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sexual orientation, partnership status, gender and/or gender identity or expression, marital, parental or familial status, national origin, ethnicity, veteran or military status, age, disability, or any other legally protected basis.

Compensation and Benefits:

Comprehensive Employee Health Benefits (full medical, dental & vision coverage)
Retirement matching
Access to engaging and personalized professional development
The Girls’ Middle School uses a competitive salary scale. The salary for this position ranges from $70,000 to $110,000, commensurate with experience.

Interested candidates

Please send a resume and cover letter to Employment at employment@girlsms.org.

OVERVIEW

SSB Construction in Salinas, CA is seeking a Construction Project Manager with 10+ years of experience to manage multiple commercial clients and projects. We would love to have you join our dynamic and growing team!

This is a fast-moving job that requires detail orientation, time management, and the ability to make decisions quickly and correctly.
This position is all about building and maintaining relationships, both within the company and with our customers and subcontractors. Communication skills are critical.
Ideal candidate is friendly, curious, and willing to learn about both our company and our customers.
This position does involve managing others with a positive attitude and careful follow-up to ensure that work is being done correctly and efficiently. Necessary corrections should be made in a constructive and supportive manner.
We are looking for someone who can motivate others, respond to their needs, and effectively communicate the company’s policies and programs in a positive way.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Project Development and Design Management: Negotiate with client contacts and design team to manage commercial/industrial construction projects through all phases (development, budgeting, design, and permitting).
Project Estimating: Review new job opportunities and meet with potential clients to understand their long-term needs. Attend job walks, prepare takeoffs, and solicit and review estimates from vendors and subcontractors. Prepare detailed project estimate for leadership review and submit according to requirements.
Project Management: Represent SSB in a professional manner at all times while serving as the main liaison between the office and field, owners, architects, engineers, and subcontractors. Manage teams to ensure that all quality and safety goals are met while completing the project on time and within budget. This includes supervising and supporting the superintendent, foreman, and administrative staff.
Client Relations: Review monthly billings. Keep in regular communication with clients to understand their needs, resolve issues, and ensure successful completion of project. Maintain positive relationship to ensure client satisfaction and increase potential for additional business.
Subcontractor Management: Conduct and report on project meetings with subcontractors and owners. Ensure timely issuance and execution of subcontracts. Review and approve all subcontractor invoices.
Safety: Assist in promoting and enforcing SSB’s rigorous safety program.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Permit Coordination: Obtain all necessary building operational and safety permits for the project.
Schedule Management: Create and manage construction schedule from initial development through completion. Provide timely updates on any changes or impacts. Develop solutions to present to clients.
Cost Management: Create overall project budget and manage costs throughout design and construction. Drive efforts for value engineering and change management as needed to maintain or adjust budget. Provide reporting updates as needed or requested by client.
Contract Administration: Understand all contract documents and oversee change management, closeout, and reporting.
Teamwork: Support and receive support from other team members to resolve issues and maximize team success.

IDEAL CHARACTERISTICS

Proven success at balancing different activities across multiple projects in a fast-paced environment.
Customer-first attitude and dedication to building long-term business relationships.
Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to a range of different audiences.
Expertise in maintaining established standards of quality and accuracy as well as an ability to develop innovative improvements to existing standards and procedures.
Drive, determination, and a self-disciplined approach to achieving results.
Ability to solicit input from team members, build consensus within a team environment, lead by example, and follow up in a friendly manner to ensure proper results.
Specialized problem solving and ingenuity while working within approved organizational systems and technology.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Demonstrated ability to set and achieve skill development goals and exceed client expectations
Knowledge of modern construction management tools and software
10 years construction related experience, including managing foreman and field teams

About SSB Construction

Having built a strong reputation for integrity, hard work, and craftsmanship since 1945, SSB Construction provides a positive culture of teamwork and support. We are continuing to grow and expand, both in the number of projects we oversee and the types of construction services we provide to our clients.

At SSB, our motto is “Solid Sustainable Building.” We are driven to help our clients meet their needs and give back to the communities we serve. Our work helps drive the economic growth and vitality of the local region.

SSB Construction is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital status, disability, or veteran status. We look forward to receiving your application and learning more about you.

Semiconductor / High Tech industry

HPSP is a leading manufacturer of processing equipment for the semiconductor industry. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates for our Engineering Manager position for our Silicon Valley branch.

This individual will assume lead responsibility for design, develop and assess mechanical and electro-mechanical equipment and systems used in semiconductor equipment. Familiar with automation, high purity gas delivery systems, pressure and temperature sensors, pressure vessels, and clean room furnace equipment.

The ideal candidate would be a highly motivated individual contributor that has the vision and initiative to provide technical leadership on the assigned projects.

Job Description:

· Thorough knowledge of mechanical design, mechanics and material science concepts, heat transfer / thermal analysis, stress analysis, and system integration

About Us
Coulomb Solutions Inc. (CSI) provides innovative electrification solutions for commercial vehicles including advanced Li-ion HV batteries, battery heating and cooling systems, electric air conditioning compressors, electric steering pumps, electric air compressors for braking, DC/DC converters, accessory Inverters and onboard AC and fast DC Chargers. As our cornerstone, CSI is the authorized North American distributor of commercial vehicle batteries for the largest Li-Ion battery designer and manufacturer of the world, CATL. Quality Coordinator/ ISO 9001 Documentation Specialist
Reports to: Quality Manager
Location: Livermore, CA

Job Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Quality Coordinator to assist our company in achieving ISO 9001 certification. This role will be responsible for creating, implementing, and maintaining the necessary documentation and processes in line with ISO 9001 standards. You will work closely with various departments within the organization, gathering input, developing comprehensive documents, and ensuring compliance with ISO 9001 requirements. This role requires a strong understanding of ISO 9001 standards and experience in creating and managing quality management systems.

Responsibilities:

Collaborate with key stakeholders across departments to gather high-level input and understand the organization's processes, procedures, and quality requirements.
Develop, review, and revise documentation, including quality manuals, procedures, work instructions, forms, and other related documents such as control plan, inspection instructions, to align with ISO 9001 standards.
Create and maintain an organized documentation system to ensure easy access and retrieval of information.
Conduct gap analysis to identify areas where current processes and practices do not comply with ISO 9001 requirements and work with teams to develop effective solutions.
Assist in the development and implementation of new quality management processes, ensuring they are aligned with ISO 9001 standards.
Train employees on ISO 9001 standards, documentation requirements, and quality management practices.
Conduct internal audits to assess compliance with ISO 9001 standards and identify opportunities for improvement.
Participate in external audits conducted by certification bodies and assist in addressing any non-conformances identified during the audit.
Monitor and analyze quality metrics to identify trends and areas for improvement and propose corrective and preventive actions.
Stay up to date with the latest revisions and updates to ISO 9001 standards and incorporate necessary changes into the documentation and processes.
Additional duties as required, including but not limited to creation of work instructions, inspection instructions, data analysis, completion of product inspections, and so on.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field, such as quality management, or engineering. Relevant certifications in quality management, such as ISO 9001 Auditor, ASQ certificates are highly desirable.
3-5 years’ experience in quality field, automotive industry is preferred.
Proven experience in developing and implementing quality management systems, preferably within the framework of ISO 9001.
Strong knowledge of ISO 9001 standards and requirements, with the ability to interpret and apply them effectively to various processes.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to create clear and concise documentation and effectively communicate complex concepts.
Attention to detail and a strong commitment to accuracy in documentation and process development.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify areas for improvement and propose effective solutions.
Experience in conducting internal audits and addressing non-conformances is preferred
Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and build positive relationships across the organization.
Proficiency in document management systems and software applications.
Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.

Physical Job Requirements

Constantly access, enter, and retrieve data by using a computer terminal.
Frequent communication and exchange of information via phone and email.
Must be able to remain in a stationary position, as well as move about for extended periods of time.

Travel

The position is expected to have very limited travel.

Compensation & Benefits

Base salary range of $67k - $90k, depending on qualifications, skills and experience
Fully paid health, dental and vision benefits for employees
401(k) with employer match
Flexible Spending Account
Paid Time Off

Joining our team as a Quality Coordinator provides an exciting opportunity to contribute to our company's quality management efforts and play a key role in achieving ISO 9001 certification. If you are a motivated and detail-oriented professional with a passion for quality, we would love to hear from you.

Job Summary: The Safety Coordinator will be responsible for ensuring that all construction activities are performed in a safe and compliant manner, in accordance with industry regulations and company policies. The successful candidate will work closely with the project management team, and construction workers to promote and maintain a culture of safety.

Key Responsibilities of Safety Coordinator:

Implement a site-specific safety program for each construction project, in accordance with applicable regulations and company policies.
Conduct regular safety audits and inspections of the construction site to identify potential hazards and ensure compliance with safety standards.
Develop and deliver safety training programs to all employees, including new employee orientation, on-site safety meetings, and specialized training as required.
Investigate accidents, incidents, and near-misses, and implement corrective actions to prevent recurrence.
Maintain accurate records of all safety-related incidents, inspections, and training.
Communicate with project management and safety team on safety issues and concerns.
Review and approve job specific safety plans and ensure compliance with their safety policies.
Coordinate and conduct regular emergency response drills and ensure that all workers are familiar with emergency procedures.
Stay current with changes in safety regulations and best practices, and ensure that the company's safety program reflects these changes.

Qualifications for Safety Coordinator:

(Preferred) Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent work experience.
Bilingual in Spanish and English Preferred
Minimum of 3 years of experience in construction safety.
Knowledge of OSHA and other relevant safety regulations.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to develop and deliver effective safety training programs.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
Detail-oriented and organized.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office.
Ability to travel to various job locations
A valid driver’s license with a clean driving record.

Physical Requirements for Safety Coordinator:

Ability to walk and stand for extended periods of time.
Ability to climb ladders and stairs.
Ability to wear personal protective equipment, including hard hats, safety glasses, and steel-toed boots.
Ability to lift and carry up to 50 pounds.

Working Conditions for Safety Coordinator:

Work is performed primarily on construction sites and may involve exposure to hazards such as noise, dust, chemicals, and heavy machinery.
May be required to work irregular hours or shifts, depending on project needs.

The Safety Coordinator will play a critical role in ensuring that all construction activities are conducted safely, efficiently, and in compliance with all relevant regulations and policies. If you have the required qualifications and are passionate about promoting a culture of safety in construction, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

JD:
The program supervisor serves in the field as the manager responsible for the case, mastering daily case management skills, including developing and overseeing clinical programs, supervising Behavior Technicians, and providing education and training for client caregivers. The Program Manager will provide clinical skills instruction and behavior reduction protocols based upon the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis to children with Autism and related developmental disabilities in the home, community, school, and clinic settings. The Program Manager will collect data on programs, assist with parent training, and implement programs developed by a Board Certified Behavior Analyst which are individualized for each client.

Essential components of this position are listed below but are subject to change at the discretion of Behavior Nation LLC. This job description describes essential job functions but does not provide an exhaustive list of duties that may be assigned.

Responsibilities and Duties:

Deliver clear, concise, constructive, and actionable communications, insights, and feedback to staff and client families with professionalism, HR-compliant language, and a spirit of customer service.

Efficiently produce each client’s clinical programs, reports, and other supervision documents accurately and completely in compliance with contracted (billable) hours.

Directly supervise, train, and support BIs, from entry-level to advanced, to successfully exhibit the necessary confidence and authority to build rapport with families and conduct effective sessions from Day 1, regardless of, and in alignment with, their personal level of experience.

Provide coverage for peers during their absences and provide direct therapy to clients if the BI is absent and other coverage is not available.

Respect the time of colleagues and client families by maintaining a punctual, consistent, reliable schedule, and inspiring others to reflect the same attitude and share the commitment.

Provide training and ongoing support to caregivers and family members tailored to support their communication and learning styles, and cultural needs.

Maintain professional, regular, and effective (timely and accurate) communication with client families and all colleagues (administrative and clinical).

Produce clinical and administrative duties and paperwork with accuracy and timeliness and in compliance with the contracted (billable) hours allotted.

With a spirit of leadership and teamwork, attend and lead the clinical team and training meetings.

Comply with the company’s policies, procedures, timelines, and budgets.

Assist in the effective development and delivery of ABA and other services as needed by their supervisor and area director.

Billable Hours Requirements: Minimum of 25 hours per week or per current company policy.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Self‐disciplined: Able to schedule and attend client appointments and clinical team meetings with consistency, reliability, and punctuality.

Excellent written and spoken communication: Clear language, accurate grammar, and spelling.

Excellent time management skills: Understands how to allocate working days between billable hours and non-billable hours, onsite (direct) and in‐office (indirect) supervision hours.

Excellent interpersonal skills: Builds rapport with clients and with colleagues, and cultivates rapport between the clinical team and the client's family.

Excellent team player attitude and customer service orientation: Aligned with organizational practices, and working in service to client families and colleagues, regardless of their position.

Ability to give and receive constructive feedback.

Bilingual skills are valued.

Basic & Physical Requirements:

Must be able to lift 30 to 60 pounds.

Must be able to lift and carry clients with adaptive equipment.

Must be able to assume and maintain a variety of postures (kneeling, squatting, crawling, sitting, standing) for extended periods of time.

Must be able to sit on the floor or stand for extended periods of time.

Must be willing and able to restrain/hold/transport and utilize quick body movements as indicated in the Behavior Intervention Plan in the course of working with children with challenging behaviors.

Must have the manual dexterity to perform specific computer and electronic device functions, and paper means for data collection.

Must be physically present at the assigned job location, which may include home, school, community, and clinical placements.

Must be able to receive detailed information through oral communication.

Must have visual acuity to read and comprehend written communication through a computer, electronic devices, and paper means.

Must have reliable transportation and be willing and able to travel between different job sites within the San Francisco Bay Area.

Must have a valid California Driver’s License & insurance in good standing.

Must maintain a professional appearance with regard to clothing, grooming, hair, and make-up.

Must pass a criminal background check (Clean DOJ/FBI record).

Must have or be able to acquire First Aid/CPR Certification.

Must have or be able to successfully complete RBT certification if does not have BCaBA certification.

Must pass TB test, and have up-to-date immunization record (per company requirements).

Strong interest in working with individuals impacted by neurodevelopmental disorders.

Experience:

Experience working with children ages 18 months and older providing in a classroom or 1:1 setting.

Experience implementing the principles of Applied Behavior Analysis.

Educational, Speech, or Allied Health Services experience.

Education:

Required:

Bachelor’s Degree + 12-semester units in applied behavior analysis + 1 year of experience in implementing behavior modification intervention services OR;

Bachelor’s Degree + 2 years of experience in implementing behavior modification intervention services + RBT Certification OR;

Board Certified Associate Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) certification.

Preferred:

Master’s degree in Psychology, Education, Applied Behavior Analysis, Speech, and Hearing Services, or related field Board Certified Associate Behavior Analyst (BCaBA) certification.

Benefits Of Working With Behavior Nation:

Highly competitive pay depending on experience.

Monthly bonus opportunities (eligibility per company policy).

Professional Development Opportunities and Training.

Opportunities to attend conferences (per company policy).

Paid Training.

Sick and vacation days.

401(k) per company policy.

Paid drive time and mileage.

Opportunities for career advancement.

Medical and dental benefits for full-time employees.

Company laptop and other digital devices.

Diamond Foundry Inc. is the global leader in single-crystal diamond technology. We produce single-crystal diamond (SCD) wafers by crystallizing greenhouse gas into diamond using proprietary plasma reactors powered by zero-emission energy. Founded in 2012 in San Francisco, California by Stanford/M.I.T./Princeton engineers, Diamond Foundry Inc. received $315MM in funding and has had a multi-year track record of profitable fast growth.

We are looking for a dedicated and self-driven Metrology Engineer to help us make our world leading diamond production technology even better. You'll be an integral part of an experienced team of mechanical, electrical, and materials engineers, and at the interface between R&D and production operations in our SSF facility. The position will involve hands-on work with commercial and custom characterization equipment, development of automation, standardization, and throughput optimization strategies, as well as conducting experiments.

Typical salary ranges for this position is $120k - $170k + position is eligible for company shares. Actual compensation may be higher or lower in the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to a candidate’s job duties, experience, and expertise. We will also consider higher level candidates and salary will be adjusted accordingly.

Responsibilities:

Characterizing novel and existing products and establishing critical performance parameters that feed back into production and R&D processes.
Taking ownership of existing instrumentation and leading expansion / customization of capabilities in accordance with company needs.
Driving and coordinating development of innovative metrology equipment and strategies from proof-of-concept to implementation into manufacturing.
Developing metrology automation concepts for throughput maximization and resource distribution optimization.
Effectively communicating results and recommending course of action.
Working across multidisciplinary teams to attack challenges ranging from demonstration of capability to production deployment.
Acting as point of contact and knowledgeable resource for area specific questions and/or challenges.
Partner with vendors to evaluate new metrology equipment and technologies, upgrade existing tools, expand capacity/throughput.

Requirements:

PhD with 4+ years or Bachelor's degree with 8+ years of relevant experiences in Physics, Material Science, or Engineering from a top university.
Strong understanding of physical principles in the area of crystallography and ability to apply them in an industrial manufacturing environment.
Expert in crystallographic techniques such as X-ray diffraction, X-ray tomography.
Experience in introducing new metrology equipment into a production line and establishing performance metrics.
Expert in data collection and analysis / interpretation, as well as presentation of experimental findings, DOE, SPC.
Proficient in measurement & analysis automation / scripting (e.g. LabVIEW, Python).
Effective communication and ability to thrive in a cross-functional development team.
Comprehensive knowledge of crystal structure and electronic properties of carbon materials is a plus.
Position requires successful candidate to be onsite.

Diamond Foundry believes in supporting our employees from the workplace to their personal and home life. We provide eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work. Perks include employee discounts to VRAI and catered lunches for onsite staff. All benefits offered are available starting your first day.

Diamond Foundry is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor under federal, state or local law

Design, build and support electrical control solutions/applications for electro-mechanical machines manufactured for use in the global packaging industry. Expand, refine and optimize PLC programs and HMI screens to improve machine speed, performance, ease of operation and maintenance.

Coordinate the assembly, testing and validation of ELUM products, including the installation and technical support of PLC-based hardware and software. Document designs/programs and create troubleshooting guides and training instructions for use by machinery assemblers and operators.

Based on customer experience and field service reports, recommend and define solutions to enhance customer experience and avoid system malfunctions. Provide direct troubleshooting and fault resolution assistance to customers and field service technicians.

Investigate industry trends and research alternative solutions to resolve technical issues and achieve machine performance objectives. Develop and utilize component selection criteria to achieve appropriate cost/benefit balance.

Reports to and works under the immediate supervision of the Senior Electrical Controls Engineer. Interfaces regularly with mechanical engineers.

PLC, HMI and Servo Motion Programming skills and familiarity with networking standards.

Must have experience with DC to 440 VAC 3 PH motors and controls from installation to startup and troubleshooting.
Familiar with PID control loop tuning.
Experience in sensor testing, calibration, and trouble-shooting.
Proficient in AutoCAD Electrical
Machine building experience is a plus. Packaging or labeling machinery experience is a plus.
Bilingual English/Spanish preferred.

Project Manager Job Summary

Ownership of all aspects of the project from pre-construction through closeout and beyond
Establish and manage the administrative requirements of a project in conformance with Project Management Procedures.
Review, understand, and comply with all the requirements of the contract between owner and contractor.
Review and understand the Project Estimate; develop and manage cost control and document control procedures for each project.
Responsible and accountable for Total Project Delivery, including project costs, scheduling, client relationships, and profitability.

As a TAC Administrator, you will be a frontline contact for our Enterprise Customers. You will have significant interaction (phone, emails, and ticketing) with our customers and our internal engineering team on service requests, projects, and escalations. You will be responsible for the day-to-day operation of the customer's Technical Support desk in the Technical Assistance Center (TAC), act as a liaison between customers and engineers to ensure exceptional customer service. Candidates are required to have at least 3-5 years of experience in technical support/Help Desk environments and 1 year of customer service experience for this position.

The TAC Administrator oversees and coordinates the activities of technical support teams, ensuring clients and staff receive optimal support and service. Work closely with the team, senior leadership, communications and programmatic colleagues, and others to support the overall work of the organization. Demonstrate initiative and be effective and a creative problem-solver, work independently and on teams, manage multiple priorities under tight deadlines, excellent analytical skills, strong attention to detail, ability to learn and master information quickly, ability to identify and understand trends that affect AMS.

This position will also interface with the customer and internal teams as needed to coordinate the RMA returns. The TAC Administrator will work directly with customers to address their needs and expectations. This position is also responsible for receiving customer product returns and helping to perform post return analysis and follow-up.

Responsibilities:

Monitor and process incoming requests via email, phone as per established SLA guidelines and priorities.
Manage ticket queues as per establish SLA guidelines and priorities.

Escalate the case to the appropriate resources when troubleshooting efforts are not enough to resolve the issue and share all the gathered information with the next level of escalation.
Develop an understanding of the AMS.NET ecosystem and provide effective coordination for clients.
Under management supervision, monitor/manage service contracts, and take needed actions to address any contract balance issues and notify appropriate parties when escalation is required.
Work with cross-functional teams supporting our customers.
Communicate effectively with both internal and external senior-level management to understand customer needs.
Interface with vendors to directly authorize returns from the customer.
Handle the day-to-day RMA Receiving activities (utilizing Salesforce and the RMA tracking database).
Perform basic analysis on RMA returns.

Prior experience in IT helpdesk, NOC or IT Technical Support.

Familiarity with Microsoft Windows operating systems, and Microsoft Office Products.
Ability to communicate complex technical terms in an easy to understand, non-technical manner.
Knowledge of escalation.
Active team player, self-starter, and multitasker who can quickly adjust priorities.
Comfortable working across multiple departments in a deadline-driven environment.
RMA Receiving activities utilizing Salesforce.

3-5 years of experience in technical support/Help Desk environments are mandatory.

Science Teacher / Outdoor Educator

Are you an experienced, imaginative, and collaborative educator who believes in progressive education? Do you enjoy creating meaningful learning experiences, and being part of a diverse, supportive and talented community? If so, please consider joining our team at Tessellations. We are currently accepting applications for a full-time Science Teacher / Outdoor Educator position within our unique Nature Connections program. The position would start immediately. Competitive salary and full benefits available.

Tessellations is a progressive K-8 non-profit school for gifted learners based in Cupertino, CA. Our mission is to provide challenging experiential education that recognizes and nurtures the individual strengths of gifted learners, empowering them to confidently express who they are and pursue a meaningful life. At Tessellations, community is a core value, as it is the reason our small and mighty school was able to form and thrive despite the global pandemic. Our team consists of passionate, qualified and dedicated staff from diverse backgrounds and includes nationally renowned gifted experts. Our first year was online only. In our second year, we quadrupled in size, and we also added our Nature Campus. We’re in our fourth year with excellent staff and student retention, and extremely high family satisfaction. We moved to a larger campus in order to house our growing population, and in Fall 2024 we will launch our high school.

The Nature Connections program consists of weekly classes provided to all students and is primarily designed to take place at our Nature Campus located in the nearby foothills of the Santa Cruz Mountains. The Nature Connections curriculum provides students with rich project-based experiences related to environmental sciences and the surrounding ecosystem as well as activities that foster wellness, community building, and wilderness skills. Naturalists lead science lessons and facilitate a wide range of outdoor experiences to allow students to deepen their connection with and sense of belonging in the natural world. Our blossoming Nature Journey curriculum is connected with students' on-campus experiences and Homeroom Journeys, extending homeroom learning and content beyond the classroom walls.

If you join our team you will help us grow our program and continue designing and delivering a rich, immersive learning experience. You will be heard, respected, and celebrated for your talents and efforts. You will work with students who love to learn, engaged parents who are grateful for your work, and supportive colleagues that will help bring out your best.

Primary Responsibilities

Create and foster a safe and supportive learning environment where all students feel heard
Assist with the development of an outdoor education curriculum and related content that integrates environmental education standards, English Language Arts, Social Studies, Art, Indigenous History, and Science
Implement lessons, activities, and instruction while adapting to the intellectual, physical, and social-emotional needs of students as they arise
Help plan, organize, and attend fieldwork and overnight trips
Maintain organizational systems in physical and digital space
Regularly use and maintain documentation of multiple forms of assessment to gauge student learning and inform next steps in teaching
Work collaboratively with a team of Naturalists and other staff members to develop the year-long curriculum
Attend staff meetings and actively engage with professional development opportunities
Attend family-teacher meetings as scheduled and as needed to support student learning
Prepare report card narratives
Complete other duties and responsibilities as required to ensure student safety and educational instruction.

Requirements

Prior experience teaching students in Elementary and Middle School
Prior studies, familiarity with, and experience learning and teaching Natural History and science
Prior experience teaching in the outdoors
Proficiency with technology (Google Suite in particular)
Willingness to drive a 12-passenger vehicle to transport students, if able
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Social-emotional teaching experience
Enthusiastic life-long learner
Experience in a school setting
Openness and flexibility in designing improved learning experiences
Passing a criminal background check upon hire

Bonus Points

Experience with Primary (K-3) learners and/or Middle (6th-8th) learners
Experience teaching gifted learners
Curriculum development experience for programs spanning one semester or longer
Familiarity with and commitment to DEIJ work and restorative justice practices
Prior experience coordinating and leading fieldwork and camping experiences with students
Work experience in the Earth and/or Life Sciences
Class B driver's license with 15 passenger endorsement, or willingness to get one if able to do so

Compensation

Salary range: $70,000 - $95,000

Benefits include medical, dental, vision, life, 401(k), flexible spending account, paid time off, holidays, and school breaks.

To Apply

Please submit a cover letter and resume. For more information about our school, visit https://tessellations.school.

Tessellations is an Equal Opportunity Employer — we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant on the bases of race, color, gender, national origin, age, religion, creed, disability, sex, or reproductive health decision making.

VOLUNTEER COORDINATOR

Sourcewise Mission:

Provides adults and their caregivers the tools and services they need to effectively navigate their health and life options. Through a comprehensive network of resources, Sourcewise strives to educate, prepare, support, and advocate for all adults, their families, and their caregivers within Santa Clara County.

Program Description:

The Health Insurance Counseling & Advocacy Program (HICAP) is administered by Sourcewise Community Resource Solutions. HICAP advocates for senior health care rights and assists with obtaining entitlement to their Medicare health care benefits. HICAP also provides objective counseling and information allowing clients to make informed decisions about Medicare supplements, Medicare prescription drug coverage, Medicare Advantage plans, and long-term care insurance. HICAP conducts outreach and education about Medicare and long-term care topics. HICAP supports a group of state registered volunteer counselors who are instrumental in providing these services throughout Santa Clara County.

The HICAP Volunteer Coordinator will report to the HICAP Volunteer Supervisor. This role will support the day-to-day activities involved in recruiting, training, supporting, evaluating, recognizing, correcting, and maintaining communication with HICAP volunteers according to California Department of Aging (CDA) and Administration on Community Living (ACL) guidelines. The Volunteer Coordinator receives program direction from, and reports program activities to, the Sourcewise HICAP Volunteer Supervisor.

REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree or three or more years’ experience coordinating volunteers, seniors, people with disabilities, and/or community groups.
Demonstrated ability in public speaking, telephone communication skills and advocacy efforts.
Ability to learn and build out different software platforms, such as Rosterfy, iSpring, and MS 365 applications.
Proficient in Microsoft 365 Excel, Word, Microsoft Teams, and SharePoint

PREFERRED

Demonstrated capacity to work efficiently in a multi-cultural context and experience working in ethnically and racially diverse communities.
Knowledge of Medicare and related health insurance options and benefits.
Ability to use training or teaching software platforms with older adults.

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Perform HICAP volunteer recruitment activities including screening potential volunteers to ensure capability, no conflict of interest, and awareness of all HICAP requirements verbally and in writing. Recommend volunteers to HICAP Supervisor and HICAP Director for approval.
Conduct volunteer recruitment to ensure equity in HICAP services. This includes, but is not limited to, onboarding volunteers with English second language abilities.
Support Volunteer Supervisor in all stages of the volunteer onboarding, training, and support process.
Organize new counselor training to provide up-to-date information on HICAP, Medicare, Long Term Care, and other volunteer training needed to prepare and support a vibrant volunteer force.
Maintains the master list of HICAP Counselor manuals and distributes additions and addendums as necessary.
Track HICAP volunteer counseling and education hours and develop plans to ensure counselors reach the minimum hours calendar year.
Provide updates and reports to HICAP Volunteer Supervisor as requested.
Conduct regular evaluation of volunteers. Identify and report volunteer issues promptly and provide solutions.
Organize recognition of volunteers to show appreciation.
Establish and maintain counseling sites, ensuring Memorandum of Understandings (MOUs) are up to date and meet the needs of HICAP counseling activities.
Place HICAP Counselors at sites throughout the County so HICAP Counseling is available where people are at.
Enter all necessary information into the HICAP Data base – PeerPlace.
Provide HICAP counseling and assistance to clients.
Participate in outreach events with HICAP Volunteers.
Assist HICAP Director as needed.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

Not all primary responsibilities listed will be required to immediately be performed. The Volunteer Coordinator will have the opportunity to grow and develop skills by taking on additional duties.

AVAILABILITY

Monday – Friday, 8:00 am – 5:00 pm., with the ability to work remotely as needed. Ability to work in our office located at 3100 De La Cruz Blvd, Suite 310, Santa Clara. On rare occasions travel to a client’s home who is homebound may be needed.

REPORTING AND WORKING RELATIONSHIPS

The Volunteer Coordinator reports directly to the Volunteer Supervisor; works closely with other department and interdepartmental staff as approved by the Volunteer Supervisor.

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

Sourcewise is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
This is a 40 hour per week non-exempt position.

At Independent Construction Company, dedication to excellence in service has been a cornerstone of our company from the very beginning. Independent Construction owns one of the largest earth moving fleets in the United States which makes it possible to complete a multitude of aspects in construction ranging from small to very large in size, and we pride ourselves in providing service that will make our clients feel comfortable both with the finished product and with future projects they may have. We have completed thousands of projects as the general contractor working for developers, cities, and municipalities. Our work consists of grading, paving, construction management and land development. Come be a part of a legacy that has been around since 1938.

Senior Estimator

Independent Construction Company is seeking qualified applicants for the position of Senior Estimator. The ideal candidate is someone who is organized and possesses strong time management skills. This position is responsible for assisting in the development of timely bid proposals and accurate estimates for both private and public-sector grading and paving projects.

Estimating Responsibilities:

· Analyze and compile estimate data to ensure quality and timely estimates.

· Review drawings, specifications and proposed project site conditions; record findings and solicit input from field operations to include in final project estimate.

· Seek out alternative solutions and construction methods to increase competitiveness of the bid.

· Determine, review and validate “take-off” quantities to ensure accuracy of data used in estimates.

· Utilize existing cost history as a check to complete estimate.

· Analyze and evaluate bidding risks, strategies and present estimate for bid reviews with senior management for final review.

· Communicate estimate information to project manager, project superintendent, and foremen to ensure understanding of project scope and critical means and methods of construction for budget compliance.

· Provide ongoing assistance during the construction phase of successful low bids as necessary, including estimate or means and methods interpretation.

· Maintain healthy business relationships to increase bid opportunities in the regional market.

Knowledge, Skills and Strengths:

· Knowledge of construction grading and paving practices including production rates, contractual documents, plans, specifications and soils reports, etc.

· Ability to work within and comply with proposal/bidding time constraints/deadlines, individually and in a team environment.

· Previous experience with estimating software, HCSS is preferred (Bid2Win, Hard Dollar, etc.)

· Proficient with Microsoft Word and Excel.

· Ability to produce and maintain a project schedule using Primavera, SureTrak, Microsoft Scheduler or other software.

· Previous experience with AGTEK, and AutoCAD software is a plus.

· Solid leadership, supervisory, communication, decision making and organizational skills.

· Thrives in fast paced, fun, competitive work environment.

· Attention to detail while productively meeting goals is a must.

Education/Work Experience:

· Bachelor’s Degree in Construction Management, Civil Engineering, or demonstrated project management/estimating work history and related experience in lieu of degree.

· Minimum 7-10 years construction field support/management experience.

· Minimum 5 years of construction estimating support, engineering, or similar experience.

Position Summary: Kalman Manufacturing is a CNC machine shop looking for a process engineer to support the design and release to production of manufacturing processes to create customer products on our manufacturing floor. As a member of the engineering team, this engineer will work with other process engineers, production, quality, and procurement, as well as our customers and vendors, to develop the most efficient manufacturing process possible. The engineer will be responsible for participating in the overall manufacturing concept, performing detailed analysis of machine tool and process performance and requirements, developing methods of solving problems against machine tool and process performance issues, overseeing fabrication, assembly, and test of prototype and alpha-level processes, as well as finalize and support the process design through production release. Depending on the size and scope of the projects, this work may be done by the engineer alone, or as part of a small team of engineers, machinists, inspectors and designers under the direction of the process engineer. As manufacturing processes are the core of Kalman Manufacturing’s business, the position has high visibility within the business, and strong performers will become highly-valued members of the team. There is opportunity for increased levels of responsibility and corresponding career advancement.

Structure: This position reports to the Engineering Manager

Reasonable Accommodations Statement: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions

Minimum Requirements:

· High School Graduate or GED equivalent

· 10 years of experience in developing machined components in milling centers

· 5 years of experience in 4 and 5-axis milling work

· Fluency in CAD/CAM appropriate for the development of said manufacturing processes

· Theoretical understanding of the key metrics and parameters associated with the design of manufacturing processes for complex machined components

· Demonstrated technical depth in the analysis of, and development of solutions for the challenges in the fabrication and qualification of complex machined components

· Strong communication skills including demonstrated ability to create clear reports and documentation

· Ability to lead small teams of machinists, inspectors, and other skilled labor

· Enthusiastic desire to help drive engineering effort and capability of a company to best in class

Preferred Requirements:

· Bachelor’s in mechanical or manufacturing engineering, or machine tool technology or related field

· Expertise in Esprit CAM software

· Expertise in SolidWorks CAD software

· Experience in Hypermill CAM Software

· Project management capabilities centered around the development of project plans and workload/time estimates as well as reporting against project milestones, and developing solutions to close project gaps

· Experience in digital manufacturing and development of digital manufacturing capability

Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Job Description

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers, Inc.

Job Position: Structural Design Engineer

Location: Concord, CA

Firm Description:

Ficcadenti Waggoner and Castle Structural Engineers (FWC) was established in 1991 to provide structural engineering services to a diverse group of high-quality clients. FWC has over 70 employees with 4 offices nationwide.

Throughout our company, we believe that knowledge, experience, and education are the key components to be a successful partner with our clients.

FWC designs parking structures, theme parks, theaters, large retail centers, fitness centers, hotels, multifamily residential buildings, university facilities, airport facilities, and commercial buildings. We design using concrete, steel, aluminum, masonry, timber, cold formed steel, fiber reinforced plastic, and other materials.

Our qualifications and experience enable us to back our creative solutions with fundamental engineering principles. Our engineers use the latest analytical software combined with a hands-on approach with significant contractor interaction. Our design and graphics departments utilize the latest drafting and three-dimensional modeling packages to develop quality designs, reports, and construction documents.

Job Responsibilities:

We are seeking applicants with 2-5 years of experience to join our team. The job responsibilities include:

1. Designing significant structures using concrete,

steel, wood, masonry, timber, cold-formed steel, and fiber reinforced

plastic.

2. Developing designs using prefabricated construction

3. Interacting with clients

4. Conducting site inspections and interacting with contractors

5. Developing client relationships

Job Qualifications:

Applicants must have the following qualifications:

1. BS degree required; MS degree preferred

2. PE license preferred

3. Knowledge of software such as SAP, ETABS, RISA, Enercalc, Bluebeam and Revit are preferred

4. Be self-motivated

5. Be team oriented

6. Demonstrate excellent verbal and written communication skills

7. Have ability to develop innovative solutions for complex problems

Benefits and Pay:

FWC offers the following benefits and pay:

1. Base Salary: Negotiable

2. Overtime: 1.5 times base rate

3. Bonuses: Semi-annual

4. Tax deferred profit sharing for all employees: 7.5% of total annual gross compensation with 5-year vesting. 100% employer paid

5. Medical and dental: 100% employer paid

6. 401K program

7. Selected employee seminars or professional organizations: 100% paid

8. Annual retreat (Recent retreats have been at various winter or summer

resorts): 100% paid

FWC is an equal opportunity employer.  FWCSE is not accepting applicants that require sponsorship for an H-1B visa. Local candidates are preferred.
