Introduction:

SCI Consulting Group has an opening for a Project Consultant primarily to support our local cannabis policy and regulation services. Our consultants are full-time, salaried employees who target variety, diversity, and challenging projects in the roles they take on to help them grow. We are seeking candidates who reside in the San Francisco Bay Area and should:

possess or have a desire to improve their qualitative analytical skills
demonstrate strong written and verbal communication capabilities
enjoy working in an energetic and entrepreneurial setting
be highly self-managing
engage in independent thinking and creative problem-solving
understand or be interested in learning about client relationship management
be familiar with social media platforms
have conducted or have an interest in community outreach
demonstrate a desire to improve public policy
want to improve local communities

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are core values of our company. Our excellence can only be fully realized by staff who share our commitment to these values. Join our amazing team for a dynamic and fascinating career while conducting important work to improve California. There are significant promotional opportunities with increased responsibilities over time. This is an Equal Employment Opportunity.

Application Requirements:

Please submit a resume and answers to the three application questions (maximum one page per question):

Why are you interested in this position?
Can you tell us about any skills or experience you have that might be helpful in this job?
What motivates you to do a great job at work, other than the paycheck?

Company Description:

Established in 1985, SCI Consulting Group is a recognized public finance and urban economic consulting firm. Our small private firm specializes in local funding measures for California public agencies such as school districts, fire districts, cities, and counties. We conduct public opinion surveys, ballot measures, impact fee studies, and data analytics. Other consulting services include planning services (establishing new or updated financing programs for public agencies) and cannabis management (local cannabis policy implementation). We have a dynamic and collaborative work environment, a dedicated and energetic staff, and flexible work schedules. The office is located in Fairfield, California (near the intersection of I-80 and I-680, about 30 minutes from Berkeley or Walnut Creek).

Local Cannabis Policy Services:

The position will primarily support SCI’s local cannabis policy and regulation services. Since 2014, SCI has provided consulting services in support of local medicinal and adult-use cannabis policies. SCI has emerged as one of the primary consulting firms providing comprehensive local cannabis policy services in California. We assist cities and counties with developing local health and safety policies, regulations, and ordinances; equity program development to support social justice; application review and selection of optimal cannabis businesses; providing support analysis for regulatory fees for full cost recovery of agency cannabis-related costs; leading cannabis-related local tax measures; and conducting annual monitoring and compliance activities.

Duties & Responsibilities:

While projects will mainly focus on local cannabis policy and regulation services, the Consultant may assist in other focus areas such as storm drainage, flood control, groundwater sustainability, water, utility undergrounding, mosquito and vector control, vacant property taxes, landscape and lighting, parks and recreation, fire protection, and/or other special projects.

The Consultant is expected to develop the skill sets needed to serve as the lead Consultant on various projects eventually. Our training program will equip the Consultant to assume management and administration of existing clients and new consulting projects.

Initial assignments will include project planning; management of timelines; financial research and analysis; GIS mapping; database utilization; public speaking in a government forum; development of reports, resolutions, ordinances, notices, ballots, and other documents; polling projects, including development of survey and informational documents; community outreach and volunteer management; annual administration of fees, special taxes, and assessments; and some light business development.

Experience & Qualifications:

Candidate must have at least 10 years of experience in local cannabis policy, public administration, accounting, code enforcement, data analysis, or any combination thereof. A bachelor's degree in business, public policy, accounting, finance, civil engineering, data science, or a related field can substitute for two years of experience. Working for a city or county as an employee or consultant with experience providing developing ordinances and policies (such as a Management Analyst or Planner) may substitute for five years of experience.

Candidate must live within the greater San Francisco Bay Area and be willing to travel to projects throughout the State (most travel will be day trips and will not require an overnight stay). A valid California Driver's License is required. The following are additional required qualifications:

be self-motivated, possess strong analytical skills, and be able to plan and execute project tasks with minimal supervision
possess strong interpersonal and presentation skills
possess solid computer skills in an MS Office environment
effectively execute multiple projects and tasks in parallel

Qualifications not required but desired include graphic design, multilingual, social media management, data administration, community outreach, and marketing.

Compensation and Benefits:

The compensation package for this full-time position includes:

Salaries that are competitive and commensurate with experience and can range from $70,000 to $105,000 (plus bonus below)
Year-end performance-based profit-sharing bonus typically ranging from 3% to 25% of base salary
401(k) profit-sharing retirement plan with the company’s contribution determined annually (18% of base salary for several years) with no requirement for employee matching funds
Comprehensive medical and dental benefits, including 100% of premiums for employee-only coverage
Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO) plan and eight holidays with an expectation to manage time off based on project workload and ability to perform duties at a satisfactory level
Flexible work schedule and possible remote working opportunities after passing one-year probation

Hunting and Prospecting

Conduct door-to-door sales prospecting to residential and commercial properties and engage with potential customers in a friendly and professional manner, introducing Everlights products and services, including explaining our benefits to promote and sell Everlights products or services.
Continuously prospect for new leads and identify potential customers within assigned territories.
When receiving warm leads, provide in-home design consultations with businesses and homeowners to promote and sell Everlights products or services.
Develop relationships with home builders to become their exclusive holiday lighting partners.
Participate in your areas Home Builders Association to develop long-term relationships with home builders and be an active member of the association's committees.
Participate in your area's Chambers of Commerce to develop long-term relationships with local businesses and be an active member of the association's committees.

Utilize Effective Sales Skills

Follow up with customers to ensure satisfaction, address issues, and foster long-term customer relationships.
Utilize persuasive sales techniques to convince potential customers to make a purchase or schedule a follow-up appointment.
Demonstrate in-depth knowledge of the product or service, addressing customer questions or concerns.
Maintain a high level of product knowledge and stay updated on industry trends to communicate product features and advantages effectively.
Effectively handle objections and rejections, using persistence and persuasive skills to turn potential customers into sales.
Professionally represent the company, adhering to ethical standards and promoting a positive brand image.

Be an Active Sales Team Member

Participate in sales training programs and professional development activities to enhance sales skills and knowledge.
Collaborate with the sales team and management to achieve sales targets and contribute to overall sales strategies.
Stay informed about competitors' products and sales strategies to identify opportunities for differentiation.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of sales activities, customer interactions, and leads in the sales database.

Ideal Candidate Qualifications

Proven experience in sales, preferably in a door-to-door or direct sales environment.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to engage and build rapport with potential customers.
Strong persuasion and negotiation skills to effectively close sales and overcome objections.
Self-motivated and target-driven, with a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quotas.
Ability to work independently and manage time effectively to prioritize leads and maximize sales opportunities.
Resilience and perseverance to handle rejection and maintain a positive attitude throughout the sales process.
Confidence in approaching and interacting with strangers, demonstrating a friendly and professional demeanor.
Exceptional listening skills to understand customer needs and tailor sales pitches accordingly.
Proficient in using sales techniques and strategies, such as building rapport, creating urgency, and closing deals.
Basic computer skills to maintain accurate sales records and utilize sales software or customer relationship management (CRM) systems.

Mandatory Requirements

Valid driver's license and reliable transportation to travel to different locations within assigned territories.
High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or training in sales or marketing is a plus.
Flexibility to work evenings, weekends, or extended hours as necessary to reach potential customers.
Background check

We offer competitive compensation, including a *base salary plus commission, along with benefits such as health insurance, retirement plan, and paid time off. Join our dynamic team and take your career in sales to the next level!

Overview:

Job Corps is a government-funded, no-cost education and vocational training program administered by the U.S. Department of Labor that helps socioeconomically disadvantaged youth. We strive to fulfill this mission by following our Core Values of Safety, Individual Accountability, Respect, Integrity, Growth and Commitment.

Come and surround yourself with talented and professional individuals who have also taken the next step of making a difference in someone’s life.

In this role you would also be eligible to take advantage of a comprehensive benefits plan which includes medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), legal, paid holidays, vacation, and sick time.

Responsibilities:

The Registered Nurse assists in the medical assessment and treatment of students.

Conducts cursory examinations of all new students.
Conducts evaluation and treatment of students during daily sick call as per Job Corps Standing Orders.
Measures and records student vital signs, conduct cursory hearing and vision exams. Obtain and test samples utilizing department equipment per policy.
Performs phlebotomy procedures as required. Develop a working knowledge of the CDC Laboratory computer system and testing procedures per National Job Corps protocol.
Administers specified medications and notes times and amounts on patients’ charts. Assists in counting and maintaining narcotic medication logs. Observes students and report adverse reactions to medication to Health and Wellness Manager.
Schedules medical appointments for on center and community appointments.
Assist with Chronic Care Management Plans and Accommodations Plans in the CIS System.
Serves as Co-Disability Coordinator, managing and providing medical accommodations to students.
Support HEALS Committee and Activities.
Attends required staff training sessions.

Requirements:

Minimum: High school graduate plus State RN license + one year experience. Model company Core Values

Preferred: Minimum plus Job Corps or medical clinic experience.

Knowledge Required:

Sound nursing techniques.
Ability to relate effectively to student population.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Good organizational skills.
Ability to carry out instructions without constant supervision.
Must maintain CPR/First Aid certificates if not already certified.

All post offer candidates must complete and pass a background check and drug screen.

We are a 35-year General contractor based out of the Bay area with projects throughout the state. A leader in the construction industry, we've been rated a 2023 Best Place to Work in the Bay Area. Schedule: Hybrid work schedule is available, with in-office days at our location in Fremont.

Generous Benefits: Medical/dental/vision, self-elected 401(k), performance bonuses, vacation, sick leave and paid holidays.

Position Summary:

The Senior Project Manager is responsible for implementing the preconstruction, construction, commissioning and project closeout phases of a development project with an emphasis on establishing and maintaining project controls and completing projects in a timely and cost-effective manner. The Senior Construction Manager must have demonstrated skills in leadership, negotiating, coordinating and directing work of subcontractors, and in developing strong working relationships with general contractor personnel, subcontractors, inspectors, and other related parties. The Senior Construction Manager will be responsible for maintaining relationships in the construction community to provide market intelligence as well as ensure consideration for future business development opportunities.

Essential Functions:

Develops a cost-effective plan and schedule for completion of project following a logical pattern for utilization of resources.
Selects and coordinates the work of subcontractors working on various phases of the project.
Oversees performance of all trade contractors and reviews architectural and engineering drawings to make sure that all specifications and regulations are being followed.
Tracks and controls construction schedule and associated costs to achieve completion of project within time and budget.

Other requirements include, but are not limited to,

Organize and manage multiple projects effectively.
Manage cost control systems, review and analyze plans.
Facilitate the bidding/negotiations/buyout process with a general contractor.
Review all forms (bidding, construction, or other) of requests for information. (RFI’s).
Examine and negotiate change orders, and review and comment on submittals.
Must be highly skilled in budgeting and scheduling with strong verbal and writing skills.

Job Requirements:

Ability to balance competing priorities and multiple projects.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, tight deadline-oriented environment.
Ability to demonstrate initiative and a proactive approach to daily tasks.
Ability to read blueprints and deep knowledge of building methods.
Leadership ability to assist and oversee other PM’s, PMA’s, and PE’s as needed.
Excellent organizational skills.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills – articulate and diplomatic manner.
Accuracy for all work methodical accurate and consistent attention to detail.
Able to manage sensitive and sometimes confidential information.
Self-motivated and able to take responsibility for work and actions.
Punctual and reliable.

Computer Skills and Experience:

Proficiency in SAGE and Sage Paperless.
Microsoft Teams.
Intermediate to Advanced experience with, Blue Beam, Microsoft Project, On Screen take off, Excel, Outlook, Word, Zoom, Procore and Plan grid, Word and PowerPoint.

Competencies:

Integrity –Job requires being honest, accountable, and ethical.
Leadership —Job requires a willingness to lead, take charge, and offer opinions and direction.
Dependability —Job requires being reliable, responsible, dependable, and fulfilling obligations.
Attention to Detail —Job requires being careful about detail and thorough in completing work tasks.

Qualifications:

Graduate of a four-year degree program in construction management or construction science. Masters degree is a plus.
Ten or more years of construction experience working for a general contractor on projects of increasing complexity.
Ability to work under pressure and coordinate numerous activities and groups of people who need to cooperate to achieve maximum efficiency.
Good oral and written communication skills.

Physical Requirements:

Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
Must be able to physically navigate construction sites, including but not limited to walking on uneven ground, climbing stairs, ladders and/or scaffolding.
Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.

Interstate Equities Corporation (IEC)

*
The Position: Asset Manager*
Reports To: Director of Asset Management
Location: San Francisco or Los Altos, CA

*
Firm Summary:*
IEC is a vertically integrated real estate investment firm specializing in value-add, multifamily in the Bay Area and greater Los Angeles markets. We focus on adding value through opportunistic investing, strategic repositioning, and property management. Our property management company, IEC Property Services Corporation, strives to offer excellent customer service and care to residents while achieving property business plans. Founded in 1981, IEC has an exceptional 35+ year track record and is rapidly acquiring new communities, offering growth opportunities to great team members.
Position Summary:
The Asset Manager is responsible for overseeing annual business plans, fair market value, accretive analysis, and budgeting for a multifamily investment portfolio. This position reports to the Director of Asset Management. Responsibilities include but are not limited to working closely with the acquisitions team to understand and develop the business plan, collaboration with Property Management Regional Managers to plan strategic implementation, track, and monitor asset performance against the business plan, and prepare asset management reports for investors. This role is responsible for maintaining excellent working relationships with IEC team members, partners, and clients. The Asset Manager is responsible for driving the process and results, while working collaboratively with others. The Asset Manager has one direct report, the Renovation Project Manager for the NorCal region.

*
Specific responsibilities include*:

Overseeing annual business plans, fair market value, accretive analysis by working with and providing direction to financial analysts.
Complete weekly review of property metrics and status including vacancy, rental rates, traffic, delinquencies, and work orders.
Conduct monthly review of financials versus budget and work with Property Management Regional Managers to address variances.
Work closely with Property Management to address key issues, establishing benchmarks, guidelines, key performance indicators and policies to reinforce the business plan.
Oversee development of annual operational and capital expenditure budgets for portfolio assets, in accordance with the acquisition business plans.
Conduct site visits on a regular basis to review status, including but not limited to curb appeal, marketing, expenses, staffing, and capital improvements.
Analyze, propose, and implement strategic operational initiatives including training policies, ancillary income opportunities, marketing improvements, cost savings, strategic partnerships, and community improvement ideas to boost NOI and improve asset value.
Coordinate and provide direction to two Job Cost Administrators for financial reporting and budgeting.
Monitor on-site staff and activities to ensure that the operating plan is being carried out and the Company’s objectives are being satisfied regarding property and asset management policies.
Evaluate and pursue operating efficiencies, including utilities, vendor contracts and management initiatives.
Provide regular, comprehensive updates to management regarding the status of portfolio assets. Make recommendations to senior leadership to maximize results.
Plan and manage various renovation projects. Identify the appropriate scope of work for common areas, apartment interiors, and other spaces, consistent with the business plan and the specific market. Work with internal staff and/or vendors to implement on-time and budget.
Select and engage design teams, contractors, and other vendor partners to achieve repositioning results.
Write quarterly asset management reports incorporating financials performance and operational status for investors.
Create disposition memos and key operational initiatives for a successful sale.
Participate in deal due diligence, providing input on deal strengths/weaknesses, repositioning strategies, and budget assumptions.
Troubleshoot execution challenges such as leasing issues, unit downtime, vendor engagement, etc.
The Asset Manager will be expected to add significant value to the team, bringing strategic thinking and driving results.
Analyze, document, and execute ESG initiatives.

**
Candidate Qualifications:

Four-year college degree
Passionate about operations, efficiency and achieving goals.
Experience working with institutional investors.
Minimum 7 years of multifamily asset management experience.
Demonstrated leadership and teamwork skills.
Ability to work with personnel at all levels of the organization.
Excellent communication skills, verbally and in writing.
Organizational skills and extreme attention to detail.
Independent and resourceful, working autonomously but able to ask for support when needed.
Project management skills. Proven track record of managing various work-streams to complete business plans on time and budget.
Analytical skills and financial acumen. The successful candidate must be well-versed in financial calculations/metrics, pro forma analysis, and focused on Return on Cost.
A high sense of urgency.
Excellent computer skills: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, etc.
Ability to travel to Southern California and Seattle 1-2x per month.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience using Yardi Voyager
Knowledge of California markets

*
Compensation*:

Salary Range $170,000-$180,000
Annual Discretionary Performance Bonus

*
IEC offers a competitive compensation package including:*

Company paid healthcare premiums at 100%, specifically for the employee, with options to buy up.
401(k) Plan, with 4% company match
Flexible Spending/Health Savings Accounts

Ruby's Place is a haven of support and joy, offering survivors crisis services, shelter, counseling, children's services, and more. Our commitment extends to training first responders and social services providers in best practices, spreading the joy of effective trauma victim support.

Hybrid Remote/In-Person Full-Time (40 hours per week) Position in Castro Valley, CA (Exempt)

Reports To: Chief Clinical Officer

Who We Are

Ruby’s Place (RP) is an innovative nonprofit committed to ending domestic violence, human trafficking, and violent crime through hope, advocacy and connection. Our services include emergency shelter, transitional housing, rental subsidies, mental health services, and wrap around services. All our services are trauma-sensitive and client-centered and are provided at no cost to our clients. There are no barriers to participate in our programs.

Ruby's Place is led by survivors with a focus on reflection, innovation, and connection. We value diversity, and equity across all races, genders, sexualities, and abilities. We believe in fostering relationships, both in our direct service work and throughout our internal work culture. We aim to cultivate an inclusive workplace that appreciates and emphasizes the voices of those most impacted by violence including women, individuals with disabilities, people of color, and the LGBTQ+ community. We recognize these voices are vital to interrupting the cycle of violence and transforming lives towards safety, unity, and trust. We encourage those with lived experience with housing instability, trafficking, domestic violence, and interpersonal violence to join our team.

Who You Are

You have a strong commitment to the field of mental health as well as an understanding of, and sensitivity to, serving diverse populations. You have excellent interpersonal skills, the willingness to expand on your knowledge of trauma sensitive care and an orientation towards survivor-centered services.

You are a motivated clinician who enjoys a fast-paced environment while embracing change and growth. You are adept at time management and highly organized with a proven ability to ensure you can meet deadlines, plan, organize and execute. You are comfortable working independently to manage the needs of all clients on your caseload, enjoy working with a team and are an accountable collaborator. You excel at organizing, prioritizing, and following through on multiple demands of your role. You are flexible, creative, willing to grow in your role and take initiative in handling crises. You have genuine interests in contributing to the systematic change including but not limited to providing services to those who have caused harm as well as those who have been harmed.

What qualifications are required for this position?

You Are Also:

A person with a Master’s Degree in Psychology, Clinical Social Work or related field.
Registered with the California Board of Behavioral Sciences as one of the following: a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT), a Licensed Clinical Social Worker (LCSW), a Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor (LPCC), or a Licensed Educational Psychologist (LEP).
Experience at a shelter or residential setting managing clinical services and supervising clinical staff with a minimum of 2 years experience.
Understanding of, and sensitivity to, serving diverse populations as it relates to family dynamics and other aspects of cultural practice.
A strong interest in program development and high level management.
Open to learning, being flexible, taking accountability and being proactive.
Knowledge of community resources, community based organizations and social services providers.
Someone with The State mandated 40-hour Domestic Violence and Human Trafficking counselor certification (this can be scheduled after date of hire)
In possession of a valid CA driver's license, proof of insurance, and be approved by Ruby's Place insurance as a driver in order to drive agency vehicles.
Able to complete a background check, fingerprinting (Live Scan), and completion of all Community Care Licensing requirement documents. Able to meet all licensing requirements of Community Care Licensing.

What You Will Do

The anticipated start date for this position is late 2023. You will report to the Chief Clinical Officer and work closely with the leadership team to develop clinical programs, expand services and oversee all programs that provide therapy services, including assessments and mental health counseling, to individuals and their families who participate in our various residential and outreach programs. You embody and promote the agency's mindset, values, and commitment to trauma sensitive care, voluntary services, and a relational model. In addition, this position administratively and reflectively supervises clinical program staff.

Responsibilities include

Supervise and oversee all aspects and duties of the clinical department, including all individual and group services, following the agency mission demonstrated by setting departmental goals and objectives.

Evaluate existing contract compliance, monitoring and reporting to ensure all goals are being met.

Manage the planning and implementation of all the existing and upcoming grants to ensure the quality of care for clients and meeting deliverables.

Ensure all participants of clinical programs at Ruby’s Place receive mental health services and any necessary referrals as needed.

Provide consultation on any CPS and APS reporting as needed.

Provide individual administrative and reflective supervision to all designated staff.

Participate in the monthly Director’s Meeting and actively contribute to the leadership team.

Meet regularly and work closely with the Chief Clinical Officer in order to provide innovative and strategic ways to expand the clinical program and community awareness of mental health.

Provide customized staff/client trainings and invite fellow collaborative agencies to provide training to shelter staff and volunteers.

Assess current systems, upgrade as needed to track and evaluate reports for the staff and funding source(s).

Assist and work with the leadership team and the Chief Clinical Officer regarding strategic and long-range planning as needed.

Carry a limited caseload of clients in order to remain proactive in the clinical and therapeutic process.

Provide high quality training to RP’s direct service staff as well as staff in other partner agencies.

Support the Chief Clinical Officer to develop and maintain the growth and stabilization plan for the clinical department.

Supports the clinical team by attending meetings, supervision and meeting the team at the shelters as needed.

Supporting the strategic planning by overseeing timely reports, meeting with funders, providing inputs for future grant applications.

All training as required by program grants must be completed

Fill out a functional timesheet by assigned due dates in compliance with the time allocations.

Actively participate in reflective supervision

Create and maintain documentation of processes and procedures in relation to duties of the job

Other duties as assigned by your supervisor

DIRECT SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO STAFF:

Assist the staff in managing crisis situations

Check in with staff on any stressful issues and provide coping techniques

Provide support to staff to address secondary trauma, burn-out and other types of first responder challenges.

Oversee clinical supervision to the clinical staff.

Working Conditions

This position is eligible for hybrid in person & remote work. Time spent on-site versus remote working will be discussed and agreed upon with your supervisor. You are expected to be available on-site as necessary given business needs. You must be able to stand for long periods of time and perform physical activities, including lifting up to 25 pounds. You will be subject to frequent interruptions and must be able to multitask and handle stress.

Local travel in the greater Bay Area may be required.

Applying

The pay rate for the Director of Clinical Services is $120k to $145K per year. The benefits that come with working at Ruby’s Place at full-time hours include medical, dental, and vision plans, a life insurance policy, significant vacation, sick time, sabbatical, and immediate vesting in our 403(b) with a generous match. This is a full-time, salaried position, 40 hours per week. This is a hybrid position (flex work), with some days required in our Castro Valley Office. Applicants must be located in the greater Bay Area.

If all this sounds like a good fit for you, submit your resume, cover letter and responses to the following questions:

Please share why you are interested in working at Ruby’s Place.
Please share three reasons that explain why the Director of Clinical Services position is a right career move for you.
Please share your vision about a successful, cohesive and growth-oriented clinical department.
Why do you believe you are a qualified candidate who holds strong clinical and administrative components?

At Ruby’s Place, we are committed to workplace diversity and providing equal employment opportunities. Please also note that we are going to be especially excited about candidates who understand the unique nature of a mission-driven organization and have lived experience or direct experience working with survivors of domestic violence, human trafficking, or violent crime.

JOB SUMMARY

It is the primary responsibility for the Pastry Sous Chef to assist the Executive Pastry Chef in direction and management of all bake shop operations and associates, assuring the proper preparation of all baked items for the Resort's restaurants, food and beverage outlets, and banquet day-to-day pastry production and operations. Must also be able to perform the duties of the Executive Pastry Chef in their absence.

QUALIFICATION STANDARDS

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS: High School diploma or GED equivalent is required. An Associate's Degree in F&B and/or course certification from an accredited Culinary Institute is preferred.

LICENSE/PERMITS REQUIRED: State or Local Law may require a certificate upon completion of state-certified proper food handling certification.

REQUIRED SKILLS:

Must be able to communicate, read, write, and speak English effectively.
Bi-lingual skills are preferred but not required.
Ability to calculate figures amounts such as proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume helpful.
Excellent interpersonal service skills and organizational skills to plan time effectively.
Ability to work without direct supervision.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, busy, and somewhat stressful environment, work under pressure and meet deadlines with particular attention to detail.

KNOWLEDGE OF COMPUTER HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE:

Computer experience with Excel and Microsoft software programs are helpful.

PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

3 to 5 + years experience in a high-volume/fine dining/Banquet/Pastry production kitchen, preferably in a hotel/resort environment. Minimum 3+year's previous supervisory experience with organizing and scheduling employees to maximize efficiency.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be able to frequently communicate and develop rapport with guests and associates and have a working relationship with the resort management team.
Must be able to work in a stationary position for long periods of times (up to 5 hours).
Must be able to work and be flexible with all shifts, weekends, and holidays.
Must possess the ability to access all areas of the kitchen, the ability to move frequently & freely about facility.
Must be able to withstand prolonged standing, stretching, bending, kneeling, lifting and carrying items weighing up to 50 lbs. without restriction.
Must be able to work in close quarters or small rooms and is occasionally exposed to hot, cold, wet and/or humid condition.
Work environmental factors include noise, dust, and smoke.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

MENTAL REQUIREMENTS:

Must be able to convey information and ideas clearly.
Must be able to evaluate and select among alternative courses of action quickly and accurately.
Must be effective in handling problems in the workplace, including anticipating, preventing, identifying and solving problems as necessary.
Must be effective at listening to, understanding, and clarifying the issues raised by Associates, Supervisors, Department Heads, Senior Management, and guests.
Must be able to work with and understand financial information and data, and basic arithmetic functions.
Ability to be a clear thinker, analyze and resolve problems exercising good judgment.
Make independent decisions while maintaining strong ethical standards consistent with company policy, rules and the ability to maintain confidential information.
Ability to effectively deal with internal and external customers, some of whom will require high levels of patience, tact and diplomacy to defuse anger. Collect accurate information and resolve conflicts.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & FUNCTIONS:

Instructs and trains bakery associates on the proper procedures and techniques for the creation of attractive, professional pastry items.
Inspects all bakery items upon completion to ensure they have been prepared correctly and attractively.
Continually monitors business flow and works with the Executive Pastry Chef in scheduling associates according to demand for bakeshop goods.
Works with Executive Pastry Chef and regarding guest complaints or disputes which associates are not able to settle.
Works with Executive Pastry Chef to take appropriate action to reduce operating costs without affecting quality of pastries or service.
Keeps the Executive Pastry Chef informed of all pertinent information and any irregularities occurring in the bake shop operation.
Assists with ordering bakery ingredients from suppliers.
Assists the Executive Pastry Chef in the establishment of department budgets and the adherence to budget guidelines.
Works to help reduce accident costs by maintaining a safe, hazard free bakery operation, ensuring that all accidents are immediately reported and accident reports completed.
Helps Executive Pastry Chef develop and research new recipes and creates decorative cakes, statuaries and ornaments for special events, parties, and banquets.
Ensure that all guests feel welcome and are given responsive, friendly, and courteous service at all times.
Ensure that all food and beverage products are consistently prepared and served according to the restaurant's recipes, portioning, cooking and serving standards.
Ensure that all equipment is kept clean and kept in excellent working condition through personal inspection and by following the culinary preventative maintenance programs.
Ensure that all products are received in correct unit count and condition and deliveries are performed in accordance with culinary receiving policies and procedures.
Participate and ensure that culinary policies on associate performance appraisals are followed and completed in a timely basis.
Assist Executive Pastry Chef in scheduling labor as required by anticipated business activity while ensuring that all positions are staffed when and as needed and labor cost objectives are met per management decisions.
Fully understand and comply with all federal, state, county and municipal regulations that pertain to health, safety and labor requirements of the pastry areas, associates and guests.
Maintain paperwork for attendance records, payroll adjustments, payroll, monthly and yearly budgets, and Human Resource reporting requirements.
Assist in monitoring par and inventory levels for business, guest, and resort specifications.
Conduct and participate in training classes and all Daily Promise shift meetings, orientation meetings, BEO meetings, F&B meetings, and Manager Meetings if Pastry Chef is unavailable.
Keep an open line of communication with all departments and keep them posted on what is happening in the department.
Provide advice and suggestions to Executive Pastry Chef when needed.

Fay is increasing access to affordable medical nutrition therapy. Over 150 million Americans need the help of a Registered Dietitian Nutritionist, but many of them can't find one that accepts insurance. As a result, most people end up paying out of their own pocket or do not seek help at all. Fay is empowering dietitians to accept insurance and connecting RD's with patients who are eager to get the care they need.

We've are supported by the best names in health and medicine: Harvard University, Blue Cross Blue Shield, United Healthcare, and Cigna. If you are a Registered Dietitian that already has a private practice or is looking to make extra income in addition to your current job, then we can help you with the following:

New client referrals: grow your clientele and book of business by getting connected with patients from our referral partnerships
Get in-network with insurance: we credential you with major insurance plans and we do it for free
Billing & admin: we know billing to insurance is a pain, so we do it for you and guarantee you get paid
Technology: we can provide HIPAA compliant technology so you can meet your clients in a virtual environment and stay in compliance with insurance companies
Patient education materials: feel free to use our library of handouts or bring your own
Flexibility: you can see as little as one client through Fay. We have no minimums or required number of visits per month.

All you need to provide is:

Proof you are a Registered Dietitian, certified by the Commission on Dietetic Registration
Professional Liability insurance (we can help you obtain this if you do not have it)

We're working with many different types of dietitians at different stages in their career. We're happy to help you grow your existing private practice or help you make additional income outside of your current job. Please feel welcome to apply no matter where you are on your journey. We are excited to meet you and empower you!

POSITION SUMMARY

In alignment with company vision, mission, values, and objectives, the mechanic will troubleshoot, repair, maintain and improve mechanical systems with intent of improving uptime and efficiency.
Ensures operation of machinery and mechanical equipment by completing preventive maintenance requirements on engines, motors, pneumatic tools, conveyor systems, and production machines; following diagrams, sketches, operations manuals, manufacturer's instructions, and engineering specifications; troubleshooting malfunctions.
Locates sources of problems by observing mechanical devices in operation; listening for problems; using precision measuring and testing instruments.
Removes defective parts by dismantling devices; using hoists, cranes, and hand and power tools; examining form and texture of parts.
Determines changes in dimensional requirements of parts by inspecting used parts; using rules, calipers, micrometers, and other measuring instruments.
Adjusts functional parts of devices and control instruments by using hand tools, levels, plumb bobs, and straightedges.
Controls downtime by informing production workers of routine preventive maintenance techniques; monitoring compliance.
Fabricates repair parts by using machine shop instrumentation and equipment.
Maintains equipment, parts, and supplies inventories by checking stock to determine inventory level; anticipating needed equipment, parts, and supplies; placing and expediting orders; verifying receipt.
Conserves maintenance resources by using equipment and supplies as needed to accomplish job results.
Provides mechanical maintenance information by answering questions and requests.
Prepares mechanical maintenance reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Maintains technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing technical publications; establishing personal networks.
Maintains continuity among work teams by documenting and communicating actions, irregularities, and continuing needs.
Maintains safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules, and regulations.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Operate overhead and jib cranes safely to maneuver parts or equipment as needed Ability to lubricate parts and components
Assist in design, installation and start-up of multiple projects
Work with team members and operators to ensure the daily production schedule is met
Ability to learn new information quickly and apply
Ability to work safely and efficiently unsupervised
Ability to use SAP systems for writing work notifications and close work orders
Maintains and understands all equipment in the area
Diagnose, locate the cause of, and repair malfunctioning systems and components using test equipment
Safely operates any mobile equipment
Completes required documentation for maintenance projects.
Completes housekeeping duties on every shift.
Performs other related duties that contribute to the success of the operation as assigned by supervisor

MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED

High school diploma/GED

Minimum 2 years’ industrial mechanic experience
Minimum 3-5yrs maintenance experience and troubleshooting capability with industrial manufacturing equipment
Basic knowledge on how to perform diagnostic/troubleshooting and preventative maintenance
Experience with routine maintenance operations
Familiar with a variety of hand and power tools
Ability to Operate a forklift as needed to complete duties
Ability to work independently in a busy environment
Ability to work in a team based environment with little to no supervision
Ability to clearly communicate both verbally and in writing
Highly flexible, with solid interpersonal skills that allow one to work effectively in a diverse working environment.
Able to work well under pressure
Strong attention to detail.
Preferred or Desired Qualifications
5+ years’ industrial mechanic experience
Manufacturing experience in a team based environment
Self-starter, with developed analytical and troubleshooting skills
Familiarity with Safety Programs in a manufacturing facility
Personal Computer skills including word processing, spreadsheet, and presentation applications
Familiarity with World Class Manufacturing systems
Good understanding of quality and product specifications
Knowledge of safe operating procedures.

WORKING CONDITIONS

Work hours with occasional optional as well as mandatory overtime necessary to meet deadlines or objectives
Works in a manufacturing plant environment which may include exposure to industrial solvents, liquids and other materials.
Work with an awkward posture for 2 hours or more.
The working environment will extend to both hot and cold conditions Work in hot environments exceeding 110 degrees and dusty confined spaces.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Must be capable of wearing Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) necessary to comply with government and company safety standards. Job includes tasks that require bending, lifting materials weighing up to 50 lbs., twisting, gripping and stair climbing. Willing and able to work at heights.

The above declarations are not intended to be all-inclusive of this position’s duties, responsibilities, and requirements to do this job. They are intended only to describe its general nature.

Compensation

Certain states require pay information be provided in job postings. The base pay for this position is $39.88 per hour plus shift differential of $0.30 for swing shift and $0.70 for night shift.

In addition to base salary, this position is eligible for an annual bonus. The targeted bonus amount is 9% of base salary based on company and individual performance measures.

About Us

Who are we?

Through the responsible development of innovative and sustainable building products, CertainTeed, headquartered in Malvern, Pennsylvania, has helped shape the building products industry for more than 110 years. Founded in 1904 as General Roofing Manufacturing Company, the firm's slogan "Quality Made Certain, Satisfaction Guaranteed," inspired the name CertainTeed. Today, CertainTeed is a leading North American brand of exterior and interior building products, including roofing, siding, fence, decking, railing, trim, insulation, drywall and ceilings.

Express London.

Accounting Manager

Il Mercato di Che Fico (a grocery store) is seeking a new Assistant General Manager to join our team!

From the Back Home Hospitality team that brought Che Fico and Che Fico Alimentari to San Francisco, comes a new Che Fico location in Menlo Park! Il Mercato di Che Fico is featured in the Springline development and is a 4,500-square-foot specialty market in the vein of a Che Fico farmers market meets Eataly, with Che Fico’s signature style applied. At Il Mercato di Che Fico, you’ll find beautiful produce from local farmers, a deli with salumi created in- house, cheeses imported from around the world, a butcher counter with dry-aged meats, a seafood counter with the freshest catches, more than 100 bottles of wine, and a prepared foods section with a variety of grab-and-go options such as sandwiches and salads. The location will feature a walk-up gelato window on El Camino Real, where freshly spun flavors are available every day. We will also showcase the highly successful Che Fico line of consumer-packaged goods, including sauces, condiments, fresh pastas, salumi, and more. Il Mercato di Che Fico will have a robust catering program that offers breakfast, lunch, and dinner options for everything from small celebrations to work lunches to big parties.

The Position:

Candidates should be outgoing, positive, and have a strong background in grocery and retail service, as well as a passion for learning and growth. We are seeking a candidate that has experience running all aspects and organizations within a specialty market/grocery store. They should provide exceptional guest experiences and continually strive to exceed guests' expectations with every opportunity.

We are looking for a strong leader who can provide continual guidance and coaching to our team.

The Assistant General Manager role will be responsible for educating the team on new and current products, providing support on the floor during hours of business, upholding and elevating our service standards, and providing strong communication with the retail and culinary teams to provide exceptional guest experience.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:
Oversee daily store operations, including sales, ordering, merchandising, inventory management, catering, culinary operations, customer service, and team management
Assisting the General Manager create and implement effective sales and marketing strategies to increase store revenue and profitability
Manage and train team, including hiring, scheduling, and performance evaluations
Monitor inventory levels and ensure products are stocked, displayed, and rotated correctly
Ensure compliance with local, state, and federal regulations, including food safety standards
Maintain positive relationships with customers, vendors, and suppliers
Resolve customer complaints and issues in a timely and satisfactory manner
Assisting the General manager develop and maintain budgets, financial reports, and manage P&L for profitability and revenue goals
Work with department leads to analyze sales data and make recommendations for improvement

For the role of Assistant GM we offer:
Salary range: $75K-$85K based on experience plus bonus opportunities
Paid Health, Dental, Vision insurance
Free Mental health resources
Paid-Time-Off
Paid Maternal/Parental Leave
Retirement savings plan - 401k with 4% match
Opportunities for internal growth and career advancement - we are a fast growing company and look to promote from within
Profit sharing - after one year you will have access to our quarterly profit sharing pool
Financial education
Work-Life Balance
Discount on items purchased in store and sister restaurant locations
We host staff events, field trips and seminars to build restaurant culture and further our development as a team.
We want this to be the most fun and rewarding job you have ever had in the hospitality industry and we are seeking talented professionals to help grow our team. Please send us your resume and a brief note about you and why you want to work at Il Mercato di Che Fico. We look forward to meeting you!

GENERAL INFORMATION

Great company seeks candidates with experience in a manufacturing environment for position of QA-Safety-Purchasing Director. Flexibility, dependability, a can-do attitude, and ability to solve challenges are important attributes for this role.

Does that sound like you? If yes, then read on, and if you are interested, send us an email with your cover letter *and* resume, including your desired pay range.

Please make sure that your resume includes your contact phone number AND lists the *month and year* of your previous positions, not just the year.

Some of what we offer to you are a pleasant and friendly work environment, very good benefits, and competitive compensation.

Please note that a background check will be conducted.

We look forward to hearing from you!

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

The Quality Assurance-Safety-Purchasing Director is responsible for managing the product quality and availability of the materials needed in our manufacturing company. QA is also performed through observation and by monitoring the processes of production and equipment operations to make sure these operations conform to process specifications or propose necessary process or assembly adjustments. QASPD will manage the purchasing agent to secure materials on a timely basis to meet Minimum Stocking Requirements at appropriate costs. This is critical to the smooth operation of our growing company. In addition, the QASPD will oversee and be responsible for the Safety function and Safety needs of the organization.

A strong skill set of: financial management, negotiations, and communication is essential to being successful in this position.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

o Secure needed raw materials from our global supplier network to maintain our minimum stocking requirements at our facility. This position currently has one direct report to help in purchasing over 500 items.

o Develop and executes comprehensive purchasing plan (short and long term) to support sales objectives.

o Ensure supplier compliance to quality, cost, and delivery of purchases.

o Provide weekly updates noting possible issues.

o Manage Purchasing Agent to improve skill sets and deliver on goals

o Maintenance, renewal, and updates of organic, Kosher, gluten free, non-GMO, and AIB certifications. Work with Certification Agencies to provide needed information.

o Ensure that the safety requirements for food manufacturing set forth in the QA and preventative control programs are met. Programs may include but are not limited to: Environmental Monitoring, Sanitation Program, Shipping and Receiving, Allergen, Raw Material Hold & Release, Good Manufacturing Procedures (GMPs), Food Defense, Supplier Verification Program, Raw Material Sampling, and Pre-ship Sampling.

o Lead our effort to improve our programs to Global Food Safety Initiative approval.

o Review and update documentation for all ingredients including but not limited to COA and specification sheets.

o Update internal databases with work-completed, issue status, and other information as needed.

o Maintain detailed, timely, and accurate records of all incoming materials and test results.

o Recommend improvements after evaluating current testing protocols, production standards, and product quality.

o Assist in inspecting the quality of raw material to make sure they meet specifications at the various stages such as incoming shipments, FIFO timing, shelf life extension, etc.

o Evaluate and validate incoming materials’ Certificate of Analysis (COA) against the current company specifications.

o Update internal databases with work-completed, issue status, and other information as needed.

o Monitor quality attributes for all manufacturing goods to ensure accurate product

o Conduct proper quality and safety training according to QA/QC protocols.

o Communicate product status and updates through NetSuite and via email to appropriate departments, customer service, and production.

o Oversee pest control program, including pest inspections for products and coordination with EcoLab.

o Manage communications across departments in regard to: supply technical data, understand their needs and problems through email and occasionally through telephone. Working with other departments on communicating proper QA information. This would include occasional customer audits (1 to 2 per year).

o Manage and administer IIPP (Injury and Illness Prevention Program) for the company.

o Work with third-party vendor to manage and report on KPIs for the program

o Make recommendations to improve/change program as needed.

o Purchasing for raw materials, bulk materials, and product packaging. Those items include (but are not limited to):

o About 100 spice or herbs used as raw materials.

o Ecobox packaging, Jar Labels, PC1 Labels, Tin Labels, and Foil Bags that are UPC specific.

o The QASPD will manage purchases with the Purchasing Agent to process-check our orders.

o All purchasing will be recorded and maintained in NetSuite with current prices and arrival dates.

o Perform other functions as assigned.

ESSENTIAL ABILITIES

o Strong organizational skills

o Strong attention to detail

o High level of Communication skills: in person, verbal, writing, and electronically

o Understand, follow, and provide instructions in English

o Perform successfully in a multi-task, fast paced/dynamic environment

WORK EXPERIENCE AND JOB REQUIREMENTS

o Strong ERP (NetSuite) and MS Office (Excel) skills

o CPIM Certified, experience with SQF and GFSI

o Must possess a valid California driver’s license

EDUCATION

Prologis, Inc. is the global leader in logistics real estate. In partnership with our customers and our communities, we develop modern, high-quality properties that set the standard for innovative building design and sustainability. Job Title:
Engineering Manager - Solar and Storage
Company:
Prologis
Prologis is seeking an ambitious and passionate Engineering Manager (Solar and Storage) to lead engineering efforts and support all phases of project development of its grid scale storage portfolio in the US. We have made a public commitment to achieve 1 GW of solar and storage by year-end 2025. Prologis Energy team has multiple GWs of pipeline for solar and battery energy storage systems across North America and several projects coming online in near future. This role will work closely with our development and execution teams to bring projects from conception to commercial operations.
This position offers an unparalleled ability to build one of the largest portfolios of Solar and Utility scale BESS assets globally.
What’s needed in order to do that:
Responsible for engineering design elements throughout the full life cycle of Solar & utility scale BESS projects-from project origination, conception to commissioning and O&M.
On PV side, manage all the engineering elements provided by EPC vendors to support the project thru early development, budgeting / estimation, stakeholder management, and provide support as required on regulatory approval and interconnection agreement.
On BESS side, identify potential project sites, conduct feasibility studies, assess environmental and regulatory constraints, and work cross functionally (with internal and external stakeholders) to facilitate all necessary permits and approvals. Develop 5%, 10% up to 30% BESS layouts including MV Transformer, switchgear and protection solutions.
Evaluate new technologies and vendors; collaborate cross functionally to help develop and maintain standard set of specifications for supporting sales, design and installation of our PV + BESS & Utility Scale BESS solutions.
Visits sites as needed during pre-construction phase and drive/support 30% CD Packages.
Perform, generate and review high level electrical SLD and site layouts as needed for PV+BESS and Utility scale BESS solutions.
Provide as needed construction support / oversight / review of the engineering performed by our Contractors, Engineering/Procurement/Construction (EPC) partners, and Subcontractors, as required for successful completion of Utility BESS projects. Assist as needed with procurement activities including technical requirements, review and contracting.
Manage contractual relationships with Engineer Contractors/Consultants and coordinate with legal, as needed, to assist with contract negotiations and to resolve programmatic needs/requirements
Lead cost reduction efforts including researching design alternatives and value engineering. Enforce processes, best practices, and strategies for the design and execution of cost and schedule-efficient projects.
Tell us if you’re ready.
5+ years’ senior level experience in engineering, technical project management, or sales engineering, ideally in a PV and Utility Scale BESS environment
Solid understanding and demonstrated experience of all engineering design elements throughout the full life cycle of Solar & utility scale BESS projects
Expert understanding of project development process from Design through Interconnection, Permitting and Construction
Have in depth understanding of overall project (PV and BESS) interconnection requirements, solar array layouts, SLD’s, module selection, string sizing, ground coverage ratio, inverter selection, power factor requirements, cable sizing etc.
Hands on experience in power generation, distribution, and other highly relevant industry.
Positive, innovative, and collaborative attitude, strong ability to communicate across departments and drive to “find a solution that works”
Strong understanding of the interplay between system design, cost, project economics, and financed pricing
In depth experience in dealing with AHJ’s, Utilities, ISO’s (ERCOT and CAISO), Permitting agencies (in CA and TX) and represent Prologis in the best possible way.
Proficient in AutoCAD.
Knowledge of Utility interconnection requirements, power purchase agreements, distributed solar, storage, EV and general renewable energy
Basic understanding of electricity market design, federal and state regulatory rules and issues, tariff structures, renewable energy, and renewable incentives
Able to travel up to 20% of the time
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Power Systems or Renewables. Master’s degree preferred.
PE license preferred.
Hiring Salary Range of $126,000.00 - $173,000.00. Salary and total compensation package (bonus target) to be determined by the candidate’s location, education, experience, and skills, as well as internal pay equity and alignment with market data.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Support primary financial advisors and provide service to the firms’ 180+ client households
Responsible for appointment preparation and post-appointment follow up for new and current clients – including assembling the required paperwork (mostly DocuSign) and forms, account reviews, and post appointment logs and data entry into financial planning software
Ensures that all assigned activities are executed in a timely and accurate manner, and that all documentation is maintained to compliance standards
May independently meet with clients to perform account opening procedures and obtaining appropriate signatures while also being able to answer basic questions regarding paperwork/DocuSign forms.

Semiconductor / High Tech industry

HPSP is a leading manufacturer of processing equipment for the semiconductor industry. We are looking for enthusiastic candidates for our Engineering Manager position for our Silicon Valley branch.

This individual will assume lead responsibility for design, develop and assess mechanical and electro-mechanical equipment and systems used in semiconductor equipment. Familiar with automation, high purity gas delivery systems, pressure and temperature sensors, pressure vessels, and clean room furnace equipment.

The ideal candidate would be a highly motivated individual contributor that has the vision and initiative to provide technical leadership on the assigned projects.

Job Description:

· Thorough knowledge of mechanical design, mechanics and material science concepts, heat transfer / thermal analysis, stress analysis, and system integration

· Research, design, develops, modifies and evaluate parts, components and modules of systems for semiconductor process equipment. Determines design approaches and parameters, conduct experimental tests and evaluates results.

· Develop hardware modules, select components & required materials based on analysis of specification and reliability per customer requirement for Prototype build and develop BOM & build SOE together with engineer team/s. Designs will include; high purity process gas delivery systems, instrumentation, temperature PID control, pressure vessels, automation, etc.

· Responsible for the design, fabrication, assembly, and test efforts for components and assemblies

· Responsible for review of technical specifications and drawings of systems, interpretation of drawings and schematics, supporting mechanical equipment troubleshooting, checkout, subsystem testing etc., as required to support field techs.

· Basic knowledge of electronics and controls

· Troubleshoot a variety of moderately complex thermal, mechanical, & electro-mechanical problems

· Work closely with manufacturing department for establishing effective manufacturing process and resolve technical issues

· Experience working with vendors to implement your designs in a timely and cost-effective fashion

· Develop Test procedures, reports, program and fixtures needed to verify the product functionality

· Release and support the design for manufacturing (BOM, layout drawing, P&IDs, assembly / detail drawings, interconnect diagrams, specification sheets, etc.)

· Interact with customers to define NPI requirements, develop execution plans to meet customer requirements.

· Support Customer and Field issues pertaining to existing and legacy products

· Implement ECO changes to product and manufacturing processes

· Demonstrated use and understanding of change management process

· Manage overall development project schedule.

· Manage CE / SEMI-S2 and other Certification process as required.

Qualification:

· BSME or MSME in Mechanical Engineering

· REQUIRED: 5 years of related work experience in semiconductor or biotech industries required

· Experience managing/leading/directing engineering team members

· Detail oriented

· Excellent analysis and trouble-shooting skills

· Proficiency with SolidWorks & AutoCAD software

· Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools

· Experience with GD&T fundamentals and ASME drafting standards

Understand Semi-S2 & CE Mark, etc.

About Peninsula Custom Homes
Founded in 1978, Peninsula Custom Homes has earned the distinguished reputation as a premier custom residential builder in the San Francisco Bay area. Our employees are our greatest resource, we value their input and willingness to continually help improve the organization and in return provide on-the-job training and opportunities for advancement. When you join PCH you work with a variety of clients who expect the highest quality in building their dream home. At PCH you are a part of a diverse team which values your input and provides you the opportunity to learn from and be supported by multiple team members who have been with the company for over 20 years. At PCH you can take pride in the masterpieces that you help to create.

READ ON IF:
You take pride and ownership in your projects, display quality and craftsmanship through the details, can interpret the design teams’ intent, are passionate about upholding a high reputation, and continue to strive for excellence with a constant learning mentality.

You drive results with a strong Leadership presence, plan ahead and schedule the necessary meetings to complete projects on time, on budget and explain expectations clearly. Display a strategic mindset when directing others, lead by example and adapt to changing priorities while always maintaining and encouraging a positive attitude.

You are relationship driven and understand the importance of building trust with the client, the construction teams. You make sure the job is done the right way even if the client cannot see it. You continue to double and triple check the work and anticipate and mitigate potential problems and delays.

Your are an excellent communicator & team player – You understand that clear communication around goals, priorities, and expectations are the keys to productivity with both internal and external team members. You encourage collaboration and know that different perspectives and ideas lead to the highest success for the team and the project.

Project Superintendent

Job Summary:
The Project Superintendent provides on-site coordination for all phases of high-end residential construction projects, includes coordinating subcontractors, maintains client and design team relationships, ensures necessary material and equipment for the project, ensures that specifications are being strictly followed, and work proceeds on schedule and within budget at the highest quality and attention to detail. The Project Superintendent is responsible for scheduling, compliance, quality, cost control, personnel management and job site safety.

Expectations:

Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with clients, architects, designers, all field personnel, and PCH staff
Strong problem solving-skills; responsibly address issues and problems as they arise
Ability to make informed decisions
Ability to understand the overall scope of the job and plan ahead
Ability to interpret the design team’s intent and provide positive feedback towards solution
Ability to read and comprehend structural, architectural and shop drawings
Knowledge of broader trades (electrical, mechanical, plumbing, etc.)
Manage special projects as assigned

Primary Responsibilities

Ensure and monitor quality and compliance with all necessary codes, specifications, safety requirements, and PCH standards of quality
Maintain an “on-site-hands-on” presence on the jobsite at all times
Attend bi-weekly superintendent meetings

Budgets/Estimates

Analyze proposals and recommend subcontractors
Coordinate with project coordinator to issue required change orders
Review with project coordinator overall project costs on a regular basis (at least monthly) by reviewing financial reports, sub and materials contracts, change orders and original budget
Work with project coordinator to prepare weekly Job Status Reports

Field Personnel Management

Monitor punctuality and attendance of all field personnel (including subcontractors)
Schedule subcontractors and monitor quality of work and productivity
Promote safe practices and operations on jobsites
Monitor quality of work and productivity
Conduct annual performance evaluations

Schedule Tracking and Analysis

Work with project coordinator to build working MS Project schedule
Analyze schedule to anticipate and avoid potential schedule delays and manage client’s expectations

Project Operations

Establish and maintain jobsite security, layout and organization
Monitor and promote jobsite safety
Conduct weekly tailgate meetings
Inform job crew of PCH policies as appropriate

Qualifications

At least seven years of construction experience
Expertise in high-quality residential construction
Ability to communicate professionally and effectively with clients, architects, designers, all field personnel, and PCH staff
Ability to manage multiple tasks and effectively delegate work responsibilities to field personnel

Compensation & Benefits:

Compensation range of $165,000.00 - $183,000.00 per year actual base pay will depend on skills, qualifications and experience
Paid Health, Dental and Vision Insurance,
401(K) Plan with Employer Match,
Paid Time Off,
Training and Development Opportunities,
Gas Reimbursement

The Multiple Subject/General Education Teacher is employed by John Muir Charter Schools (JMCS) and is responsible for classroom instruction of young people (age 16-24) participating in the Rancho Cielo Youth Campus in Salinas, Ca. The teacher will work closely with the Rancho Cielo staff team to integrate Rancho Cielo’s mission into the classroom.

The Multiple Subject Teacher will be responsible for assisting students in Rancho Cielo programs to complete their high school diploma and to provide necessary support services to enable participants to be successful. The teacher will assist with enrolling and assessing students to determine the proper course of study that will lead to a high school diploma and prepare them for successful continuation to post-secondary education. The teacher’s primary role will be to instruct students in multiple subjects at multiple skills levels. The teacher reports jointly to the JCMS Site Director/PPS Counseling and JMCS Site Director/Principal.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Prepare monthly, weekly, and daily lesson plans for all courses.
Be able to teach high school level multiple subject courses at a variety of student skill

levels.

Commitment to the Rancho Cielo program model and ability incorporate practical

learning experiences related to job readiness, life skills and leadership.

Coordinate with Rancho Cielo staff and be a strong team player to ensure comprehensive,

synchronized services.

Conduct culturally relevant classes appropriate for students coming from many cultural,

ethnic, linguistic, and economic backgrounds and incorporating students’ experiences
into learning.

Inform the Site Directors and other appropriate staff of academic and non-academic

issues that affect student progress

Incorporate college and career planning into regular classroom practice.
Monitor and evaluate student progress on standardized assessments (STAR)
Perform duties associated with attendance and record-keeping.
Other duties as assigned
The teacher will complete all necessary paperwork as required by John Muir Charter Schools administration, as well as any paperwork requested by the Nevada County Superintendent of Schools (NCSOS).

QUALIFICATIONS:

Demonstrated ability to engage disenfranchised young people from "at risk" conditions in meaningful, interesting, and creative learning experiences.
Demonstrated knowledge in developing class and individual learning plans for students.
Dedication to the basic philosophy of emphasizing the core curriculum and commitment

to the vision, mission, core values and philosophy of JMCS and Rancho Cielo.

Be able to integrate leadership development in the classroom and empower youth through

knowledge, literacy, and numeracy.

Strong written and verbal communication skills.

EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s degree in Education or any related field.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:

A current California Multiple Subject teaching credential, or ability to acquire Provisional Intern or Short Term Staff Permit while working towards credential. Single Subject credentials may be accepted in some circumstances.
Authorization for Supporting English Language Learners required

WORK HOURS
Onsite classroom hours are Monday-Friday approximately 8:00 am-3:30 pm. Classroom hours may change based on teacher and student availability or student transportation schedules.

SALARY
Beginning Salary of $55,209 to $82,688 depending on experience and years of service. Medical, dental and vision benefits.

TO APPLY
Please apply through EdJoin at the following link:

https://www.edjoin.org/Home/DistrictJobPosting/1781329

About Hearts and Minds Activity Center

Hearts & Minds Activity Center is a community based organization providing care for children and seniors in a positive, creative and fun environment!

Hearts & Minds Childcare Center is a play based program focused on social, emotional development and kinder readiness. Our childcare is housed in the same building with our Adult Day care, which provides therapeutic activities for seniors with dementia. Together these two programs provide daily onsite intergenerational activities for our seniors and preschool children.

DUTIES:

The Teacher is responsible for the care and supervision of the childcare program under the direction of the Director. Must have the ability to create and implement age appropriate lesson planning for children ages 2 to entry level first grade, follow indicated procedures by Director to maintain and improve the quality of the childcare program.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Must be at least 18 years of age, and have strong desire to work with children. This person must have a warm, nurturing and friendly personality, be able to relate well with children and be willing to fulfill their responsibilities in accordance with the Center’s philosophy. Must have a minimum of 12 ECE units in the following areas: Child Growth and Development, Child Family and Community, Child Family and Program Curriculum, First Aid and CPR training, FBO/DOJ clearance and six months’ experience working at a licensed center.

HOURS OF WORK:

Full time, with benefits, ability to attend Center’s special events, meetings and staff training workshops.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. Assisting in planning and implementing the daily program under the supervision of the Head Teacher and Director.

2. Have strong knowledge of Community Care Licensing regulations under Title 22.

3. Help in the children’s development by creating age appropriate lesson plans.

4. Set a good example by working with the children and the team in a respectful manner.

5. Supervise the program in the absence of the Director or Head Teacher.

6. Participate in meetings and in-service trainings.

7. Beaware of location of information files and emergency procedures.

8. Participate in the Intergenerational Program offered by Hearts & Minds Activity Center.

9. Assist with parent-teacher conferences.

10. Planning and preparing the learning environment, setting up activities and preparing needed materials and supplies.

11. Document any physical, mental or social changes observed in any child’s behavior, and report to the director.

12. Assist with the sanitation of toys and classroom supplies.

13. Assist in maintaining the Center to meet and exceed State Licensing requirements.

WORKING CONDITIONS:

This position is on site in a well ventilated classroom and outdoor play area. May be required to lift up to 40 pounds, cots are set and put away every day for naptime, must be able to sit and stand for long periods of time, required to assist children with toilet training. Interaction with children, families, co-workers, personnel from the adult day care program and volunteers from the community required.

PERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

Must be flexible, report to work as schedule, self-starter, must be sensitive to the needs of children, possess strong communication skills and be a team player.

LANGUAGE SKILLS:

Ability to read, write and understand age appropriate curriculum plans, parent concerns and childcare center information.

MATHEMATICS SKILLS:

Basic Math knowledge required.

REASONING ABILITIES:

Ability to collect necessary data required by granters.

Hearts & Minds Activity Center is committed to the implementation of an Affirmative Action Policy and the Americans with Disabilities Policy in its recruitment selection and placement of all personnel and is Equal Opportunity Employer.
