Position Description: Commercial Construction TI Superintendent

Classification: Full-time employee (W-2)(Salary)

Location: Campbell, CA

ABOUT US

We at COBE Construction, Inc. are a group of Commercial Builders and Engineers that take great pride in providing exceptional value to every project of which we are a part. We are an innovative company with our own proprietary software and advanced project management tools that better enable the fast paced world of commercial construction. We are fortunate to work with many of the best- and well-known high-tech companies in Silicon Valley. We believe our success over the past 20 years is in large part due to our can‐do attitudes, family‐like culture, and great work life balance. We genuinely feel that COBE offers its employees a great opportunity to grow and advance their professional careers.

ABOUT THE POSITION

As a COBE Senior Construction Superintendent you will be ultimately responsible for ALL field operations for a specific project. The success of each project and the possibility of future projects with the same client and other clients is greatly dependent on your performance as a COBE Construction Superintendent.

Communication:

Complete and distribute daily reports and meeting minutes for each project that you are responsible for
Conduct weekly subcontractor and “tailgate safety” meetings to ensure coordination of trades
Prepare and distribute the “3‐week Look Ahead” and overall project schedules to properly coordinate activities
Update the Project Manager on the progress of the schedule and notify them of any possible delays
Communicate and coordinate service shutdowns and traffic or ingress/egress re‐routing with the client
Interface with government agencies for inspections and obtain Certificate of Occupancies

Sales Manager of GST Latin America is responsible for the profit and loss of Mizuho America’s Latin American region by developing and executing business strategies, achieving sales goals and managing budgets. ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

Sales

1. Holds responsibility over Mizuho’s P&L in the company’s surgical table and OR business in Latin America.

2. Plans and submits sales quota by country.

3. Works with the President to develop business plans to achieve sales quotas, including quarterly sales forecasts.

4. Manages distributor network in Latin America. Evaluates distributor track records to analyze monthly sales vs quotas. Provides recommendations and support to the distributors to achieve sales objectives.

5. Evaluates the pricing of products and provides recommendations as necessary.

6. Trains distributors on Mizuho surgical tables.

7. Identifies and works with distributors who display substandard sales, product and procedural knowledge.

8. Educates and builds relationship with Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs) and surgeons in the territory.

9. Designs incentive programs for surgeons.

10. Prepares weekly reports on business activities, contacts and expenses incurred and submit them to the President for his review and discussion.

11. Participates in Weekly GST Business Review and Planning (QBRP) Meetings, and presents reports on sales results, analysis, opportunities and forecasts.

12. Creates a Surgical Hospital and Surgical Center Database with corresponding sales volume and product line penetration by region.

13. Works with the Customer Service, Marketing and Inventory Operation teams to ensure fast customer support and quick turnaround to enable future opportunities.

Marketing

1. Works with the Product Marketing team to convey product information to the distributors and customers.

2. Attends trade shows, labs and conferences as necessary

Other

1. Acts as focal point of registration process and proactively works with suppliers and doctors to assist the process

2. Responsible for related duties as required or assigned.

3. Complete special projects and miscellaneous assignments as required.

Walking, bending, stooping, kneeling may be required regularly. WORK ENVIRONMENT

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

JD:
POSITION TITLE: Employee Experience Project Manager

JOB CLASSIFICATION: Exempt, Non-Union

REPORTING RELATIONSHIP: Sr. Director of Human Resources

SUMMARY:

About Community Solutions: As a wellness and recovery-based behavioral health services provider, our mission is to create positive change in the lives of our clients. Community Solutions has a compassionate, strengths-based, client-centered, trauma-informed team and service delivery approach. Values of hope, kindness, equity, belonging, and collaboration guide our organization’s culture.

Job Description:

Community Solutions is seeking an Employee Experience Project Manager with expertise in project management to coordinate and oversee the development of a company-wide leadership development program and support with other organizational-wide employee experience initiatives. We are seeking someone who is dedicated to fostering workplaces that develop great leaders, is committed to the principles of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB), and shares our passion for delivering the best employee experience. The ideal candidate will have experience managing cross-department projects, tracking, and holding accountability on projects and deliverables, and effectively communicating project status updates to stakeholders.

This position will work cross-functionally with Training & Development and Human Resources. This individual will work on a hybrid basis, with expectations of being able to be onsite at our Gilroy, CA headquarters for onsite meetings and training as scheduled with advanced notice. Occasional travel to our offices and facilities in San Jose and Morgan Hill is required.

If this sounds exciting—and the job description below feels like a fit—we really hope, you’ll consider joining us along this journey!

​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​What You'll Be Doing in the role of Employee Experience Project Manager:

Lead by example and foster a workplace culture that promotes leadership development and inclusivity.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement leadership development and employee experience initiatives.
Perform the full range of project management cycle including initiating, planning, executing, monitoring, and reporting of projects.
Develop project plans, set objectives and metrics, and track progress to ensure projects are completed on time and within scope.
Track, record, and report-out metrics for the status and effectiveness of projects and initiatives, and communicate project status updates to stakeholders, including senior leadership and staff.
Establish appropriate metrics to measure the impact and progress of work.
Hold teams accountable for project deliverables and milestones.
Facilitate project workgroups, meetings, and workshops with all levels of staff and management to drive leadership development efforts.
Ensure that DEIB principles are integrated into leadership development and employee experience initiatives/projects.
Manage surveys, including development, implementation, analysis, and presentation of results. Utilize survey data to inform strategy development and action planning to inform improvements in workplace culture and employee experience.
Develop data collection tools and strategies. Lead data analysis efforts, and regularly provide data reports/presentations to stakeholders and recommend improvements as needed.
Identify and collaboratively implement best practices to increase employee support, engagement, performance, retention, and advancement.
Write clear, concise, and effective reports, presentations, training guides, correspondence, and other forms of communication (e.g., articles, short videos, etc.).
Develop and implement effective communication strategies to convey project status, updates, and outcomes to stakeholders.
Provide grant administration involving managing and monitoring of grants, tracking, and reporting on deliverables, providing grant data, and grant compliance.
Provide employee experience project and task support to Human Resources and Training & Development in partnership with existing teams. This includes, but not limited to, New Employee Onboarding (NEO), companywide meetings, Agency Strategic Plan implementation, and employer brand development.
Willingness to take initiative, high level of self-motivation, and ease of working independently or as part of a team.
Collaborate with external consultants and stakeholders.
Responds to phone calls and emails within 24 hours on business days.

The Ideal Candidate Will Possess the Following Qualifications and Knowledge:

Did you know that research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups often apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications? Please know that no one ever meets 100% of the qualifications. If much of this describes you, we encourage you to apply. This might be the right next role for you if you have:

Proven experience (5+ years) managing cross-functional projects and/or initiatives in a similar role.
Strong project management skills, including the ability to create and manage project plans, set objectives, and track progress.
A deep commitment to fostering diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplaces and developing great leaders.
Strong knowledge of diversity, equity, and inclusion principles and the ability to integrate them into leadership development programs.
Exceptional communication and messaging skills, with the ability to engage and influence all levels of staff and management.
Experience handling large projects using data collection, tracking processes, generating reports, and data systems management.
Experience facilitating training utilizing best practices in adult learning to groups of 50+ individuals across all leadership levels.
Demonstrated track record of engaging facilitation and strong communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence all levels of staff and management.
Comfortable writing grant report summaries, event descriptions, and writing skills demonstrate good use of English grammar, sentence structure, and punctuation.
Creative and innovative thinker, who actively presents new opportunities, proposes solutions, and recommends best practices.
Exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Strong organizational and time management abilities.
Systems minded and someone who leads with curiosity and seeks to understand the interconnection.
Knowledge of and prior experience in applicable eLearning software, project management tracking and presentation tools (Microsoft Projects, Teams, SharePoint), and presentation tools (Canva and Zoom).
Demonstrates cultural competency by effectively working with people differing in value systems, ethnicity, cultural backgrounds, language capabilities and disabilities. Treats all individuals with empathy and respect.
Occasionally, will need to be available to work flexible hours, including weekends and evening hours.

Preferred:

The individual will preferably be bilingual and bicultural.
Associate-level degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Organizational Development, or a related field.
Experience working within an organization that provides behavioral health services.
Experience in talent development and leadership coaching is a plus.
Prior experience managing people and leading teams.

Working at Community Solutions:

The annual base salary range for this role is $66,000-$76,000. Grade level and salary ranges are determined through interviews and a review of education, experience, knowledge, skills, abilities of the applicant, equity with other team members, and alignment with market data. We offer a comprehensive employee benefits package and encourages strong work-life balance. We believe in supporting the whole person by providing:

Medical, dental and vision 100% of premiums paid by employer for full-time employees and eligible dependent children
403(b) Retirement Plan with 5% employer match
3-weeks paid vacation to start
13 paid holidays as well as 96 sick hours per year and self-care time
Longevity bonuses
Generous family leave
Staff learning and development and robust in-house training opportunities
Employee-led Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Resource Group

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

JD:
BASIC PURPOSE

Cultivates, solicits, and closes major gifts ($50,000+) in support of The Salvation Army’s Campaign for Alameda to expand our umbrella of social services including transitional housing, workforce development, youth development, food assistance, and homeless outreach. The successful candidate will help manage high-level donors and prospects, collaborating with a Planned Gifts team, and Divisional Development staff to execute comprehensive gift proposals.

B. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

I. FUNDRAISING

1. Cultivate, solicit, and steward an existing portfolio of 125-150 prospects and current donors with the ability to make campaign gifts between $50,000 and $2.5 million.

2. Augment an existing campaign prospect pipeline which will include individual donors (85%), corporations (10%), and foundations (5%).

3. Ability to secure 120 face-to-face visits and minimum of $1.5 million annually in direct support.

4. Knowledge of moves management, endowment fundraising and philanthropic reporting.

5. Ability to organize and prioritize a solicitation schedule that maintains the momentum of a capital campaign and adheres to campaign timelines and benchmarks.

6. Experience with all mechanisms of charitable giving including planned giving and gifts-in-kind.

7. Coordinate the overall campaign effort through the regular reporting of progress, the integration of board members for better identification and solicitation, and the engagement of local officer/leaders.

8. Ability to work successfully within The Salvation Army’s fundraising practices as defined by the Division and Territory to ensure a continuity of support while maintaining and improving existing donor relationships.

9. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

10. Experience with Raiser’s Edge NXT or other CRM.

11. Other duties assigned as necessary.

C. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES AND OTHER QUALIFICATIONS REQUIREMENTS

1. Bachelor’s degree (B. A.) from a four-year college or university.

2. At least 5 years of field experience in major gifts fundraising, ideally in institutions of higher education or social service delivery.

3. Demonstrated ability to solicit and secure five and six figure gifts.

4. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

5. Ability to work with diverse communities including board members, community members, and others.

6. High energy, strong sense of initiative, creative problem solving and flexibility.

7. Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

8. Must be goal-oriented, self-motivated and able to multi-task.

9. Proficiency in Microsoft Office products, including Office 365 (Word, Excel, Publisher) is necessary.

10. Valid CA driver’s license.

D. PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:

· Ability to sit, walk, stand, bend, squat, climb, kneel, and twist on an intermittent or sometimes continuous basis.

· Ability to grasp, push, and/or pull objects.

· Ability to reach overhead.

· Ability to operate telephone.

· Ability to lift up to 25 lbs. occasionally.

· Ability to operate a computer.

· Ability to process written, visual, and/or verbal information.

· Ability to operate basic office equipment and tools.

Company: Fortune USA Inc

Sales Engineer - Semiconductor Equipment

Job Description

We are seeking Account Sales - Semiconductor Equipment, to join our team, to be responsible for supporting customers in semiconductor fab and equipment industries.

Responsibility

Managing business development and supporting customers in semiconductor equipment or fabs. Responsibility including RFQ, development presentation, and local support, customer support engineer in supporting new product introduction (NPI) engineering projects in gas box, gaslines, vacuum chambers, valves, showerheads, ESC (e-chuck), ceramic, SiC, VMB (valve manifold box), machined parts, frames and assemblies.
Supporting customers from manufacturing sites in Fremont and in Asia. Interaction among internal factory, customer, and OEM/AVL suppliers.
Participate and lead manufacturability review, FMEA, defect analysis, corrective actions.
Initiate new product concept, present business case including cost, required resource, roadmap, competitive landscape, and return on investment.
Works with customers for on-site support of measurement, installation, form/fit/function resolution or reworks.

Qualifications

Must be goal, actions oriented.
Must have 5+ years of experience in semiconductor equipment companies, fab or sub-fab. Must have Class 1000 or Class 10000 cleanroom and lab work experience.
Must have Bachelor's, Master’s or PhD degree in mechanical engineering, material, or construction engineering.
Degree in MBA a plus
Experienced in at least one of following products: vacuum chambers, valves, showerheads, ESC (e-chuck), ceramic, silicon or SiC parts, gas box, gaslines, VMB (valve manifold box), machined parts, frames, assemblies used in semiconductor equipment or fabs.
Prefer prior working experiences in the following companies: Applied Materials (AMAT), Lam Research (LRCX), KLA, Micron, Intel, TSMC, Global Foundry, UCT, Ichor, FM Industries, NGK, Shinko, Kyocera, VAT, etc.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with a wide variety of internal and external customers.
At least 10% and up to 30% travel is required. Regular communication with Asia is expected.

Office Locations

Fremont, California. This is on-site position and partially remote from home workable. International travel maybe required.

Regarding Fortune USA Inc:

Fortune USA Inc, with facility in Fremont, California, is a subsidiary company of Fortune Precision Equipment Company in Shenyang, China and with functions of sales, manufacturing, customer support, product development and supply chain management.

Fortune Precision has equipped full in-house turnkey manufacturing solutions, including gas delivery systems, precision machining, sheet metal, welding, special surface treatment, high precision cleaning, serving semiconductor equipment industries. Fortune has five operation sites with total over 1,000,000 sq-ft manufacturing space, and over 1500 employees worldwide. Website: www.fortune-semi.com

Leonard Carder, LLP, based in Oakland, California, is looking for attorneys with 3-5+ years’ experience/interest in employee benefits law and a demonstrated commitment to the goals of workers’ rights and the labor movement. Ideal candidates should have ERISA experience and familiarity with multi-employer defined benefit pension plans, defined contribution plans and welfare benefit plans. Other specific experience with governmental plans, QDROs, subrogation and trust fund collections will be considered. In addition, strong research, writing and analytical skills, as well as the ability to work effectively with unions, multi-employer trust funds, and plan participants is essential.

The salary range for associate attorneys with at least three years of experience in employee benefits work is between $111,500 and $147,000 annually, depending on bar passage and experience. Associate attorneys are also eligible for loan repayment up to $4,000 per year and annual bonuses. Leonard Carder provides a comprehensive benefits package including health, dental, vision, life insurance, long-term disability insurance, and cell phone reimbursement. After one year of employment, associate attorneys are eligible for Leonard Carder’s 401k plan, with employer contributions.

To apply, submit a letter of interest, a resume, references, and writing sample(s) to Rosemary Prem by email to rprem@leonardcarder.com.

For more than 80 years, Leonard Carder has aided unions and workers involved in some of the most memorable labor struggles on the West Coast and has championed workers’ rights in precedent-setting litigation. We represent local and international labor unions and employee benefit plans, as well as representing employees in class actions, individual workers’ rights cases, and law reform litigation.

Leonard Carder is committed to social justice in our practice and diversity in our hiring, and encourage applications from attorneys of color, women, the LGBTQIA+ community, and individuals with disabilities. For more information about our work, please visit our website at www.leonardcarder.com.

Nitty Gritty Preschool is seeking a Preschool Teacher to create a nurturing environment and positive learning experience for children. We are a top-rated school dedicated to providing a nurturing and stimulating environment for our youngest learners to explore the world. Our program fosters learning and development of the whole child: physical, social, emotional and cognitive.

At Nitty Gritty, we believe in the power of play-based learning and provide a curriculum that encourages exploration, creativity, and critical thinking. Plus, you get to work with some amazing co-workers who share your passion for early childhood development!

Classroom and professional responsibility

Supervise and ensure the safety of children at all times. Be alert to the needs of children as individuals and as a group.
Work with the teaching team to set up and maintain the classroom. Keep classroom shelves, counters, storage areas, and bathrooms orderly and free of clutter.
Maintain punctual and consistent attendance.
Communicate with colleagues and administration professionally and respectfully.
Always keep developmentally appropriate practice in mind when planning for and communicating with children and families.
Represent Acton Academy Silicon Valley and the preschool professionally and positively on campus and off.
Be familiar with and follow all Preschool policies detailed in the employee and Parent Handbook.
Keep preschool administration informed of any special needs or concerns about individual children.
Fill out all required paperwork promptly. This includes but is not limited to accident reports, incident reports, and weekly curriculum calendars.
Communicate frequently with parents professionally and respectfully. Areas of concern about children should be discussed with a co-teacher, associate teacher, and director but communicated to the parent by a teacher.

Curriculum Responsibilities

Plan and implement an enriching curriculum for children as individuals and as a group.
Learn the Kimochis curriculum and weave its social language into daily communication with children.
Work with a co-teacher/teacher’s aide, if applicable. Plan and implement activities and projects that support multi-culture, holidays, and values.
Maintain snack menus, prepare daily snacks for children, and sit with them while they eat.
Conduct two individual parent/teacher conferences twice per year with each family.
Attend Back-to-School Night and school events and prepare to speak about AASV preschool’s philosophy, goals, and curriculum.
Attend all staff meetings, in-service training, classroom set-up/clean-up days, and team curriculum planning meetings.
Contribute to monthly parent newsletters.

Qualifications and Competencies

To be a fully qualified teacher, a teacher shall have one of the following:

Twelve postsecondary semester or equivalent quarter units in early childhood education or child development completed, with passing grades, at an accredited or approved college or university; and at least six months of work experience in a licensed child care center or comparable group child care program.
The units above shall include courses that cover the general areas of child growth and development, or human growth and development; child, family, and community, or child and family; and program/curriculum.
Experience shall be verified as having been performed satisfactorily, at least three hours per day for a minimum of 50 days in six months, as a paid or volunteer staff member under the supervision of a person who would qualify as a teacher or director under this chapter.
A current and valid Child Development Associate (CDA) credential with the appropriate age-level endorsement issued by the CDA National Credentialing Program of the Council for Early Childhood Professional Recognition; and at least six months of on-the-job training and/or work experience in a licensed child care center or comparable group child care program.
A CDA credential shall show the appropriate preschool or infant/ toddler age-level endorsement to qualify an individual for employment in a preschool or infant care center.
A CDA credential is valid for three years from the date of award. A renewal may be granted every five years thereafter upon approval by the CDA National Credentialing Program.
Experience shall be verified as having been performed satisfactorily, at least three hours per day for a minimum of 50 days in six months, as a paid or volunteer staff member under the supervision of a person who would qualify as a teacher or director under this chapter.
Individuals with a CDA credential may have also completed six months of work experience. This work experience shall be verified to confirm that the experience requirement has been met.
One of the following Child Development Permits issued by the California Commission on Teacher Credentialing:
Child Development Associate Teacher Permit; or
Child Development Teacher Permit; or
Child Development Master Teacher Permit.
Approved schools, colleges, or universities, including correspondence courses offered by the same, means those approved/authorized by the U.S.
A photocopy of the teacher's Child Development Permit as specified above, or a photocopy of the teacher's transcript(s) documenting successful completion of required course work, shall be maintained at the center.

Employment Requirements

Prior to employment or initial presence in the childcare center, Childcare Director must obtain.

1. Live scan fingerprints and California clearance or a criminal record exemption as required by law or Department regulations or request a transfer of a criminal record clearance or request and be approved

2. Health screening (signed by a doctor)

3. Negative TB test within the last year

Additional Required Certifications:

15 hours of health and safety training, which includes the following components:

1. Current pediatric first aid/pediatric cardiopulmonary resuscitation (CPR/first aide) card issued either by the American Red Cross or the American Heart Association or by a training program that the Emergency Medical Services have approved

2. Complete Preventative H and Safety in the Child Care Setting. Health practices courses or courses that include instruction in the recognition, management, and prevention of infectious diseases, including immunizations and prevention of childhood injuries, lead poisoning, and at least one hour of childhood nutrition training as part of the preventive health practices course or courses.

3. CCLD requires certification of Abuse Mandated Reporter Training. This three-hour training can be completed on the web at https://mandatedreporterca.com.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. The employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

JD:
FULL AND PART-TIME PEDIATRIC OCCUPATIONAL THERAPISTS NEEDED

Playsteps for Developing Kids is seeking motivated, enthusiastic, and experienced pediatric occupational therapists for a part time role in our vibrant and growing clinic.

Our Mission and Core Belief:

At Playsteps we believe that play is a child's primary occupation. We use a wide variety of play-centered therapeutic strategies to assist children in developing the skills they need to participate fully in all aspects of their daily lives. Located in the heart of downtown Menlo Park with two fully equipped gyms and two state of the art fine motor rooms, we aim to deliver the highest level of pediatric occupational therapy care available.

The Role:

We have positions available for both a part-time pediatric occupational therapists.
Working collaboratively with our experienced team of therapists (boasting over 50 years of pediatric experience), your days will involve the planning and delivery of fun, innovative and effective in-clinic treatment sessions for children between the ages of infancy and 12. Your work will never be dull or repetitive as our clients present with a variety of conditions and diagnoses, including general developmental delay, sensory integration and feeding concerns, ADHD, and autism, among others. Treatment is provided in our state of the art play-gyms and fine-motor rooms, purpose-built in 2022 to provide a modern and supportive treatment environment. Whether you take advantage of our cozy ball-pit, our massive rock-wall, our cool climbing gym or our wide variety of floor and hanging apparatus, your treatment options will only be limited by your imagination. At Playsteps we work as a collaborative team, so you will be able to mentor and be mentored as you work with your colleagues to provide the highest possible standard of care. Treatment can often go beyond the clinic to include school observations, home visits and tele-health sessions, as well as consultations with parents, teachers and other team support members. Therapists will also be responsible for client assessments, writing reports and treatment plans, and the production of all necessary documentation of treatment. While no one likes paperwork, you will be provided all the necessary tools, templates and support systems, as well as the necessary time to process this work efficiently and effectively. At the end of the day you will have the pleasure of being a member of a passionate, fun-loving, and cohesive therapy team dedicated to the on-going success and well-being of our clients, clinic, staff, and community. We look forward to your application!!

We Value:

High quality, evidence-based and client-centered care of the whole child, working in partnership with their family, school and entire support team
True collaboration between professionals, colleagues and clients
Respect for individuals, their ideas and opinions
Continual learning and up-skilling through a commitment to ongoing professional education
Work-life balance
Fair, equitable, and competitive compensation
Professionalism, initiative and a desire to grow both professionally and personally

Required Qualifications and Skills:

At least two years work experience in a pediatric occupational therapy setting required.
Degree in occupational therapy from an accredited college or university required.
Valid California licensure required.
NBCOT certification required.
AOTA membership preferred.
Strong assessment skills.
Able to authentically connect with children – absolutely imperative!
Able to build rapport with clients, their families, and other caregivers.
Able to work collaboratively as part of an inter-disciplinary team.
Proactive in the development of skills and programs.
Strong communicator, with proven report writing experience.
Fun-loving, enthusiastic, and creative

Pay and Benefits:

Compensation ranges from $50 to $70 per hour depending on skill level. Profit sharing bonus is available based on individual productivity.
PTO available to therapists billing more than 15 client sessions per week
Therapists are eligible to receive a Professional Development Stipend
Health Expenses Stipend available to therapists billing more than 15 client sessions per week
Therapists are eligible to participate in the company's 401k Program with a 3.5% Employer Match
Therapists are encouraged to participate in the company's coordinated mentorship program

Schedule:

Varies with client schedules, mainly weekday afternoons, opportunity to work Saturdays with bonus pay exists but is not obligatory
Part Time role is a minimum 2 days per week
Maximum treatment load is 6 direct client hours per day
Typical end time is 6:30 pm

POSITION TITLE: Therapist

JOB TYPE: Union, Regular, Full-Time, Salary Exempt, Benefited

PROGRAM(S): FACT, FSP-TAY, IFSP-TAY

REPORTING TO: Director and/or Designee

SUMMARY:

Since its founding as a teen drop-in center in 1972, Community Solutions (CS) has grown in both depth and breadth of services in response to the growing and changing needs in the community. As one of the most comprehensive nonprofit human services agencies in Santa Clara County and the surrounding areas, CS provides prevention, intervention, treatment, and residential services to more than 6,400 clients annually, helping them overcome the challenges posed by mental health issues, substance abuse, trauma, severe family dysfunction, sexual and domestic violence, and human trafficking.

Community Solutions has a compassionate, strengths-based, client-centered, and trauma-informed team and service delivery approach. Values of respect, integrity, excellence, compassion, celebration, initiative, and unity guide the organization’s culture.

As our Therapist, you will be responsible for utilizing clinical knowledge and judgment to provide treatment and rehabilitation services to individuals with mental illness, drug addiction, and/or victims of intimate partner abuse and their families. Services are provided throughout Santa Clara County and San Benito County.

This full-time opportunity is available for immediate hire within Santa Clara and Monterey Counties – California. Local candidates are highly preferred, as this opportunity requires a hybrid schedule and travel within a commutable distance to either to our Gilroy Headquarters, Morgan Hill or San Jose offices based upon proximity to the clients you will be serving.

The Ideal Candidate Will Possess the Following Qualifications and Knowledge:

Did you know that research shows that women and people from underrepresented groups often apply to jobs only if they meet 100% of the qualifications? Please understand that no one ever meets 100% of the capabilities. If much of this describes you, we encourage you to apply. This might be the right next role for you if you have:

Educational Qualifications: Master’s Degree in social work, psychology or related field plus one-year direct client experience working with mental health issues, drug and alcohol services, psychiatric services, intimate partner abuse issues and/or family systems. In collaboration with various County services, experience working with systems to meet requirements of the Agency and contracts.

License: Must be registered and in good standing with California Board of Behavioral Science (BBS) as a licensed Marriage Family Therapist Intern (MFTI), an Associate Clinical Social Worker (ASW) or eligible to register with the Board of Psychology as an Associate Psychologist (APSY) as a waivered therapist. Must apply for registration and waiver at time of hire, obtain waiver within four months of hire date and maintain registration and waiver.

Knowledge Of:

Required:

· Clinical knowledge and expertise within scope of practice in group, family and individual therapy.

· Treatment, rehabilitation and assessment techniques for victims/survivors of violence and their families, people with mental illness or substance abuse issues.

· Working knowledge of wellness and recovery concepts, Medi-Cal regulations and program documentation.

· Knowledge of multiple partner systems, case management, linkage-referral, and crisis intervention.

Preferred:

· Knowledge of strength-based client driven care consistency.

· Knowledge and/or certification in evidence-based practices and outcome driven care.

· Working knowledge of Santa Clara County and surrounding areas community resources.

Ability To:

· Maintain assigned case load, achieve productivity expectations and work within a program structure.

· Accurately apply Medi-Cal regulations and documentation requirements based on training and ensure audit ready charts.

· Maintain good strength based, problem solving and conflict resolution skills. Consistently applies good judgment.

· Provide strength-based, client driven and outcome driven care, based on use of assessment and outcome tools.

· Accurately assess clients’ needs and strengths.

· Engage clients in the treatment process.

What You'll Be Doing in the role of Therapist includes:

· Utilizes clinical best practices to conduct screening, intake and assessments to determine the client’s needs develop treatment goals. Promptly develops and/or implements individual and family treatment plans using Transformational Care Planning and is responsible for coordination of care to provide for the client’s stated needs and goals. Community based work to include home visits and school-based services.

· Performs intensive counseling services with clients and their families through individual, family and group therapy. Employs evidenced-based practices and the wellness & recovery model as appropriate to assist the client and identify issues of dual diagnosis, activities of daily living, employment, mental illness, physical illness, relationships, and housing which are impacting their mental health and successful recovery.

· Provides crisis intervention, counseling, advocacy, case management and referral services for assigned individuals and families.

· Completes detailed program documents in accordance with agency, program and regulatory requirements.

· Maintains all charts within Agency and/or Medi-Cal regulations.

· Teaches life skills, assists individuals and families with educational and support activities, accesses appropriate community services and rehabilitation counseling.

· Develops and maintains collaborative relationships with appropriate community organizations and system providers.

· Employee must have the ability to operate their personal or Agency motor vehicle to participate in client visits, provide daily transportation of clients and/or any other assigned Agency business.

· Frequent travel required.

· Responds to phone calls and emails within 24 hours on business days unless extenuating circumstance exist. Resolve outstanding issues collaboratively using strength-based solutions focused approach.

· Attends and participates in Agency meetings and contributes to continuous quality improvement activities to enhance team and program development.

· Consistently uses strength-based and solution focused problem-solving skills.

· Maintains good customer service skills with internal and external customers.

· Successfully completes all training requirements for this position to ensure agency and contract compliance.

· Participates in on-call and after hour’s rotation, as assigned. Flexible schedule may be required to work some evenings and weekends.

· Performs first aid as needed based on training and certification.

Shelter Facilities:

· For the Intimate Partner Abuse/Sexual Assault team, assesses clients’ needs to determine appropriate resources, including the referral to professional services without delay. Coordinates services with other advocacy programs and the legal system.

· For Intimate Partner Abuse/Sexual Assault team, advocates on behalf of the intimate partner abuse survivors with systems, institutions, agencies and at community meetings.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion:

Community Solutions is deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We are a team of dedicated professionals with backgrounds as diverse as the impact we achieve. We are committed to diversity in our workforce and equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

Working at Community Solutions:

Community Solutions offers a competitive starting pay rate of $3,015.81 per by-weekly pay period, equivalent of $78,411.06 annually, with additional supplemental earnings available based upon program which include second language skills, special certifications, and others. Additionally, our agency offers a generous employee benefits package and encourages a strong work-life balance. We believe in supporting the whole person by providing:

· 100% of premiums paid by employer for full-time employees and eligible dependent children

· 403(b) Retirement Plan with 5% employer match

· 3-weeks paid vacation to start

· 13 paid holidays; 96 sick hours per year (inclusive of self-care/mental health days)

· Longevity bonuses

· Generous family medical leave for eligible employees

· Student Loan Forgiveness Program

· Staff learning and development and robust in-house training opportunities

· Employee-led Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Resource Group

Physical Requirements:

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodation may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to both sit and stand for extended periods, talk and hear, and use office equipment; occasional need to lift and move objects up to 25lbs.

Work Environment and Location: Commutable distance to either our Gilroy Headquarters, Morgan Hill or San Jose offices based upon proximity to the clients to be served.

Special Requirements:

· License: Possess a valid California driver’s license, current car insurance and a good driving record as documented by a DMV report and consistent with the Agency’s liability insurance requirements.

· Requires an automobile to perform routine job duties.

· COVID-19 Vaccination: Please note that Community Solutions has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and clients. As a condition of employment, Community Solutions employees are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

What you'll do:

Provide direct services including individual sessions, group sessions, or push-in sessions as per the number of services specified on a Student’s Individualized Education Plan (IEP)
Offer consultation services, engaging with appropriate parties or members of the team (e.g., parents, teachers, educational specialists), in alignment with the number of services stipulated on a Student’s IEP on the current or future NPS caseload (or otherwise specified).
Administer, prepare, and complete all necessary assessments or evaluations for students
Maintain a detailed and regularly updated log of student services provided, documenting the date and the beginning and ending time of each service.
Attend and actively participate in IEP team meetings scheduled by the IEP team.
Regularly complete and report on student progress on a quarterly basis for all students on the current or future NPS caseload (or otherwise specified).
Correspond and maintain consistent contact with members of the IEP team based on student or case requirements. Maintain open lines of communication with NPS upon request, ensuring effective collaboration and coordination of services.

What You Bring:

Master’s degree in Occupational Therapy from an accredited program.
Valid state licensure or certification as an Occupational Therapist.
Previous experience in a clinical or educational setting preferred
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively interact with students, families, and other professionals
Strong leadership skills

Who You Are:

Mission-driven: You are dedicated to our mission and understand that providing excellent care to children with autism is at the core of everything we do.
Motivated: You take ownership of your projects and are driven to produce the highest quality work product. You meet deadlines and communicate roadblocks. You look for opportunities to add value.
Creative: You come up with original ideas to solve complex problems.
Collaborative: You thrive in a team environment. You love listening to feedback and incorporating other people's opinions into your ideas. You're willing to work beyond your stated role for the better of the team.
Compassionate: You care about people. You want others to succeed.

To apply for this position, please submit your resume detailing your relevant experience. We look forward to reviewing your application!

"As iron sharpens iron, so one person sharpens another" Proverbs 27:17

We understand our purpose is to help people heal. We use the career and business of Physical Therapy to accomplish this. The bonus is that we get to grow alongside our patients and fellow team members. This can change the world.

WHO WE ARE:

Kabat & Associates Physical Therapy was established in 2005 by PTs: Samuel Kabat and Jodi Kabat as a mission to create an atmosphere where patients could receive more than a standard Physical Therapy experience. The company tailors recovery so patients may:

Embrace a Pivotal Moment, Engage Their Greater Potential, and Enhance the World.

These concepts have become known as the "_E3 Challenge"_, that we strive to impart on both our patients and on our team.

The E3 Challenge:

Embrace a Pivotal Moment - Choose to seek growth in the face of adversity

Engage their Potential - Realize that all humans have untapped potential for greatness.

Enhance the World - Share that greatness with family, friends and the world.

WHAT SETS US APART:

Regarding pay and benefits, We try to stay comparable with industry standards. We even provide opportunities for business minded and motivated individuals to accelerate their income.

***Our edge is our mentorship with a Fellowship trained PT and a continuous learning environment. Each PT has the opportunity to hone their craft in communication, understanding and addressing personal obstacles, clinical application of motion analysis, manual therapy, exercise refinement, consideration of all body systems to treat a local complaint.

To better foster growth in our patients, we continue to invest in our therapists and support staff. Our treatment approach is a blend of evidence based care with a personal injection based on mentorship, experience, creativity and intuition.

We have a wide range of clinical interests beyond general treatment strategies, including:

- Residency Program

-New grad pathway to clinical excellence

-OCS pathway

- Community and global outreach

- IPA (Institute of Physical Art) and FMT (Functional Manual Therapy)

- PNF (Proprioceptive Neuromuscular Facilitation)

- PRI (Postural Restoration Institute)

- CSCS (Certified Strength and Conditioning Specialists)

- Global approaches and techniques to aide healing can include consideration of: musculo skeletal, fascial, motor control, Vestibular, Visceral/Vascular, neuro muscular, neuro/dural tension, Post-Concussion / Trauma, NOI -pain science, fielding emotional connections to physical issues, tailored education.

WHO WE SEEK:

We are seeking a Physical Therapist who:

-Wants to work in a setting directed by a Double Fellowship trained lead PT.

-Makes the best decision for the patient based on their individual needs.

-Seeks a deeper understanding of anatomical and functional systems to accomplish goals.

-Aims to join a collaborative and dynamic work environment

-Improves their skill set on a daily basis and avoids stagnation

-Embraces the value in continuing education and perfecting your craft

QUALIFICATIONS & COMPENSATION:

Salary / bonus: Competitive. $67,000 to $80,000+ with bonus, tuition contribution, and leadership opportunities warranting more.

Qualifications: Active CA PTA license

New Grad enhanced progression program

Experience: 0+ years

This is an opportunity to enhance the quality of life for many patients......... and yourself.

To the person who this posting speaks to, we're available.

Company: Hearts and Hands Post Acute Care & Rehab Center
JT: Occupational Therapist - In House Therapy Department, (FT or PRN)
JD:
Join the Hearts and Hands Post Acute and Rehab Center team in Santa Cruz, California!

We are looking for a Occupational Therapist, OT, to join our in-house therapy department. We offer reasonable and achievable productivity standards, flexible work hours, and a positive and cohesive therapy team.

Visit our website at: https://heartsnhands.us/

Here are some of the benefits of working at Hearts and Hands:

Reasonable and achievable productivity standards: We want you to be successful, so we set realistic expectations for our therapists.
Flexible work hours: We understand that you have a life outside of work, so we offer flexible work hours that fit your schedule.
Privately owned SNF: We are a privately owned SNF, which means we have more control over our policies and procedures. This allows us to create a more positive and supportive work environment for our therapists.
Optima software with laptops: We use the latest technology to provide our patients with the best possible care. You will have your own laptop and access to Optima software, which will make your job easier.
Easy going Administrator, DON and staff: Our administrator, DON, and staff are all easygoing and supportive. We create a positive work environment where everyone feels valued.
Energetic rehab team with very positive attitude: Our rehab team is energetic and passionate about their work. We are always looking for ways to improve our care and make a difference in our patients' lives.

As an in-house rehab team member, you will be an employee of the facility and as such, you will be able to attend all facility events, trainings and any other unified tasks directed by the facility administration. This will create a "One Team, One Goal" mentality for all facility staff, including the therapy team, regardless of their duties and all other involved parties.

If you are looking for a rewarding career in occupational therapy, we encourage you to apply to Hearts and Hands Post Acute and Rehab Center. We would love to have you on our team!

JOB SUMMARY

The Occupational Therapist works within their Ethical Scope of Practice at all times, follows all State and Federal laws pertaining to healthcare delivery; completes evaluations, treatments and documentation in a timely manner; works cooperatively with team members, all internal and external customers and strives to positively represent their discipline and their company in the community.

Job Duties:

Evaluations

Provide occupational therapy evaluations as ordered by a physician and obtain insurance verification/authorization before initiating the eval.
Complete evaluations within a timely manner of receiving the physicians order, or place a note in the chart stating reasons for delay in initiation of the eval.
Obtain a clarification order or physician signature per facility protocol.

Treatment

Provide treatment as ordered by a physician.
Ensure that insurance authorization has been obtained prior to treatment.
Provide treatment appropriate to eval findings and within the professional scope of practice and individual level of expertise.
Will report deviations from scheduled treatment minutes to Director of Rehab or Rehab Coordinator.
Update treatment plans as needed to meet desired outcomes.
Include staff and family caregiver training in treatment plans as appropriate.
Instruct Occupational Therapy Assistants in needed protocols of treatment for each patient.
Instruct rehab aides to carry out appropriate duties to support the provision of occupational therapy services.
Supervise Occupational Therapy Assistants as per scope of practice/licensure guidelines.
Communicate regularly and as needed to other team members and on-call therapists regarding patient care issues.
Ensure a discharge order is obtained at the conclusion of Occupational Therapy services unless the patient is discharged from the facility
Coordinate scheduling issues with team members and the staffing coordinator as needed.
Manage time and prioritize responsibilities to meet productivity expectations.
Will provide only such treatment as allowed by the OT Board. If not possessing advanced practice approval, will not provide swallowing evaluation or treatment, hand therapy or use physical agent modalities unless operating under the guidelines approved by the Board for working towards this approval.

Company: Mental Health Association of San Mateo County
JD:
This position is a temporary position, 6 months, with the possibility to extend to a permanent position.

The Mental Health Association of San Mateo County (MHA), a nonprofit organization, enriches quality of life, restores dignity, and reduces homelessness, particularly for those living with mental illness and other chronic health conditions. MHA strengthens hope by providing shelter, support, and opportunities for socialization. MHA participants live in shelters, agency-owned apartments, and scattered-site housing. Most participants are adults with serious mental illness, including individuals with co-occurring disorders. Many of the residents were previously homeless for many years and have limited experience in performing daily tasks.

The Occupational Therapist assesses, makes recommendations, and administers client centered interventions to clients directly, both individually and in groups, with the goal of living stably and independently in the community. The Occupational Therapist works within a client care team consisting of case managers and a nurse. In addition, Occupational Therapists may consult with partner agencies and other professionals including psychiatrists, care navigators, and peer counselors. The Occupational Therapist supervises graduate interns and practicum students. The Occupational Therapist works in collaboration with MHA Case Management Service Coordinators, under the supervision of the Executive Director. This position is full time.

Duties

Conduct client-specific assessments to evaluate functional independence including but not limited to the Executive Function Performance Test, Canadian Occupational Performance Measure, Kohlman Evaluation of Living Skills, etc.
Prepare and present reports and recommendations to the client’s designated team, including support needs and client-centered goals related to functional independence in daily living skills and maintaining housing in the community.
Consult with staff on designated team about client needs and progress.
Work with families and consults with professionals, including case managers, psychiatrists, and partner agencies.
Initiate individual and group activities that facilitate engagement and independence in daily living skills, such as safety, home management, budgeting, meal preparation, shopping, healthy routines, etc.
Develop Level I & II internship placements and supervise graduate interns and practicum students.
Complete daily documentation requirements.
Attend monthly staff meetings and weekly case management meetings.
Attend continuing educational programs provided by MHA.

General Agency Expectations

Treat all program participants with empathy, dignity, and respect.
Comply with all program and agency policies and guidelines when serving clients.
Develop and maintain good working relationships with all MHA employees.
Become familiar with other agencies and service providers in the county and develop good working relationships.
Maintain regular contact with supervisor. Communicate daily schedule and necessary information in a timely manner.
Participate in all-staff meetings, trainings, retreats, and other activities as requested. Participate in ongoing quality improvement activities.
Assume responsibility for other tasks as needed.

Qualifications

· Bachelor’s or Master's degree, with California state licensure in occupational therapy, and at least one year of post-Baccalaureate experience.

· Effective communication and interpersonal skills to cultivate a trusting relationship with clients. OT must be patient, supportive, and considerate.

· Experience supervising OT student interns a plus.

· Ability to work independently and interact with a variety of individuals.

· Be willing to work with a team.

· Pass a criminal justice background check upon hire.

· Have a valid CA driver’s license with a good driving record, a reliable car, and current automobile insurance. There is mileage reimbursement for travel.

JD:
DUTIES

Provide skilled occupational therapy service, on an intermittent basis, to patients, in their homes, in accordance with the physician's orders.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist the physician in evaluating the patient's level of function by applying diagnostic, and prognostic, procedures.

Conduct initial, and ongoing, comprehensive assessments of the patient’s needs, including Outcome and Assessment Information Set (OASIS) assessments.

Evaluate the patient's significant other(s), and the home situation, to determine what instruction will be required and what family assistance will be available, in caring for the patient, as well as what other Agency and community services will be required.

Ensure that the physician's orders are appropriate and discuss necessary changes.

Assist in development, and implementation, of the interdisciplinary patient care plan to include Occupational Therapy, in consultation with the physician.

Guide, and instruct, the patient in prescribed therapeutic self-care and creative activities that are directed toward improving independence and physical and mental functioning.

Instruct patient in care, and use, of wheelchairs, braces, splints, and prosthetic and orthotic devices.

Teach, supervise, and counsel the family, and patient, in the total Occupational Therapy program and other related problems of the patient, at home.

Establish goals, based on the patient's current level of functioning, and potential for improvement and performs re-evaluations, as indicated.

Makes arrangement for outpatient services when procedures are required that cannot be given in the home.

Evaluate the effectiveness of occupational therapy intervention and update the patient care plan, as needed.

Prepare clinical/progress notes, on the day of the visit, which are incorporated into the chart, within 72 hours.

Communicate with the physician, on a regular basis, regarding patient's status, obtaining additional orders, if necessary.

Communicate with other team members and, when appropriate, instruct them in Occupational Therapy techniques that they may use while working with the patient.

Supervise the Home Health Aide, per agency policy, when Occupational Therapy is the only professional discipline involved in the patient's care.

Supervise the Occupational Therapy Assistant, every 60 days, per Agency policy.

Participate in Agency activities, in-services, and meetings, when appropriate.

Confirm, on a weekly basis, the scheduling of visits with the Clinical Manager in order to coordinate Agency visits.

Participate with the staff, the patient, and the physician, in discharge activities and completes an Occupational Therapy Discharge Summary.

Assume responsibility for self-development by continually striving to improve his/her health care knowledge through educational programs, attendance at workshops and conferences, active participation in professional and related organizations, and individual research and reading.

American CareQuest, Inc. has been operating in the San Francisco Bay Area as a home care company since 2002.

We are not just a team of highly qualified clinicians but we are a family creating relationships based on respect, teamwork, and passion for caring for patients in need. We are looking for a committed and patient-focused Occupational Therapist to develop, recover or maintain the daily living and work skills of people with physical, mental, or developmental conditions.

Responsibilities

Improves or minimizes residual physical disabilities of the patient.
Returns the individual to optimum and productive living within the patient’s capabilities
Provides prescribed occupational therapy.
Apply interventions to maximize safety and performance in activities of daily living (ADL) and instrumental activities of daily living (IADL)
Teach clients new ways of approaching tasks and educate them on how to break down activities into achievable components
Assess client’s homes and other environments and advice on alterations consistent with their needs and capabilities
Recommend adaptive equipment and train in its use
Guide and educate family members and caregivers
Observe, note, and report on the progress of long and short term treatment goals
Collect data and document processes followed
Regularly follow-up client

Skills

Excellent knowledge of principles and practices of occupational therapy
Familiarity with ADLs evaluation tools ( e.g. Katz ADL scale, Lawton IADL scale)
Ability to manage patients with different types of personalities
Current knowledge of treatment practices per discipline.

Qualifications for the OT include but are not limited to:

Current California OT License
Current CPR/ BLS Certification
Valid Driver's License preferred
1 Year: Proven working experience as an occupational therapist preferred

Benefits of joining our Team:

Competitive compensation
Full-time health benefits paid 100% by employer; Dental/ Vision included, 401-K matching
Mileage reimbursement (according to the laws of California)
End of the Year Bonus
Monthly Employee rewards
Great office support and family like environment

Let's discuss the options of part-time or on-call work. If you are already employed as an Occupational Therapist and are just looking to supplement your current income, let's discuss the flexible and well-compensated opportunities here at American CareQuest.

Looking forward to reviewing your qualifications!

Position Summary

Perform basic supportive dental procedures under the supervision of a dentist; must be available to work Saturdays

Essential Functions/Responsibilities

General Supervision:

o Extra-oral duties or procedures specified by the supervising licensed dentist, provided that these duties or procedures meet the definition of a basic supportive procedure.

o Operate dental radiography equipment for oral radiography and have a radiographic safety certificate.

o Perform intraoral and extraoral photography.

Direct Supervision:

o Apply non-aerosol and non-caustic topical agents.

o Apply topical fluoride.

o Take intraoral impressions for all non-prosthodontic appliances.

o Place and remove rubber dams or other isolation devices.

o Place, wedge, and remove matrices for restorative procedures.

o Remove post-extraction dressings after inspection of the surgical site by the supervising licensed dentist.

o Cure restorative or orthodontic materials in operative site with a light-curing device.

Patient Care

o Manage patient flow to maximize patient access and service by ensuring dental exam rooms are adequately stocked and are ready for patients.

o Prepare patients for dental examination by taking and recording vital signs and medical/dental histories.

o Help patients feel comfortable before, during and after dental treatment

o Effectively communicate request from patients to dentist or dental care team members.

o Assist the dentist during a variety of treatment procedures such as taking dental x-rays.

o Clean, sterilize, and maintain an adequate supply of functioning instruments and equipment.

o Prepare instruments, materials and medication for use in dental procedures. o Instruct patients in oral hygiene and plaque control programs.

o Provide patients with instructions for oral care following surgery or other dental treatment procedures.

o Record treatment information in patient records using Electronic Dental Records system.

Commitment to Quality:

o Demonstrate a commitment to excellent patient experience and quality outcomes in equal measure.

o Communicate and work effectively with providers and other members of the dental care team to best serve patients. Contribute to a welcoming clinical space and healthy work environment through proactive relationship building, direct communication and sound judgment.

o Engaged participation in huddles, staff meetings, team building activities and assigned development opportunities. Continue your professional development through participation in educational opportunities.

o Adherence to all Dientes’ ethical and professional standards, including Dientes policies and procedures.

Company: Youth Service Bureaus of the YMCA of San Francisco
JT: Spanish Speaking Community Mental Health Therapist
JD:
Youth Service Bureaus of the YMCA of San Francisco

PROGRAM DESCRIPTION:
Our Community Mental Health Therapists provide school-based services and intensive services in our community of clients in San Francisco. Two-thirds of our referrals come from school campuses and services are provided on-site. A smaller fraction of our clients is referred to us by SF DPH, SF JPD, and Foster Care Mental Health. We pride ourselves at the Y in being a stellar training establishment and wonderful way to begin or further your mental health career. This job includes a combination of mental health consultation, direct therapeutic service provision, and referral linkages as necessary to other local programs.

Must be able to travel around the city to provide services in multiple school sites. Car or efficient use of public transportation is a must. Mileage reimbursement applied anytime there is more than one work site per day.

GENERAL DUTIES:

Direct Services

Serve as the referral source for school faculty, students, parents, administrators and community members regarding the emotional and behavioral issues of students that effect school functioning and could result in harm to self, harm to others, or school based violence.
Provide clinical assessments of all students referred.
Complete CANS assessments for all students seen 4 or more times.
Based on assessment, facilitate interventions, develop on-campus support plans, and make referrals to service providers.
Intervene in crises and safety incidents occurring at school in collaboration with school staff, including mediating fights, and preventing bullying and cyber-bullying. Assist with gathering of information for interventions as appropriate.
Provide case management services to students assessed as high moderate or severe level of risk, including violence potential and harm to self, as defined by the Violence Response Procedures for School Districts.
Identify students appropriate for psycho-social support groups on campus
Develop and maintain familiarity with best practices and professional literature on asset-based youth development, mental health interventions, and promoting safe schools and healthy environments.
Provide individual, family, and group counseling, crisis intervention, and case management in the community.
Communicate effectively with clinical team
Maintain confidential clinical charts
Timely service reporting
Provide appropriate referral resources to families
Track statistics concerning the type and amount of service provided

School Relationships and Collaboration

Position is dependent upon successful working relationship with school/funder. Employee is responsible for creating, developing and maintaining a positive working relationship with school administration.
Be a resource to faculty and staff about school safety issues at the school site level.
Participate in school-wide safety and anti-bullying efforts in collaboration with school staff.
Serve as a liaison for and meet regularly with parents, police, probation, mental health and other agencies on campus working to prevent violence.

DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Master’s degree in counseling, psychology, social work or a related field.
Registered MFT Associate or ASW / License as a MFT, LCSW or Psychologist required.
Spanish Language Fluency - Oral & Written
Willingness to travel throughout San Francisco County
Knowledge of and/or experience in utilizing crisis intervention techniques; Familiarity with San Francisco County community resources.
2+ years of work or volunteerism in social services.
Ability to work in a multidisciplinary team setting, establishing and maintaining effective working relationships
Ability to work with ethnically/racially diverse students/families.
Valid CA Driver’s license, working car, and ability to pass Livescan and TB clearance is required.
Knowledge of Microsoft Teams and Zoom.
YMCA approved CPR/First Aid Certification.
Clear TB test required.

YSB POLICIES:

Meet with program director and supervisors for programmatic and clinical supervision.
Collaborate with and provide guidance to any YSB staff and volunteers on campus.

Attend all YSB staff meetings and trainings as required.

Uphold YMCA policies for safety, supervision, mandated reporting and risk management.

All other duties as assigned by your supervisor.

Effect of End Result:

Clean and safe environment for members and employees
Compliance with Covid-19 safety protocols
Good communication between team members will result in the Mental health agency running smoothly
Professionalism will reflect well upon the YMCA of San Francisco’s Mental Health Agency.

The Bayview Hunters Point Adult Day Health Center is a licensed program that is designed to help seniors and people living with disabilities age in place in the community, and avoid premature placement in a skilled nursing facility. The Adult Day Health Center is licensed by the State Department of Public Health and certified as a MediCal provider with the California Department of Aging. The center provides social services, nutrition and nutritional services, therapies, including physical, occupational, speech and psychological services, as well as a variety of person-centered activities to address individual and group needs for socialization, memory, and physical movement in an inclusive atmosphere. The Occupational Therapist is part of a multidisciplinary team who provides assessment and treatment in response to the needs of participants at adult day health.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

1. Provide Occupational therapy assessments, treatment plan, and therapy interventions and routines for frail elders and adults with disabilities in a day health program

2. Oversee work of Rehabilitation Aide in the assistance of administering treatment routines

3. Document treatment plan and interventions in client database

EDUCATION/OTHER REQUIREMENTS

1. Graduate of an occupational therapy curriculum accredited jointly by the Council of Medical Education of the American Medical Association and the American Occupational Therapy Association (ACT) and registered by ACT

2. Experience working with an elder population and with a multidisciplinary team preferred

3. Strong and written communication skills in English

4. Computer literacy for documentation and reports

5. Effective organizational skills

6. Interest and ability to work in a diverse population of staff and clients

SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE, AND ABILITIES

1. Skill in assessing, monitoring, counseling and training

2. Must be able to maintain accurate records and write clear, concise and appropriate assessments and treatment plans

3. Must be able to work independently and use sound judgment

4. Flexibility, creativity and initiative necessary

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Occupational Therapist must be able to move around the facility as well as sit at a work station. Lifting up to 10 pounds occurs about half the time, while up to and above 25 pounds occurs occasionally

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, employee is regularly required to stand and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to walk, use hands to handle or feel; and reach forward with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit and stoop, kneel, or crouch. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

OTHER:

· Physical clearance

· TB clearance

· COVID-19 Full Vaccination and COVID-19 Booster required

Salary is competitive in a nonprofit environment; will earn sick and vacation time, and can qualify for health benefits, if working 30+ hours per week.

Company: Hearts and Hands Post Acute Care & Rehab Center
JT: Physical Therapist Assistant, (PTA) Full-Time, Part-Time, Per Diem
JD:
Join the Hearts and Hands Post Acute and Rehab Center team in Santa Cruz, California!

We are looking for a Physical Therapist Assistant, PTA, to join our in-house therapy department. We offer reasonable and achievable productivity standards, flexible work hours, and a positive and cohesive therapy team.

Visit our website at: https://heartsnhands.us/

Here are some of the benefits of working at Hearts and Hands:

Reasonable and achievable productivity standards: We want you to be successful, so we set realistic expectations for our therapists.
Flexible work hours: We understand that you have a life outside of work, so we offer flexible work hours that fit your schedule.
Privately owned SNF: We are a privately owned SNF, which means we have more control over our policies and procedures. This allows us to create a more positive and supportive work environment for our therapists.
Optima software with laptops: We use the latest technology to provide our patients with the best possible care. You will have your own laptop and access to Optima software, which will make your job easier.
Easy going Administrator, DON and staff: Our administrator, DON, and staff are all easygoing and supportive. We create a positive work environment where everyone feels valued.
Energetic rehab team with very positive attitude: Our rehab team is energetic and passionate about their work. We are always looking for ways to improve our care and make a difference in our patients' lives.

As an in-house rehab team member, you will be an employee of the facility and as such, you will be able to attend all facility events, trainings and any other unified tasks directed by the facility administration. This will create a "One Team, One Goal" mentality for all facility staff, including the therapy team, regardless of their duties and all other involved parties.

If you are looking for a rewarding career in physical therapy, we encourage you to apply to Hearts and Hands Post Acute and Rehab Center. We would love to have you on our team!

JOB SUMMARY

The Physical Therapist Assistant (PTA) works within their Ethical Scope of Practice at all times, follows all State and Federal laws pertaining to healthcare delivery; completes evaluations, treatments and documentation in a timely manner; works cooperatively with team members, all internal and external customers and strives to positively represent their discipline and their company in the community.

Job Duties:

Provide treatment following the Plan of Care as determined by the Physical Therapist and ordered by a physician.
Provide treatment appropriate to eval findings and within the professional scope of practice and individual level of expertise of the PTA.
Report deviations from scheduled treatment minutes to Director of Rehab or Rehab Coordinator.
Ensure that insurance authorization has been obtained prior to treatment.
Include staff and family caregiver training in treatment as appropriate.
Report patient progress and barriers to the supervising Physical Therapist (PT).
Consult regularly with the PT of record regarding patient response to treatment.
Consult with the supervising PT before treating any patient experiencing a change of condition.
Instruct rehab aides to carry out appropriate duties to support the provision of Physical therapy such as set up and cleanup activities.
Communicate regularly and as needed to other team members and on-call therapists re: patient care issues.
Coordinate scheduling issues with team members and the staffing coordinator as needed.
Manage time and prioritize responsibilities to meet productivity expectations.
Provide only such treatment as allowed by the PT Board and the level of experience and knowledge of the PTA.
Will not independently make a determination to discharge the Physical Therapy plan of care but may contribute information to assist the PT to make this determination.

Education:

The Physical Therapist Assistant must have graduated from accredited Associate level program of Physical Therapy accredited by the Commission on Accreditation in Physical Therapy Education (CAPTE) or a program if trained in a country other than the US.

Licensure:

A Physical Therapist Assistant must possess a current, valid PTA license or documentation from the PT Board of licensed applicant status. Any current disciplinary actions taken against that license must be reported to the supervisor and may result in loss of ability to work depending on the seriousness of the action.

· Provide accurate and timely documentation

The Physical Therapist Assistant employed through the organization provides physical therapy services under the direction of the physical therapist which may include but is not limited to:
