**Home Health Physical Therapist (PT) in San Francisco and San Mateo County **

Are you a dedicated and compassionate Physical Therapist looking for an exciting opportunity to provide exceptional care to patients in the comfort of their own homes? Look no further! We are currently seeking a skilled and motivated Home Health Physical Therapist to join our dynamic team in San Francisco and San Mateo counties. And San Mateo

**Company Description:**

At HomeAssist Home Health, we are committed to delivering high-quality, personalized healthcare services to our patients. Our organization specializes in providing comprehensive home health services to individuals of all ages, helping them achieve their optimal physical well-being. We pride ourselves on our compassionate and patient-centered approach, offering flexible schedules and a supportive work environment for our valued team members.

**Position Overview:**

As a Home Health Physical Therapist, you will be responsible for evaluating, developing, and implementing individualized treatment plans for patients in their homes. Your expertise will be essential in assisting patients in restoring their physical function, reducing pain, and maximizing their overall independence. You will work closely with a multidisciplinary team of healthcare professionals, providing invaluable guidance, support, and education to patients and their families.

**Job Responsibilities:**

- Conduct comprehensive assessments of patients' physical conditions and functional abilities in home settings.

- Develop individualized treatment plans and goals based on assessment findings and patient-specific needs.

- Provide evidence-based physical therapy interventions, exercises, and modalities to promote optimal recovery and independence.

- Monitor patient progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary, ensuring timely and effective interventions.

- Educate patients and their families on proper techniques, exercises, and strategies for self-management and injury prevention.

- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals, including physicians, nurses, and occupational therapists, to ensure coordinated and holistic patient care.

- Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of patient evaluations, treatment plans, progress notes, and outcomes.

- Adhere to professional standards, ethics, and regulations, maintaining confidentiality and respecting patients' rights and dignity.

**Qualifications:**

- Valid and active license as a Physical Therapist in the state of California.

- Minimum of 2 years of experience as a Physical Therapist, preferably in a home health or related setting.

- Strong clinical skills and expertise in assessing and treating a wide range of musculoskeletal and neurological conditions.

- Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to establish rapport with patients, families, and healthcare professionals.

- Self-motivated and capable of working independently, managing a caseload effectively.

- Reliable transportation and willingness to travel to patients' homes throughout the San Francisco area.

- Proficient computer skills and familiarity with electronic health records (EHR) systems.

**Benefits:**

- Competitive salary commensurate with experience.

- Comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, and vision insurance.

- 401(k) retirement plan with company matching.

- Generous paid time off and holiday schedule.

- Continuing education and professional development opportunities.

- Supportive and collaborative work environment.

If you are passionate about making a positive impact on patients' lives and thrive in a home health setting, we want to hear from you! Join our team of dedicated professionals and contribute to the well-being of the San Francisco community. To apply, please submit your resume, cover letter, and professional references to [email address] or through our online application portal at [website URL].

HomeAssist Home Health is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

**Note:** Only a short list candidates will be contacted for interviews. Thank you for your understanding.

We are privately owned CHAP Accredited Home Health Agency, based in San Jose, California. We currently provide home health care to paients in Santa Clara county, San Mateo County and San Benito county, with plans to expland our service area.

Our founders include seasoned nurses, healthcare administrators and other professionals in the post-acute industry with experience in providing patient-centric care.

We provide exceptional, individualized home healthcare to improve their overall wellness in the comfort of their homes.

Our work environment includes:

Open supportive culture with a vision to provide transformative care to those we serve
Professional level care in a fun environment
Collaborative
Culture of openness and safety

PLEASE NOTE: This is our per visit/case rate.

Our need is for Santa Clara County focusing on Northern Areas (Palo Alto, Mountain View, Cupertino, Sunnyvale, Los Altos) as well as San Jose and surrounding cities and Beyond!

Duties:
- Evaluate and assess patients' physical conditions and develop individualized treatment plans
- Provide hands-on therapy, including exercises, stretches, and manual techniques
- Educate patients on proper techniques for exercises and activities to improve their condition
- Monitor and document patients' progress and adjust treatment plans as necessary
- Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to coordinate patient care
- Stay up-to-date with the latest research and advancements in physical therapy

Experience:
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Physical Therapy
- Valid state license to practice as a Physical Therapist
- Strong knowledge of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology
- Experience in a hospital or acute care setting is preferred
- Specialized training or experience in trigger point therapy or pediatrics is a plus

As a Physical Therapist, you will play a crucial role in helping patients recover from injuries, manage chronic conditions, and improve their overall physical well-being. You will work closely with patients to develop personalized treatment plans and provide hands-on therapy to help them regain strength, mobility, and function.

In this role, you will need a strong understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology to effectively assess patients' conditions and develop appropriate treatment plans. Experience in a hospital or acute care setting is preferred as it will allow you to work with a diverse range of patients with varying needs.

OUR COMMUNITY:

We are committed to providing the best assistance to the population we serve, and our communities, achieving optimum health, and enjoying the best quality of life possible. We bring together a variety of experts and dedicated professionals to work with each resident in achieving their goals. We take great efforts to be leaders in the skilled nursing community.

A Nursing Assistant, or a Nursing Aide, provides healthcare and support to patients in a medical facility. Their main duties include offering basic physical assistance to patients, feeding patients according to their dietary needs, and recording vital signs. Other daily tasks are the following:

Help patients use the bathroom
Clean and bathe patients or residents
Maintain patients’ hygiene and changed bedding
Turn, reposition, and move patients between wheelchairs, seats, and beds
Serve meals and help patients eat their food
Measure vital signs like blood pressure and temperature
Listen to patients regarding any health concerns they might have and report details to a Registered Nurse or Doctor

Nursing Assistant has several duties and responsibilities that they learn through studies and experience. We are looking for someone who is passionate about the healthcare field and willing to learn.

Must have High School Diploma or GED

Defy the status quo.

Join the team that's setting a new standard for women’s health.

About Us

We're working to raise the standard of care for women and all individuals with vaginal anatomy and to make the highest quality pelvic floor physical therapy as accessible as possible.

Better Together

Beyond flexible schedules and a host of benefits, the best part about working at Origin is having the support of team members who are all passionate about helping patients thrive through major life transitions — and helping each other learn, grow, and feel their best at work, day in and day out.

Our Heart & Hands

We're working to raise the standard of care for women and all individuals with vaginal anatomy, and to make the highest quality pelvic floor physical therapy as accessible as possible.

Every member of our team is critical to this mission, but physical therapists are our heart and hands. We strive to empower each clinician with what they need to succeed, from training and 1:1 mentorship to a safe environment where everyone's voice is heard.

Learn & Grow with Us

Individual Mentorship Get matched with a clinical mentor and use your dedicated mentorship hours to ask questions, practice new skills, and collaborate on challenging cases.

Passion Projects Engage in self-directed professional development projects. Pursue your passions and contribute to our mission in ways that bring you joy.

In-Depth Learning Attend virtual learning & development sessions to gain new skills, expand and deepen your clinical knowledge, and grow your confidence as a PT.

Our Team Values

Own It. We show up with our best work. We're creative, focused, proactive, and get the details right.

Go Big. We have a big vision for women's health and are energized by our potential impact. We act with urgency, yet remember it's a long game.

Stretch. Growth can be uncomfortable and progress isn't always linear. We create a safe space for honest learning, taking risks, and understanding failure.

Be Generous. We're kind, high integrity, and assume the best. We celebrate wins and build each other up.

Role

We are expanding our practice and are looking to invite several full-time and part-time Physical Therapists to join our team in Brentwood, CA. This is an excellent opportunity to learn and grow in the specialty of women's/pelvic health and to work in a collaborative environment that is actively working to blend pelvic health and orthopedic specialties. At Origin, you will be working in a positive, welcoming environment specializing in pre - and postnatal care, as well as female pelvic floor dysfunction and associated orthopedic issues. We treat a variety of obstetric and gynecologic conditions, female pelvic floor dysfunction, and general outpatient orthopedics.

Benefits

At Origin, not only do we want our patients to feel their best - but our employees as well. We believe in both working and resting with intention. The wellbeing of our community is a top priority for us and we aim to create a workplace that fosters positive mental health and growth, both personally and professionally.

Our full-time benefits include:

Healthcare insurance with generous contributions (Medical, Dental, Vision)
Paid Maternity Leave
PTO + Paid Holidays
401k with matching
Opportunities to speak, write, and advocate for women’s health in the local and national community
Incredible Client Experience and Operations team, credentialing, technology-enabled workflows
Learning, development and mentorship opportunities
Origin Physical Therapy Stipend

Requirements

What You’ll Need

Licensed Physical Therapist (DPT or MPT) in California with 2+ years of experience (new grads with clinical rotations in women’s health or orthopedic rotations and a strong passion for women’s/pelvic health will be considered)

Individuals who are passionate about women’s/pelvic health and are committed to evidence-based approaches

Access Therapy is in need of driven and dedicated Physical Therapists (PTs) for home health to provide excellent home care solutions to individuals of adult ages. Our PTs are highly-educated and experienced in Geriatric and Home health cases who work with your patients to reduce pain, improve or restore mobility and balance recovering from surgery or hospitalization. The main PT goal is to reach your patient’s prior level of function and/ or safe independence at home.

Responsibilities:

Assessment and evaluation of patient care needs related to getting patients back in motion with exercises, massage, and other techniques, and other physical therapy needs as defined by medical conditions.
Helps to determine a treatment plan, performs interventions aimed at improving and enhancing the patient's well-being, and charts and monitors the patient’s progress.
Implement and adjust patient treatment plans as needed.
Communicate with patients, caregivers, and their families regarding the patient's progress.
Create a clean and safe environment for patients.

Skills:

Candidate must have knowledge of physical therapy methods, theories and principles in the application, as such, in a rehabilitation setting.
Must possess profound skills in providing various treatments.
Communication skills in both written and oral form must be exceptional.
Must be very good in preparing records, and in maintaining them with accuracy and discretion.
Has the ability to recognize when certain patient protocols need to be modified, to meet the patients' appropriate needs, and reports it dutifully.

Qualifications:

Bilingual a plus, but not a requirement
Completion of a Physical Therapy curriculum approved by The American Physical Therapy Association, The Council on Medical Education and Hospitals of the American Medical Association, or The Council on Medical Education of the American Medical Association.
Physical Therapy license and registration by the state of agency of practice.

What we have in store for you:

Above-average compensation
Flexible schedules
Dynamic caseload and treatment settings

Please note, the salary listed is for full-time employees. We do have part-time openings as well, with the pay being based on an hourly rate.

Thank you for your interest in joining our team!

Child's Play Therapy Services, PC, is an award-winning multidisciplinary pediatric clinic with locations in Lafayette and Pleasanton. Our state-of-the-art facility provides occupational, speech therapy, and feeding therapy to children from birth to adolescence. We are dedicated to helping children build the skills needed for successful relationships and a positive sense of self.

An important part of our mission is to offer a warm and supportive work family for our team. We do this through mentoring, clinical education, cross discipline collaboration and training, as well as planned social gatherings for team building, and play! We take pride in the collaborative and supportive culture at Child's Play.

At Child's Play you can resource our team of SLP's daily, allowing you to tap into speech professionals with years of experience and a variety of specializations. Additionally, you will have the opportunity to learn from the team of OT's through co-treats and staff development days. Our entire team is committed to providing you the most comprehensive pediatric experience that will develop your clinical competency and launch you confidently into your career.

We provide treatment for children with a range of diagnoses, including speech and language disorders, pragmatic language disorders, Autism Spectrum Disorder, developmental delays, fluency disorders, articulation and phonological disorders.

Join our mission in providing the highest quality therapy in an environment of fun, love, and acceptance!

Duties:

Provide direct patient care
Conduct assessments
Complete clinical documentation including daily notes, progress notes and discharge reports
Provide parent coaching, training, and support as needed
Conduct care coordination with ABA providers as needed
Participate in co-treatments with OT's

Minimum Requirements:

Master’s Degree or equivalent Speech-Language Pathology from an accredited educational institution
Must have a Speech-Language Pathologist license (RPE) in the State of California
Proof of immunization records and TB required
CPR certification

Benefits include:

medical, dental, vision
PTO
401K matching and discretionary profit sharing
flexible spending account
alternative work schedule
